Supporting over 1,400 customers in 33 countries, Strada partners with customers at every stage of their journey, to help drive their vision forward. It’s why we’re so driven to connect passion with purpose. Our team’s experience in human insights and cloud technology gives companies and employees around the world the ability to power confident decisions, for life. With a comprehensive total rewards package, continuing education and training, and tremendous potential with a growing global organization, Strada is the perfect place to put your passion to work. To learn more about us, visit stradaglobal.com We are seeking a skilled and motivated Product Owner to join our software product team focused on delivering a high-performance payroll calculation engine. In this role, you will act as the bridge between business stakeholders and the development team, ensuring that product features are well-defined, prioritized, and aligned with customer and business needs. You will play a key role in shaping the product roadmap and delivering high-quality, compliant, and scalable payroll solutions. Key Responsibilities Backlog Ownership: Define and maintain a well-prioritized product backlog that reflects business priorities and customer needs. Write clear and actionable user stories with acceptance criteria, especially for complex payroll logic and compliance requirements. Ensure backlog items are ready for development through regular refinement sessions. Agile Delivery: Collaborate with the development team during sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and reviews to ensure successful delivery of features. Accept completed stories based on defined acceptance criteria and quality standards. Continuously gather feedback and adjust backlog priorities accordingly. Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Payroll SMEs to understand evolving requirements. Translate complex payroll rules and calculations into functional requirements for the development team. Communicate progress, risks, and dependencies to stakeholders in a transparent and timely manner. Customer-Centric Focus: Advocate for the end-user experience and ensure the product delivers real value to payroll administrators and employees. Support user acceptance testing and gather feedback to inform future iterations. Continuous Improvement: Participate in retrospectives and contribute to the team’s ongoing improvement in Agile practices and product quality. Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, HR/Payroll, or a related Benefits We offer programs and plans for a healthy mind, body, wallet and life because it’s important our benefits care for the whole person. Options include a variety of health coverage options, wellbeing and support programs, retirement, vacation and sick leave, maternity, paternity & adoption leave, continuing education and training as well as a number of voluntary benefit options. By applying for a position with Strada, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Strada’s employment policies. Background checks may include some or all the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position. Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion Strada is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We celebrate differences and believe in fostering an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and supported. We know that diverse teams are stronger, more innovative, and more successful. At Strada, we welcome and embrace all individuals, regardless of their background, and are dedicated to creating a culture that enables every employee to thrive. Join us in building a brighter, more inclusive future. Diversity Policy Statement Strada is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against anyone based on sex, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital or domestic partner status, citizenship, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristics or conduct covered by federal, state or local law. In addition, we take affirmative action to employ and advance in the employment of qualified minorities, women, disabled persons, disabled veterans and other covered veterans. Strada provides reasonable accommodations to the known limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants for employment with disabilities and sincerely held religious beliefs, practices and observances, unless doing so would result in undue hardship. Applicants for employment may request a reasonable accommodation/modification by contacting his/her recruiter. Authorization to work in the Employing Country Applicants for employment in the country in which they are applying (Employing Country) must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the Employing Country and with Strada. Note, this job description does not restrict management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this job to other entities; including but not limited to subsidiaries, partners, or purchasers of Strada business units. We offer you a competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization. Disclaimer Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities of this job to other entities; including but not limited to subsidiaries, partners, or purchasers of Strada business units.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job In a nutshell 🥜 Wikifarmer is on a mission to empower farmers globally by providing education and direct access to the open market at fair prices. As our product evolves to meet growing demand, we’re looking for a Product Manager to take full ownership of a key area of our platform. As part of our lean and fast-moving product team, you’ll be directly responsible for unlocking value in a key product vertical by improving user experience, increasing delivery velocity, and supporting the company’s ability to scale. This is a high-impact role where product thinking meets real-world outcomes. You’ll work cross-functionally, own your roadmap, and build features that drive outcomes for users across the agriculture value chain. What You’ll Be Doing Own a product area: take ownership of a core product vertical or business challenge; define and prioritize opportunities, lead roadmap execution. User-centric discovery: proactively engage with users and stakeholders; synthesize qualitative and quantitative insights into actionable product improvements. Drive execution and delivery: Work closely with design, engineering, and data to build and ship valuable features at pace; remove blockers and resolve dependencies. Make data-driven decisions: define and track metrics for success; use experiment results and user feedback to iterate quickly. Promote team collaboration: foster a culture of transparency and partnership across squads; influence without formal authority. Champion continuous learning: stay up-to-date with AI, agri-tech, and product management best practices; champion learning mindset and experimentation. What You’ll Bring To The Table Work proficiency in English with strong written and spoken communication skills At least 3+ years of product management experience, with a strong track record of leading digital products end-to-end, and aligning cross-functional teams along the way Strong user empathy and a proven experience solving real customer problems through thoughtful discovery, testing, and iteration Cross-functional collaboration in remote-first teams (engineering, design, commercial) A curious, growth-oriented mindset - comfortable with ambiguity and eager to explore new domains through research and rapid experimentation Experience prototyping with AI, either in a professional or personal capacity, demonstrating the ability to test and apply AI tools in practical, user-focused ways Bonus points if you bring... Experience in agri-tech, food systems, marketplaces (B2B or B2C), or supply chain ops Prior experience in a startup or scale-up environment Passion for emerging tech - AI, automation, or data products A process-driven mindset: you enjoy building or improving workflows, analytics, or discovery practices Multilingual or experienced in designing for global users What we can offer: A competitive fixed salary of €50-73k based on experience Private medical insurance for you and your family 24 days of annual leave (plus national holidays) A collaborative team that values initiative, innovation, and ownership Real impact - your work will directly affect customer success and operational excellence Wikifarmer is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. We are actively working to create a workplace where everyone feels they belong and can thrive. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Product Designer
description: About the job This is a fully remote role, but you’ll need to be based in Europe. What we’re building at Xata: We're building a database platform for companies that rely on PostgreSQL at scale. And by “at scale,” we don’t just mean large volumes of data or high server counts, we also mean growing teams and the operational complexity that comes with them: staging and developer branches with data, data anonymization and privacy, zero-downtime schema changes, and more. In every feature we build, we optimise for developer experience, high performance, and flexibility. This gives our customers the confidence to rely on us for one of the most critical pieces of their cloud infrastructure. The AI wave of developer tools presents exciting opportunities and challenges - and PostgreSQL and Xata are well-positioned to be at the center of it. We’re a transparent company, maintaining several popular open-source projects, and we enjoy writing technical blog posts about how we solve various challenges. What you’ll be doing: You’ll be joining our Product team as a design engineer, working closely with the frontend engineering team. You’ll be responsible for the overall product UX, DX, and visual design. This includes defining design guidelines, creating shared styles and components, and ensuring consistency across the product and public website. At implementation time, you’ll contribute directly to the codebase or pair with frontend engineers. Our design process typically starts with simple wireframes and moves straight into coded prototypes (we usually skip high-fidelity mockups in Figma). We work with: Next.js Shadcn Tailwind v4 React flow Whimsical Figma v0 In this role, you will: Be an active contributor to our core product and public website. Collaborate in multifunctional project teams (with frontend engineers, marketing, and PMs) to create new features or improve existing ones - optionally leading such projects. About you: You have a sharp eye for aesthetics. Experience with developer tools is a big plus. You’re a self-starter who takes responsibility. You’re comfortable working with design systems (preferably based on Shadcn and Tailwind). You have at least a basic knowledge of React. You’re open to leveraging AI tools like v0 to speed up development. You have strong CSS skills. You're comfortable working with Git and GitHub. Nice to haves: Solid engineering skills - coding expertise is a big plus. Familiarity with APIs, HTML, CSS, JavaScript (React), and accessibility (A11y) is a bonus. Basic data visualisation skills (e.g. knowing what type of chart best represents data). Any experience with databases (MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB) - maybe you've built something with one. Experience working on open-source projects. Interest in the startup world - you’re a shipper! Basic illustration skills (we do everything in Figma - no Illustrator or complex vector tools). Working at Xata: We’re stable. We’ve raised $35M and have years of runway. We're remote-first, with a team distributed around the world, mainly in Europe and on the East Coast of the USA. Be part of a healthy culture, one that genuinely supports innovation, empowers individuals, and cares deeply about its people. We work asynchronously. We don’t do agile. The team meets weekly to check in, and we use GitHub, Notion, and Slack to stay aligned. You'll have autonomy to lead features and projects and bring your ideas to the table. Our team is diverse. Xata is female-founded and the first developer platform with an all-female board of directors. We encourage conference meet-ups. What we offer all of our employees: Competitive salary and stock options. Friendly, diverse, and inclusive work environment. 30 vacation days (not including local public holidays). 2 months of fully paid parental leave. Flexibility, autonomy, and real impact. Budget for home office setup + coworking space stipend. Continuous learning support - budget for conferences, courses, and books. Healthcare coverage. Two company offsites per year, with partners and kids welcome. So far, we’ve been to Italy, Greece, Spain, Portugal, and Iceland! Ample opportunity for career growth - there are no boundaries to your development at Xata. Our investors: Xata is well-financed by amazing investors, including Guillermo Rauch (founder of Vercel), Shay Banon (co-founder and CEO of Elastic), Neha Narkhede (founder of Confluent), Elad Gil, Christian Bach, and Mathias Biilmann (founders of Netlify), and many others. We’ve raised a $30 million Series A from top investors (Index Ventures and Redpoint), having the first ever 100% female board for such a technical company. We care about diversity in tech: If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply. We believe that our success is driven by the talented and diverse team we’ve brought together from a variety of backgrounds, cultures, and countries. We’re always challenging ourselves to build an inclusive culture that enables us to create innovative and successful products. Our founder, Monica Sarbu, also founded a non-profit organisation called Tupu, which helps tech companies support diversity in tech through mentorship. We're eager to hear from you, and if you decide to apply, we're rooting for you! How To Apply If this role sounds like a fit, we’d love to hear from you! When applying, please include a link to your personal website or portfolio, along with your GitHub profile. Or, anywhere else we can see examples of your work that blend design and code.

title: Jr Market Researcher
description: About the job What will you do? Our team seeks a Junior Market Researcher with the skills and curiosity to assist the revenue team in conducting market research on potential client accounts and keeping our CRM's data clean and updated. Gathering data on potential client accounts Cleaning and maintaining the CRM data updated Supporting Revenue Operations. Conduct market research related to target industries. Requirements: Based in Europe (living in Europe, preferably in Spain). Fluent English is a must. A second European language is a massive plus. Hungry and ambitious, yet humble. Able to work as an individual contributor, but bearing in mind you are part of a team. Customer-centric mindset. Nice to have: Previous experience with SaaS products. Startup experience. Knowledge of Salesforce or similar. Información adicional About Hubtype Hubtype is building tools that help companies communicate with their customers on messaging apps like Whatsapp or Telegram. Some of the largest companies in Europe (like EPSON, Levi's, Volkswagen, or Allianz) use our products to attend millions of customers every month. Our mission is to create better business-consumer relationships by embracing simple, meaningful, and customer-centric communication. We are growing fast and we're in a unique position to become the leaders in the EU conversational apps space thanks to our award-winning, open-source chatbot technology, and exclusive partnerships.

title: Product Designer
description: About the job About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day. As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role We approach Design at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We love building great products. We love delighting our customers. We love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution that truly solves customer needs. Our Design team knows how to get a holistic view of the customer experience. We're looking for a Product Designer to lead the design process from discovery to delivery, always keeping in mind our customers and their interests. Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch. What You’ll Be Doing Partnering with Product Owners, Engineers, Data Scientists, etc. to define customers’ and the business’ problems Identifying key metrics for the projects and taking ownership for achieving their success Researching and bringing forward new findings and learnings for reaching complex company goals, such as launching in new territories and offering new features Designing products that solve problems in a simple and elegant way while taking care of every small detail, from wire-framing to designing end-to-end flows and prototypes Running guerrilla and customer testing workshops Implementing solutions with the Technical team and presenting actions during design reviews Reviewing release performance, identifying learnings, and finding ways to enhance it What You'll Need 3+ years of experience in designing world-class complex commercial apps in-house A portfolio featuring examples of product design work Impressive design skills across iOS, Android, and web platforms The ability to think at a high level about product strategy and articulate design decisions The ability to understand technical implications in their design decisions The ability to take ownership of design process and work as self-directed member of the development team High UX focus and understanding of human behaviour Clean visual design sense Skills in typography and grids A love for problem-solving and to be challenged Nice to have A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science or related technical field Experience programming and the ability to code simple prototypes Experience designing and maintaining cross-platform design systems Experience working in fast-paced start-up environment Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. Important notice for candidates: Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles. Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain. We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately. By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

title: Digital Product Designer (Ux/Ui)
location: Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Canary Islands, Spain
description: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More ¿Te imaginas diseñar productos con impacto real, IA de fondo y un equipo que no necesita subtítulos para entenderse? Entonces esta oferta es para ti. En Diverger no diseñamos solo pantallas bonitas. Diseñamos con propósito, con lógica de negocio, con inteligencia artificial (y a veces con memes, porque también somos human@s). Somos una empresa de desarrollo de software con más de 100 personas apasionadas por transformar el desarrollo digital. Creamos productos donde la IA no es humo, sino herramienta. Trabajamos en proyectos de larga duración para clientes top en España y Europa. ¿Sectores? Banca, retail, telco, salud… ¡y mucho más! ¿Qué buscamos ahora? Un@ Product Designer con experiencia, mirada estratégica y buen gusto (sí, lo sabemos cuando lo vemos). Es para un proyecto de largo recorrido en uno de nuestros clientes más potentes, donde vas a diseñar con libertad, colaborar con equipos tech y de producto, y construir soluciones elegantes y escalables.¿Te suena bien? Entonces sigue leyendo?? Esto no es un brief más (aunque vendrán unos cuantos) Diseñarás interfaces web y mobile limpias, intuitivas y bellas (sin pasarte con los gradients, eso sí). Participarás activamente en procesos de investigación, definición y validación con usuario. Crearás y evolucionarás sistemas de diseño y patrones reutilizables con consistencia. Colaborarás estrechamente con personas de desarrollo, producto y negocio. Prototiparás como si estuvieras enseñándole magia a tu futuro tú. Aportarás visión crítica y estratégica para entender cómo se traduce la necesidad del negocio en decisiones de diseño reales. Presentarás propuestas con seguridad y claridad (y con slides que no duelan a la vista). El toolkit que te hará encajar como componente en Figma Figma (imprescindible que lo domines con soltura) Prototipado interactivo (sí, queremos ver cómo cobra vida tu diseño) Diseño Responsive + Mobile First (de verdad, no solo que se "vea bien") HTML/CSS (nivel lectura y empatía con devs) Principios sólidos de diseño visual: tipografía, color, espaciado, jerarquía (indispensable) Conocimiento en procesos de diseño UX end-to-end (muy valorado) Webflow, After Effects, Cinema 4D… también nos gustan, pero son opcionales Para aplicar, necesitamos tu portafolio. Queremos Ver Proyectos reales, no solo Dribbble shots o rediseños ficticios. Claridad en el problema, la solución, el proceso. Coherencia visual, lógica de negocio, escalabilidad y creatividad. Y si encima lo maquetas con mimo, sin faltas y con buenas imágenes… te hacemos la ola virtual ?? Beneficios Retribución flexible (comida, transporte, guardería y más) 23 días + 24 y 31 de diciembre OFF Jornada intensiva en verano (julio y agosto) Formación top (Udemy, Frontend Masters, Google/Microsoft certs…) Red de apoyo técnico y humano (mentoría, people, comunidades) Comunidad IA activa, con acceso a todo lo último y debate jugoso Plan de carrera + feedback real en 1to1s periódicos 100% remoto (y oficinas en Madrid y Coruña por si te apetece pasar) Flexibilidad horaria real (y comunicación sin dramas) Transparencia sin jerga (all-hands, updates y dinámicas con sentido) Súmate a Diverger, donde tus diseños y tus memes serán igual de bien recibidos En Diverger respiramos un entorno diverso y en el que todas las personas tengan igualdad de condiciones. Crecemos por nuestro compromiso, nuestra exigencia y nuestra pasión por lo que hacemos sin importar la mochila con la que viajemos. Porque no entendemos estas prácticas solo como principios, sino como la inercia de nuestra cultura día a día. Nos aseguramos de crear un entorno en el que cada persona se sienta respetada, orgullosa y valorada por ser quien es y como es. DIVERGER Thinking S.L, en cumplimiento del artículo 13 del RGPD, le solicita su consentimiento para el tratamiento de sus datos personales, con la finalidad de incluirle en nuestros procesos de selección de personal. El tratamiento se encuentra legitimado en base a su consentimiento expreso (art 6.1.a) RGPD), que presta mediante su postulación a la candidatura de empleo. En determinados casos, podrá ser necesario comunicar sus datos personales a nuestro cliente para que valore su candidatura. Sus datos personales serán conservados durante el plazo de 1 año desde la finalización del proceso de selección. Puede ejercer sus derechos de acceso, rectificación, supresión, oposición, limitación, portabilidad y a no ser objeto de decisiones automatizadas en ******. Le informamos igualmente, de que tiene derecho a presentar una reclamación ante la AEPD en caso de considerarlo oportuno.

title: Product Owner
description: About the job The Story so far: Who we are Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, we have experienced rapid growth with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Madrid, and Valencia. Our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers. The Main Event: What you'll do As a Product Owner at Huspy, you'll be at the heart of driving innovation and growth. You will: Own your product: From idea to launch and beyond, ensuring it meets business goals and delivers value. Lead your team: Set clear goals, success metrics, and a roadmap aligned with Huspy's mission. Collaborate closely: Work daily with Design, Engineering, Marketing, Legal, and Strategy teams to bring your product vision to life. Drive results: Use data, market research, and company strategy to prioritize impactful initiatives that drive growth. Be a problem solver: Tackle new challenges across various domains to keep improving our product and processes. The Perfect Match: What you bring 2+ years of experience at a high-growth tech company or in finance-related fields (proptech, payments, crypto, insurance, etc.) 2+ years of proven success leading consumer-facing products 1+ year managing cross-functional teams (Product Owners at Huspy directly manage Engineering, Operations, and Design) Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal A strong eye for UX/UI and understanding of design best practices We don’t expect you to code, but you should feel comfortable discussing deep technical topics with engineering teams and the platform users. Strong analytical skills with a solid business sense to prioritize tasks based on impact and return on investment (ROI) Experience in driving product vision, and clearly communicating with leadership, customers, and partners A hands-on attitude: you take initiative and are ready to tackle major projects directly. Ability to deliver results in ambiguous situations and thrive in a fast-paced environment What will set you apart: Experience in Proptech STEM degree from a top university degree Strong attention to detail with a proven ability to juggle multiple tasks and manage competing priorities. Genuine passion for Huspy’s mission and a drive to thrive in a technology-driven culture, with a strong desire to grow and learn!

title: Product Owner - PDF
description: About the job Join our team as a Product Owner - PDF and play a crucial role in enhancing our PDF-related products and services. We seek a dedicated individual who is eager to drive innovation and ensure seamless user experiences with our PDF solutions. About Leadtech Since 2009, Leadtech has been at the forefront of pioneering innovative digital solutions across various industries. With over 500 talented employees from 23 different nationalities, our dynamic team is dedicated to delivering products that cater to millions of users worldwide. Key Responsibilities In this role, you'll be responsible for: Leading the product vision and strategy for our PDF-related offerings Collaborating with stakeholders to define product requirements and ensure alignment with user needs and business objectives Working closely with UI/UX designers and developers to transform ideas into functional and user-friendly PDF solutions Prioritizing product backlog items and managing releases efficiently while focusing on continuous improvement Conducting market research and user feedback analysis to drive product enhancements and innovations Utilizing data-driven insights to optimize user workflows and maximize product engagement Facilitating communication across cross-functional teams to ensure successful product delivery and adoption You'll be a valuable member of the Leadtech team, contributing to the overall success of our PDF initiatives. Requirements Your qualifications include: Proven experience as a Product Owner (minimum of 2 years), preferably with a focus on PDF products Deep understanding of PDF technology and its application in digital products Strong knowledge of Agile methodologies and experience in managing product backlogs Demonstrated ability to analyze and interpret customer needs and translate them into actionable product features Excellent communication and team collaboration skills Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities Experience in conducting user research and utilizing feedback for product improvements Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and remote environment Fluency in English and Spanish (written and spoken) is required Passion for technology and a strong desire to stay updated with industry trends Benefits Perks of being one of us: Top-notch private health insurance — includes dental and psychological services Full-time, permanent contract Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer! Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m) Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!) Enhanced career path designed just for you External training budget Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets Budget for team-building activities We celebrate all company landmarks And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you. Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project! Location You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you. If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions. The personal data you provide will be processed in order to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by writing to our address (Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta. Barcelona. 08005) or to the email address protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, attaching to your request a document that can validate your identity.

title: AI DESIGNER
description: About the job ¿Estás preparadx para un cambio y explotar tus habilidades como nunca? 👉🏼 Sigue leyendo porque tenemos lo que buscas… 🛸 ¿Quiénes somos? 🛸 Somos una empresa internacional con más de 17 años de experiencia en consultoría e ingeniería informática. Con más de 3.000 Primers operando en 4 sectores principales en todo el mundo: IT, Telecomunicaciones, Energía e Infraestructuras. Nos puedes encontrar en más de 50 ciudades en todo el mundo: ESPAÑA | PORTUGAL | FRANCIA | REINO UNIDO | ITALIA | SUIZA | POLONIA | BRASIL 🕵🏽‍ ¿Qué buscamos? 🕵🏽‍ Experiencia en el diseño, implementación y priorización de soluciones de IA Background técnico en desarrollo (preferiblemente en front, ya sea maquetación, diseño o desarrollo) Automatización de tareas operativas con herramientas low-code/no-code (Zapier, n8n, etc.) y APIs (Notion, Figma, etc.). Conocimiento, investigación y actualización sobre las capacidades de LLMs y herramientas de IA aplicables (Galileo, Copilot, etc.) Creación de prototipos funcionales Medición y documentación de las soluciones implantadas, así como de los resultados generados MODALIDAD: 100% REMOTO ¡¡Y lo más importante de todo que realmente estés motivadx para un cambio!! 🚀 ¿Qué ofrecemos? 🚀 Podemos asegurarte que contamos con el mejor equipo de todo el sector. Desde el proceso de selección, tu incorporación y hasta nuestro desarrollo profesional te ofrecemos un acompañamiento y un seguimiento personalizado en todo momento. Y a todo esto súmale transparencia total en todos los pasos. Pinta bien, ¿verdad? Estamos seguros de que ya sabes qué es lo que muchas empresas te ofrecen y como nosotros estamos a la altura: Vas a contar con un plan de carrera, crecimiento, proyección y desarrollo profesional personalizado. Tendrás acceso a formación continua para que puedas estar al día. Podrás participar en proyectos nacionales e internacionales con opción a movilidad. No todo va a ser trabajar, por eso disfrutar de la tarjeta restaurante y seguro médico nos parece esencial. ¡¡¡Teambuildings, afterworks y muchas más sorpresas!! ¡Te esperamos!

title: Asistente comercial Junior
description: About the job Desde Adecco, colaboramos con una firma internacional especializada en la fabricación de equipos de lavado industrial para la industria alimentaria, en la búsqueda de un perfil Asistente Comercial Junior para incorporarse a su equipo en España. La posición ofrece una modalidad remota con desplazamientos frecuentes y una oportunidad única para jóvenes profesionales que deseen desarrollar su carrera en el ámbito comercial dentro de un entorno técnico-industrial. Funciones principales Prospección activa de nuevos clientes a través de herramientas digitales. Gestión y dinamización de la red de socios, agentes y distribuidores. Desarrollo de propuestas comerciales, estudios de mercado y presentaciones técnicas. Realización de visitas comerciales para detectar necesidades y presentar soluciones adaptadas. Presentaciones a distintos interlocutores dentro del cliente (operaciones, calidad, mantenimiento, compras, etc.). Seguimiento y fortalecimiento de relaciones con distribuidores. Participación activa en ferias del sector tanto a nivel nacional como internacional. Uso de herramientas CRM para el seguimiento de oportunidades y gestión de clientes. ¿Qué ofrecemos? Contrato junior con posibilidad de incorporación indefinida tras evaluación positiva. Modalidad remota (no hay oficina física en España). Gastos de desplazamiento cubiertos por la empresa. Formación inicial de un mes en Portugal. Requisitos Grado universitario en Administración y Dirección de Empresas, Marketing, Ingeniería o Economía. Dominio de Office y Google Workspace (imprescindible). Uso de herramientas CRM (valorable). Inglés fluido (obligatorio, se valorará nivel en entrevista). Perfil junior, con experiencia en prácticas, proyectos académicos o participación en entornos comerciales. Residencia en la Comunidad de Madrid: Disponibilidad para viajar frecuentemente (60% del tiempo) a nivel nacional y para estancias cortas en el extranjero. ¿Eres una persona con actitud, ganas de aprender y pasión por las ventas? Esta es tu oportunidad para comenzar tu carrera en una empresa internacional de referencia en su sector.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job Product Manager Location: Remote – Europe (UK or France preferred) About the Company A leading innovator in video delivery technology, providing advanced solutions for content management, distribution, and OTT. The company is trusted by broadcasters, sports organisations, and media platforms, enabling end to end video distribution. Known for its cutting-edge technology and strong industry reputation, the company offers a dynamic, growth-oriented environment with a commitment to innovation. The Role The role focuses on driving product strategy, market positioning, and innovation while bridging the gap between technical teams and customer needs. Key Responsibilities Define and execute the product roadmap for IP centric video distribution technologies Engage with broadcasters, sports rights holders, and more to understand industry trends and customer needs Collaborate with engineering, sales, and customer success teams to ensure product-market fit Drive feature development, Saas, and cloud-based media strategies Conduct competitive analysis and market research to inform product decisions Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and customer meetings Ideal Candidate Profile Proven experience as a Product Manager ideally with a backgroud in Saas based IP-centric streaming environments Strong relationships in both broadcast and non-broadcast sectors Deep understanding of IP video infrastructure, cloud distribution, Saas platforms and streaming solutions Ability to translate customer requirements into product features and work closely with engineering teams Experience with SaaS-based media solutions and cloud providers Why Join? Work with a company at the forefront of video delivery innovation Strong industry reputation with a collaborative and forward-thinking team Remote work flexibility

title: Product Designer
description: About the job ⚡️Who we are We help consumers shop smarter. Our ambition? Revolutionize shopping for the next generation of consumers, powered by technology, data, and AI. We empower millions of people to find what they need, make informed purchasing decisions, and save money — effortlessly. Joko is a tech company founded in Paris. Our team of over 50 talents is international and spread across offices in Paris, Barcelona and New York, or working remotely. As a certified B Corporation, we are committed to making a difference in the lives of the communities we serve, including the 4 million consumers already using Joko to save money every day at over 7,000 merchants. Over the years, we have quickly expanded our value proposition to enable consumers to make smarter shopping decisions through many features: cash back, buy now and pay later, automatic coupons, price drop alerts, carbon footprint tracking, and more. Today, we are dedicating significant resources to developing an AI-powered assistant that helps users find the right product based on their criteria for price, quality, or environmental impact from the global e-commerce catalog. After reaching profitability in our core market, we are now expanding internationally with a primary focus on the US. It’s still day 1; come build the future of shopping with us! This position is remote-friendly. 📱 Our Product team Led by Fabien, our VP Product, Joko's Product team groups the passionate individuals behind our users' delight! From brainstorming to development to launch, the Product team's main mission is to turn ideas into reality by working hand-in-hand with the Engineering, Design and Business teams. 🏉 Your scope As Product Designer, you will take the lead in shaping our UX and UI design practice across multiple products, setting our design standards, and defining the future of our user experience. You will collaborate closely with the CEO, Lead Product Designer, and your peers in the Product team to build world-class products that are used and loved by millions of users. 🎯 What you will do Your Responsibilities Will Include Designing world-class products: You will bring your talent and expertise into crafting a world-class suite of products. Our products currently encompass a mobile app, a web app, a desktop extension, and a mobile Safari extension - and there’s more to come! From discovery to delivery: You will take part in all steps of product development with the rest of the team, from identifying user and business needs by talking to stakeholders and users, to designing and implementing solutions together with the Product and Engineering teams. Implementing best-in-class design practices: As a key member of an evolving team, you will play a crucial role in scaling our existing design practices. With a detailed design system already in place, your expertise will enhance and refine our framework, ensuring consistency and excellence across all products as we expand our offerings and impact. Brand identity: You will work closely with the Marketing team to contribute to the evolution of our brand identity and to making sure our products’ touch and feel are consistent with this identity. 👀 Who we're looking for Experience: You have a 3y+ experience as a Product Designer, ideally including on mobile app and / or consumer products. Design skills: You have demonstrated strong skills on both mobile and desktop. You make your work scalable. You love simple but powerful experiences. Leadership: You are autonomous in your work and reliable when it comes to delivering for your coworkers. You communicate about problems. Mindset: You have an entrepreneurial mindset, you like challenges, you welcome feedback and are willing to get better every day to reach excellence. Languages: You are fluent in English, both written and spoken. 💎 Our perks We believe that flexibility and trust are important parts of a company. Our work environment reflects this thanks to: Flexible remote: If you live in Paris, you can work from our office or from your place with no constraints. If you live elsewhere, you can get access to a coworking space. Work from anywhere: Do you want to travel to Italy for a month and work from there? For up to 3 months a year, you may work from most countries in the world (for full-time employees). On top of that, we offer many perks such as: a budget for remote work equipment a ClassPass subscription for you to stay in shape wherever you are premium health insurance (Alan Blue in France) a Swile card for your meals, if you are based in France frequent team events and in-person gatherings every quarter! and so much more, see here ⏪ 🤝 Our hiring process Intro Call: Quick screening with the Hiring Manager or a recruiter. Step 1 – Team Interview (45 min): Discussion with two future teammates. Step 2 – Case Study & Debrief (45 min): You’ll work on a take-home assignment relevant to the role (e.g. coding, analysis, strategy, or process design), then present it in a live debrief. We assess both your output and how you think in real time. Step 3 – Founders Interview (45 min): Conversation with two of our founders. References: Up to five calls with former colleagues or managers. ☕ You may also be invited for coffee or drinks with team members to get a feel for our culture.

title: Product Owner (banking sector)
description: About the job Take your career to the next level with Amaris Consulting as a Product Owner.Be part of an international team and thrive in a global group with a €800M turnover and over 1,000 clients worldwide. You’ll work in an agile environment, where collaboration and innovation are key. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in building scalable, high-quality applications and will be comfortable working across the entire stack. Spanish fluency is required as part of this role. ✍️ WHAT WOULD YOU NEED? ✍️ 4 to 6 years of experience as a Product Owner (PO) with a background in banking. Strong proficiency in Stakeholder Management and working with Scrum methodologies. Experience in Product Design and collaborating closely with design teams. Solid knowledge of backend development and version control tools such as Git. Advanced proficiency in Spanish (written and spoken). Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. 👉 WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING? Gather, analyze, and define product requirements in close collaboration with stakeholders • Write and prioritize clear, actionable user stories • Own the product backlog and ensure alignment with business objectives • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-value product increments • Participate in Scrum ceremonies (planning, review, retrospectives) • Ensure timely delivery of features while maintaining product quality • Stay current with industry trends and best practices in Agile product ownership 🚀 WHY US? 🚀 Join our dynamic team of talented individuals and discover a world full of growth and opportunity. Here’s what we offer: Rapid growth through a personalized career path and salary assessment. 70% of our senior leaders started in entry-level positions. Improve your skills through our Technology Academy catalogue, Udemy platform, language classes, webinars, and workshops. Take control of your training with a personal annual budget and company-paid certifications. Enjoy flexible policies, remote work options, and excellent social benefits, such as transport and restaurant tickets, childcare support, and private health insurance. Benefit from our WeCare programme, which supports employees in critical situations. Unlock your full potential, both professionally and personally. Amaris Consulting prides itself on being an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive work environment. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, creed, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

title: Digital Product Manager
description: About the job About Darkroom We're building the future of advertising and are looking for the minds to help us do it. Darkroom is a progressive omnichannel growth marketing agency focused on retail, e-commerce, and consumer businesses. We have been recognized as one of the fastest growing private companies in America by Inc. 5000 (2023), a top 1% digital advertiser by Varos (2023), and our founders were named Forbes 30 Under 30 recipients for Marketing and Advertising North America (2024). We are seeking an experienced Shopify Project Manager who combines strong project management expertise with technical Shopify development skills. The ideal candidate thrives in collaborative environments, is proactive in identifying solutions, and has a deep understanding of e-commerce workflows and best practices. If you excel in managing complex projects, are detail-oriented, and possess excellent communication skills, we’d love to hear from you. This is a fully remote role operating in the EST Time Zone and all business is conducted 100% in English. Open to candidates in the following locations: Portugal, Spain and Brazil. What You'll Do: Shopify Expertise Create and optimize data-driven CRO strategies (e.g., A/B testing, funnel optimization) to enhance user engagement and increase conversions. Performing maintenance, analysis, optimization, and developing new site features and updates. Troubleshooting and resolving issues that may affect platform performance during and post-launch. Install and configure Shopify apps and third-party integrations. Project Management End-to-end implementation of a new Shopify e-commerce store. Develop project plans, timelines, and budgets that align with business objectives. Coordinate with teams across Design, IT, Marketing, and Business Operations to ensure on-time, on-budget delivery. Monitor progress, resolve roadblocks, and adjust resources or timelines when needed. Provide regular status updates and key metrics to stakeholders. Technical Leadership Ensure project feasibility and alignment with e-commerce best practices. Evaluate third-party tools and APIs for seamless integration into the website. Stay updated on Shopify features, updates, and industry trends to recommend site improvements. Collaboration and Communication Serve as the primary point of contact between technical teams, external vendors, and stakeholders. Translate business requirements into actionable tasks for developers. Foster effective communication and resolve problems across all project teams. You Should Apply if this Sounds Like You: Experience: 2 - 3 years in e-commerce or web project management. Experience in CRO and SEO fundamentals Hands-on Shopify experience. Familiarity with Shopify APIs and third-party tool integrations. Skills: Expert in Shopify. It is your second language. Strong understanding of SEO, Conversion Rate Optimization, and e-commerce workflows. Proficiency in project management tools (Notion). Advanced organizational, and time-management skills. Excellent verbal and written english communication skills, with the ability to present complex ideas clearly. Experience with HTML, CSS is a plus What it's like to work at Darkroom: Our team is our most sacred asset, and we offer highly competitive salaries and the following perks: Unlimited Vacation Policy, and Holidays: Rebooting is one of the most important parts of growth. At Darkroom, you have access to a flexible vacation policy, and 10 holidays throughout the year to keep you recharged and sharp. Location, location, (or no) location: Remote-first culture with a strong community base. With Hubs in LA, The Bay Area, New York, Philly, Sao Paulo, Lisbon, and Eastern Europe. Endless opportunities for growth: Our agency is founded on an interdisciplinary approach, giving Darkroomers insights into services far beyond your job description. Grow your skills and interests beyond your niche and stay at the forefront of the industry through total immersion in cross-functional collaboration. Equal Opportunity Statement Darkroom is an equal opportunity workplace—we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

title: Product Intern
description: About the job PRODUCT INTERN AT ZENOWN AI SCALE-UP 🚀 WHO ARE WE? ZenOwn is innovative AI Technology company that empowers world’s leading consumer goods brands to attract, engage and retain their consumers in the retail. ZenShelf AI solutions enables automatic planning and monitoring of the in-store execution to optimise sales for CPG brands in retail. Loop by ZenOwn enables brands to register, engage, retain & understand their consumers. Awarded by Plug & Play, WebSummit and others for its innovativeness. Powered by a high performing diverse team with leading tech & consumer goods experience, powering 5 of Top 100 consumer brands on 4 continents. 👍 WHY JOIN US By joining ZenOwn, you’ll be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking team that encourages innovation and values each team member’s contributions. You’ll work in a supportive environment that prioritises personal growth and offers opportunities to make a tangible impact. 👩‍💼👨‍💼 WE ARE LOOKING FOR A TOP PERFORMER WHO: Has strong organisational skills and can manage multiple workstreams efficiently Demonstrates a genuine interest in startups, technology, and AI Is fluent in Spanish Possesses excellent analytical abilities and is comfortable working with data to inform decisions Communicates clearly and professionally, both in writing and verbally Has a cross-functional mindset, with an understanding of customer support and business operations Is proactive, reliable, and brings a high degree of professionalism to their work Is curious, eager to learn, and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment 📦 WHAT WE OFFER: Full-time internship, duration of 3 to 12 months Further career opportunities within ZenOwn for top performers Learning & development opportunities Visibility of end-to-end ownership of key initiatives with a high degree of responsibility Paid internship & location flexibility (remote) 🎯 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Support the Product team in managing product development workflows, ensuring tasks are organised and on track Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Customer Support, Business Development, Tech) to gather requirements and ensure smooth product operations Analyse user feedback, market trends, and internal data to identify opportunities for improvement to our B2B solutions Prepare clear documentation, reports, and presentations to communicate insights and progress to stakeholders Contribute to maintaining a high standard of execution across product initiatives Assist with onboarding materials and training related to new features and updates Help drive operational excellence and continuous improvement in product processes Communicate professionally with Spanish-speaking clients INTERESTED? Tell us why you’re a perfect fit for this role and how your experience can contribute to our mission and attach your CV in English. Put “Product Intern” and your name in the email subject line. jobs@zenown.com

title: Propietario de producto
description: About the job Digital Channels – PO/BA (Customer) (Remoto – España) ¿Tienes un perfil híbrido entre funcional y técnico, y te apasiona mejorar la experiencia del cliente a través de productos digitales sólidos? ¿Quieres trabajar en iniciativas con alto impacto en canales web y mobile dentro del sector bancario? Esta oportunidad puede ser perfecta para ti. Sobre nuestro cliente Estamos colaborando con una entidad financiera líder en transformación digital, que impulsa el desarrollo de soluciones orientadas al cliente final mediante tecnología de vanguardia. Su misión: simplificar procesos, integrar experiencias y construir productos digitales escalables y seguros, con visión de largo plazo y colaboración entre equipos multidisciplinares. Su cultura se basa en la innovación continua, el trabajo colaborativo y la excelencia técnica al servicio del usuario. ¿Qué harás? Como Product Owner / Business Analyst en Canales Digitales, serás clave en la toma de requerimientos, planificación funcional y coordinación con equipos de desarrollo para garantizar entregas de valor a través de soluciones web y mobile. Además, colaborarás con áreas técnicas, legales y de compliance para construir productos robustos, regulados y centrados en la experiencia del cliente. Tus misiones clave: Recoger, priorizar y documentar requerimientos funcionales junto a stakeholders internos. Participar activamente en la planificación y seguimiento de iniciativas en canales digitales (web y mobile). Definir y mantener el backlog y las user stories alineadas con objetivos de negocio. Supervisar el desarrollo técnico, pruebas funcionales y subidas a entorno pre/pro. Realizar seguimiento de testing, gestión de incidencias y reporting de KPIs. Traducir necesidades de áreas transversales (Legal, Compliance, Producto) en especificaciones funcionales claras. Asegurar una comunicación efectiva y transparente con stakeholders digitales, clientes internos y equipos técnicos. Colaborar con desarrolladores en la integración de APIs, análisis de logs y revisión técnica básica del código. Participar en la mejora continua de arquitectura cloud y modelado de datos para productos digitales orientados al cliente. Requisitos imprescindibles +5 años de experiencia como Product Owner / Business Analyst en proyectos digitales. Background técnico con experiencia en entornos de desarrollo web y mobile. Capacidad para leer y entender logs, APIs y estructura técnica básica. Experiencia en productos y procesos bancarios (cuentas, tarjetas, préstamos, onboarding, etc.). Conocimiento de herramientas como Jira, Confluence y Postman. Inglés B2 o superior (entorno de trabajo internacional). Experiencia con metodologías Agile (Scrum, Kanban). Sólidas habilidades de comunicación y gestión de stakeholders funcionales y técnicos. Capacidad para trabajar con equipos multidisciplinares en entornos ágiles y regulados. Bonus / Nice to have Especialización en Customer Experience. Conocimiento en arquitectura cloud y modelado de datos. Experiencia previa en entornos de banca digital o fintech. Familiaridad con procesos de parental control o programas de innovación (Startapp). ¿Cómo eres tú? Eres resolutivo/a, organizado/a y colaborativo/a. Sabes trabajar con autonomía sin perder la perspectiva del equipo. Combinas visión de negocio y sensibilidad técnica. Te interesa construir productos digitales que realmente mejoran la vida de las personas. Te adaptas bien a contextos regulados y entornos complejos. ¿Dónde y cómo? 100% remoto desde cualquier punto de España Jornada completa, con horario reducido en agosto Proyecto estable en banca digital con alto potencial de impacto ¿Te motiva mejorar la experiencia del cliente desde dentro de productos digitales escalables y bien diseñados? Únete a un equipo que construye soluciones reales con visión de futuro.

title: Senior Product Manager
description: About the job Hey there! We’re Fever, the world’s leading tech platform for culture and live entertainment, Our mission? To democratize access to culture and entertainment. With our proprietary cutting-edge technology and data-driven approach, we’re revolutionizing the way people engage with live entertainment. Every month, our platform inspires over 300 million people in +40 countries (and counting) to discover unforgettable experiences while also empowering event creators with our data and technology, helping them scale, innovate, and enhance their events to reach new audiences. Our results? We’ve teamed up with major industry leaders like Netflix, F.C. Barcelona, and Primavera Sound, presented international award-winning experiences, and are backed by several leading global investors! Impressive, right? To achieve our mission, we are looking for bar-raisers with a hands-on mindset who are eager to help shape the future of entertainment! Ready to be part of the experience? Now, let’s discuss this role and what you will do to help achieve Fever’s mission. Behind the user-friendly iOS and Android apps and webpage that work across the world is the engineering team. We are in charge of creating, developing, improving, and maintaining all Fever services so that more people can have an amazing experience. About The Role Understand our business, our customers, our market and the data of our product, in order to delight our customers and achieve Fever’s goals. Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders across different departments: Engineering, Design, User Research, Marketing, Sales, Customer Support, and more. Break down broad opportunities into concrete and measurable actions to help us achieve our objectives. Analyze product performance, hypothesize, test and continuously improve product metrics. Develop product features from ideation to release: gathering data, hypothesizing, conducting experiments, defining goals & requirements, releasing and tracking features’ performance. Lead a product squad, manage its roadmap and prioritization, and run sprint planning, refinements, and retrospectives with your squad. Build a vision and strategy for your product. Display strong leadership, organizational, and execution skills. About You Basic skills and qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field. 5+ years of relevant experience in product management Work proficiency in English Proven experience managing ambiguity, complexity, and interdependencies within a product development cycle Ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences Strong written communication skills Experience working closely with engineering and design teams, communicating with them and providing them feedback Strong quantitative and analytical skills - the ability to derive conclusions from data and clearly communicate findings is critical Ability to work independently and manage multiple concurrent projects from concept to completion Curiosity and desire to learn, with a demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive, in a fast-pace environment Persistence and a whatever-it-takes approach to ensure that your product and team are successful Preferred Skills And Qualifications Technically fluent; comfortable understanding and discussing architectural concepts, defining trade-offs and new opportunities with technical team members Experience in tech startups (alternatively, strong willingness to work in a leading and very fast-paced tech startup) Strong strategic aptitude; proven ability to define a winning business strategy Ability to earn trust across different levels and multiple groups of a large organization Proven experience of hypothesizing, building lean validations, conducting A/B tests and defining metrics and control metrics Strong ability to empathize with customers, and understand the competitive landscape while innovating Experience in building a vision and a clear strategy for a product line, gathering support and communicating it to the organization Benefits & Perks Attractive compensation package consisting of base salary and the potential to earn a significant bonus for top performance. Stock options. Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader 40% discount on all Fever events and experiences Home office friendly Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with! Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee. English Lessons Gympass Membership Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow. Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you! If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply! If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey. If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

title: QA accesibilidad Canales Digitales (100% remoto desde España)
description: About the job 🚀 ¡Seguimos buscando talento…y nos encantaría que te unieras a nuestro equipo! Para que nos conozcas algo mejor, UST es una multinacional norteamericana certificada como Top Employer y Great Place to Work con más de 35.000 empleados a nivel global y con presencia en más de 35 países. Somos líderes en servicios de tecnología digital y proporcionamos soluciones tecnológicas de gran alcance a grandes compañías. 🔎 ¿Qué buscamos? Para nuestro equipo estamos buscando un QA con experiencia en pruebas de accesibilidad, para formar parte de importante proyecto dentro de nuestro cliente, líder del sector bancario. Colaboración 100% remota desde cualquier provincia de España. Funciones: Planificación y Diseño de Pruebas: crear planes de pruebas detallados que cubran todos los aspectos funcionales y no funcionales del producto financiero, basados en los requisitos del cliente y las especificaciones del producto. Colaboración con el Equipo de Desarrollo: Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los desarrolladores para comprender los requisitos de las nuevas funcionalidades y las correcciones de defectos, asegurando una comunicación clara y eficiente para la resolución oportuna de problemas. Definición y adaptación de los procedimientos internos de calidad, sus estándares y especificaciones en base a los estándares de calidad de la industria y a las recomendaciones de auditoria. Aseguramiento de los estándares de calidad de pruebas a nivel compañía. Revisión de métricas de calidad, con el fin de identificar oportunidades de mejora o deficiencias en el cumplimiento de estándares fijados. 💡 Qué esperamos de ti: Aportar al menos 4 años de experiencia como tester, desarrollando, ejecutando y documentando planes de pruebas. Conocimientos sobre accesibilidad digital e inclusión de personas con discapacidad. Conocimientos sobre normativas relacionadas con la accesibilidad digital (por ejemplo, Sección 508, ADA) Conocimientos sobre los requisitos WCAG 2.1 AA Conocimientos sobre tecnologías web (por ejemplo, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) Experiencia en el uso de herramientas y marcos de evaluación de la accesibilidad (por ejemplo, WAVE, Developer Tools, Accessibility Inspector) Experiencia en el uso de tecnologías de asistencia (por ejemplo, VoiceOver, JAWS, Dragon Naturally Speaking, ZoomText) El profesional debe ser capaz de confirmar si el error detectado es realmente un error y no un falso positivo, así como evidenciar el error detectado. Valorable: nivel de inglés B2 💰 ¿Qué te ofrecemos? ✈️ 23 días laborables de vacaciones y el 24 y 31 de diciembre. ❤️ Numerosos beneficios sociales (seguro médico, ayuda al teletrabajo, seguro de vida y seguro de accidentes). 🍴 Programa de Retribución Flexible (tarjeta comida, cheques guardería, tarjeta transporte, clases de inglés online, seguro médico para tu familia…). 🎓 Acceso gratuito a varias plataformas de formación. 🚀 Estabilidad y carrera profesional. 🚶 Tenemos implantado un plan de compensación de referencias internas. 🔗 Posibilidad de elección de percibir tu salario en 12 o 14 pagas. 🏡 Medidas de conciliación (horario flexible, teletrabajo, asesoramiento de especialistas (psicólogo, nutricionista, entrenador personal), jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano según proyecto). 🎁 Plataforma UST Club descuentos y descuentos en gimnasios. 📧 Si quieres conocer más, no dudes en inscribirte y nos pondremos en contacto contigo para ampliarte información de la posición ¡Te estamos esperando! En UST nos comprometemos con la igualdad de oportunidades en nuestros procesos de selección y no realizamos ningún tipo de discriminación por razón de raza, género, discapacidad, edad, religión, orientación sexual o nacionalidad. Estamos comprometidos con la discapacidad y apostamos por la incorporación de personas con certificado de discapacidad.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job Looking for An ambitious and visionary Product Manager excited to build a new product from scratch and leave a mark on the future of finance. About Triple Triple is a high-growth fintech disrupting the payment data enrichment landscape, leveraging technology to enhance customer experiences. Our unique ecosystem offers solutions like transaction brand enrichment, logo provisioning, geolocalisation, data categorization, subscription analysis, and carbon footprint measurement. Our aim is to shape the future of finance with a powerful API. We value thinking long-term, getting things done with a diverse team, and staying humble. We have large banks and fintechs as customers, an experienced team, and a large network of investors behind our company. We have raised $10M in funding. What you will do Take full ownership of a new product from 0 to 1 Define and shape the product in close collaboration with customers and internal teams Translate abstract user problems into clear, actionable product requirements Own the roadmap from ideation to launch and continuous iteration Work cross-functionally with engineering, design, and commercial teams to ship effectively Validate assumptions quickly and iterate based on feedback and data Drive the product vision while staying agile and open to change What you need 3–5 years of experience in Product Management, ideally in fintech or banking Proficiency in English Strong problem-solving skills and ability to simplify complex systems Experience working with technical teams on API-based or data-driven products Comfortable owning products end-to-end in fast-paced, ambiguous environments Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills Conditions Remote-first. We offer a flexible work environment, a supportive and collaborative team, a competitive salary, equity options, and the opportunity to make a real impact on the future of finance. Join Triple and shape the future of finance Please kindly apply through LinkedIn.

title: Creative Project Manager
description: About the job Are you the kind of person who can bring order to creative chaos without dulling the spark? We're working with an independent beauty brand that’s scaling quickly, growing its audience, launching new products, and building a creative engine to match. This is a company that values storytelling, fast execution, and a high bar for craft, especially across video and performance creative. To support that growth, they’re hiring a Creative Project Manager to help bring structure to an increasingly busy content pipeline. This isn’t just another project manager role - we’re looking for someone who understands the pace and nuance of DTC creative, and knows how to keep things moving without cutting corners. YOUR MISSION Your mission is to bring structure, clarity, and momentum to the creative process. You'll be the go-to person for keeping projects on track - from initial brief to final delivery - ensuring nothing slips through the cracks. You’ll work closely with creative leads, editors, and brand stakeholders to manage timelines, coordinate feedback, and maintain a clear view of what’s happening across multiple workstreams. This is a full-time contractor role with flexible hours, giving you the opportunity to collaborate with a global team and work remotely from anywhere in the world. WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU Remote flexibility: Work from anywhere with the freedom to manage your day Own your impact: Be the driving force behind a high-performing creative team Creative collaboration: Work alongside top editors, marketers, and UGC talent Career growth: Shape systems, lead workflows, and make a visible difference Fast-moving team: Join a DTC brand that’s scaling fast and values speed, clarity, and execution WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING Build and maintain a streamlined asset management system that improves team efficiency, reduces versioning errors, and keeps creative files organized and easy to access Oversee the end-to-end ad production pipeline to ensure projects move smoothly from brief to delivery, hitting deadlines and maintaining a high creative standard Own the first round of revisions and QA to ensure every asset meets brand guidelines, platform specs, and performance goals before it goes live Partner with the UGC Manager and media team to align production with creative strategy, prioritizing high-impact requests and enabling fast iteration on top performers Identify workflow bottlenecks early and implement process improvements that keep the creative machine running without delays Keep stakeholders informed with clear, timely updates — increasing visibility across teams and reducing miscommunication or last-minute surprises WHO YOU ARE 2–3+ years in a Creative Project Manager role at a DTC brand or creative agency Proven experience managing a team of 5+ video editors Hands-on with video workflows and revision cycles (especially in performance marketing or direct-response contexts) Meticulous, deadline-driven, and passionate about process improvement Clear communicator who thrives in remote, high-speed creative teams Understanding of ad testing frameworks and performance data (CTR, ROAS, etc.) Previous experience in UGC ad production or direct-response video editing WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE 30 Days In: You’ve taken full ownership of the creative pipeline, implemented a streamlined asset management system, and established a rhythm with editors and stakeholders. Everyone knows what’s due and when. 60 Days In: You’re optimizing workflows, proactively solving bottlenecks, and accelerating production timelines. You’re QAing ads before they hit media buying, and iteration cycles are noticeably faster and smoother. 90 Days In: You’ve become the heartbeat of creative ops. Editors are more efficient, output is higher, revisions are sharper, and your systems are helping scale high-performing ads across the board.

title: Product Designer, Design Systems
description: About the job Who we are About Stripe Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career. About The Team We believe there are too many barriers to doing business on the internet, and that opportunities are not equally distributed throughout the world. We also think building and growing a business online is a problem rooted in code, language, and design. Stripe’s mission is to increase the GDP of the internet and expand economic access globally. We’re designing tools and infrastructure to help our users start, run, and scale an online business from anywhere in the world. That’s where you come in: we’re looking for a diverse set of designers of many disciplines, skills, backgrounds, and specialties to join our growing Design team. The Design team works across many types of product initiatives at Stripe—from our brand voice and websites to events, web and mobile products, primary qualitative and quantitative research, and even printed publications. And since Stripe’s main audience is other people who build products, we agonize over and take pride in crafting user-friendly and user-focused experiences. What you’ll do We’re looking for an experienced product designer to design UI components, patterns, and tools that enable designers and engineers at Stripe to create consistent, high quality user experiences. This includes working on Sail, the design system and component library that all of Stripe’s products are built on. As a product designer on the team, you’ll work at the intersection of design and engineering, driving both decisions that directly impact the design and code quality of Stripe products. You’ll be asked to collaborate with designers and product teams from across the company to design systems, components, and tools that raise the quality and consistency of Stripe product experiences. Responsibilities Design reusable components and patterns that align with Stripe’s design principles. Prototype components and reusable end-to-end experiences, contribute to design system repositories, and support engineering efforts. Create and maintain clear, comprehensive documentation to enable teams across the organization to adopt and extend the design system effectively. Create and maintain shared UI libraries, patterns, and templates in Figma. Facilitate training sessions to educate and onboard teams using the design system. Advocate for accessibility in all aspects of the design system. Who you are We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement. Minimum Requirements 4+ years relevant design experience at a product-driven tech company. Strong skills in visual design, interaction design, and prototyping demonstrated through a portfolio of work, spanning desktop and mobile surfaces. Experience collaborating closely with engineering teams. Experience leading changes to a design system. Preferred Qualifications Experience working on design systems at scale, including creating and managing shared libraries, templates, and tokens in Figma. Understanding of accessibility standards (e.g. WCAG). Familiarity with design tokens, version control systems (e.g. GIT), and tools for maintaining design system documentation. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to articulate design decisions and system concepts to diverse stakeholders. Passion for mentoring and educating teams on leveraging design systems to improve workflow efficiency and consistency. Working remotely at Stripe A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live. Pay and benefits The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is €68,000 - €102,000. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings (“OTE”) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and specific location.
