title: Product Manager - Website Experience (US/Europe, Remote)
description: About the job Location: Remote, US/Europe | Full-time About WebPros WebPros is committed to empowering businesses worldwide through cutting-edge solutions in web hosting, billing automation, infrastructure, server management, and online marketing. Since our founding in 2017, we’ve rapidly grown into a global leader, expanding our robust portfolio to include industry-defining brands such as cPanel & WHM, Plesk, WHMCS, SolusVM, NIXStats, XOVI, SocialBee, and Sitejet. Today, we power 85 million+ websites across 900,000+ servers worldwide, backed by a 600+ strong team of dedicated professionals spanning multiple continents. At WebPros, we embrace a fully remote, borderless workplace with a focus on flexibility, autonomy, and work-life balance. Whether you prefer working from a bustling city hub or a quiet home office, we enable our teams to thrive from anywhere while staying deeply connected through our strong collaborative culture. Your Role Hi, I’m Hendrik, Director of Product Management (Website Experience) here at WebPros—and your future manager. I’ve built my career at the intersection of product management, marketing, and sales, co-founding ventures that were later acquired by hosting industry leaders. With a degree in Business Information Systems, I thrive in strategic roles and love driving innovation. My “do-it-for-me” web design business transformed into Sitejet, which is now fully integrated into both cPanel and Plesk—empowering web professionals around the world to build better websites. I’m deeply committed to excellence and the continuous evolution of our products. In my role, I oversee the entire Website Experience division, including the Sitejet website builder, Site Quality Monitoring, and all other website tools in cPanel & Plesk. I look forward to working together to push our product suite to new heights. We’re now hiring a Product Manager to leverage Plesk and cPanel as strategic platforms to drive the adoption of our solutions and boost revenue growth. Our core mission is to provide a suite of robust tools and functionalities that cater to a diverse audience, enabling everyone—from beginners to seasoned developers—to seamlessly build and manage websites and web applications. You’ll be working across both ecosystems, aligning with internal stakeholders and external platform teams to shape high-impact solutions. The biggest challenge in this role? Navigating the technical depth of cPanel and Plesk while coordinating with platform teams you don’t directly manage. You’ll need to align roadmaps, manage dependencies, and work through adoption resistance from partners. With development resources still being clarified, you’ll need to operate with agility, creativity, and a clear sense of strategic priorities. You’ll be expected to lead discovery, validate solutions with partners, and build compelling use cases that make integration a no-brainer. You’ll thrive here if you’re comfortable working across technical boundaries, influencing without authority, and engaging deeply with hosting providers. If you enjoy solving go-to-market challenges, documenting real customer workflows, and translating partner needs into product wins—this is your space. You might struggle here if you don’t have practical experience with cPanel or Plesk. You’re uncomfortable working without direct control over development teams. You lack experience partnering with hosting providers or navigating adoption barriers. You prefer highly structured environments with clearly defined resources from the start. This is a critical role for someone who understands the web hosting ecosystem and is ready to lead with focus, creativity, and resilience. You’ll bridge the gap between product vision and platform reality—ensuring our tools integrate smoothly into complex hosting environments. This is a hands-on, high-impact role where your ability to align with partners, navigate technical platforms, and drive adoption will directly influence our revenue and market position. If you’re excited to work at the intersection of product development, platform partnerships, and user experience, we’d love to hear from you. Below, you’ll find everything you need to decide if this role is right for you—from our team culture and working rhythms to the detailed responsibilities, qualifications, and interview process. We believe in transparency and want you to have a clear, inside look at what it’s like to shape the future of website experience at WebPros. Your Impact In The First 180 Days We don’t believe in endless checklists of requirements. Instead, here’s what success looks like in your first 6 months: 30 Days Get up to speed on cPanel and Plesk platforms, including their technical architecture and key features Meet with internal teams and external cPanel/Plesk partners to understand current collaboration processes Review existing product offerings, adoption metrics, and partner feedback Identify immediate gaps in partner engagement and integration readiness Begin building relationships with key stakeholders across engineering, sales, and partner teams 60 Days Develop a detailed plan to address partner adoption challenges and streamline user onboarding processes Collaborate with UX design and engineering to start defining priority features and improvements Conduct customer and partner interviews to gather deeper insights on pain points and opportunities Establish communication and alignment routines with cPanel and Plesk platform teams Begin drafting product roadmaps that reflect realistic timelines and resource availability 90 Days Launch initial product enhancements or pilot programs aimed at increasing partner adoption Implement user testing sessions and iterate on solutions based on feedback Work closely with Sales and Partner Enablement to support go-to-market efforts Monitor progress against roadmap milestones and adjust plans as needed Identify and escalate any resource or dependency risks impacting delivery 180 Days Demonstrate measurable improvements in partner adoption and integration success Scale successful pilots and roll out expanded features to broader hosting provider audiences Refine long-term product vision in collaboration with platform partners and internal stakeholders Optimize cross-functional processes for ongoing collaboration and feedback gathering Establish yourself as the go-to expert for cPanel and Plesk product strategy within the organization This roadmap lays out the critical milestones and focus areas that will set you up for success. By the end of your first six months, you’ll have established yourself as a key driver of product adoption and partner success across the cPanel and Plesk platforms. You’ll be leading strategic initiatives with clear roadmaps, fostering strong cross-organizational relationships, and continuously improving how our solutions deliver value to hosting providers and end users. You’ll Thrive Here If You Have strong hands-on experience with cPanel and Plesk and understand their ecosystems deeply Are confident working cross-functionally with internal teams and external platform partners Enjoy solving adoption challenges by creating clear value propositions and enabling partners effectively Can translate technical customer feedback into actionable product improvements Are comfortable operating with agility in ambiguous environments and managing dependencies without direct control You Might Struggle Here If You Prefer working on a single product or within a narrowly defined scope without external collaboration Need detailed, top-down instructions for daily tasks or find it hard to prioritize without clear guidelines Avoid collaborating across engineering, sales, and external partners to solve complex challenges Expect full control over all resources and dependencies Lack practical experience with cPanel or Plesk or struggle to influence third-party teams without direct authority How We Work Team & Workflow: You’ll partner closely with cross-functional teams including design, engineering, sales, and key stakeholders to brainstorm, refine, and align on product ideas and initiatives. Own the full product management workflow—from customer and market research (analyzing feedback, conducting interviews, monitoring trends) to prioritizing features and managing resources, ensuring everything stays aligned with the overall product vision and business goals. Collaboration & Ownership: Operate in a remote-friendly, asynchronous communication environment using Slack and Confluence. Participate in regular cross-team syncs (alignment meetings) to maintain transparency and adapt plans responsively to shifting priorities and resource constraints. You’ll also lead user-centric design and testing efforts, creating customer journey maps and conducting user testing sessions to validate concepts and identify pain points. Tech Stack & Tools: Leverage a suite of collaboration, planning, and analytics tools including Confluence, Jira, Trello, Figma, Miro, Mixpanel, Slack, and Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) to facilitate effective communication, documentation, and data-driven decision-making. The specific tech stack may vary depending on the product stream and team you’re working with, allowing flexibility to use the most appropriate tools for each context. Cloud & Infrastructure: Our infrastructure leverages scalable cloud platforms combined with managed services to support high availability and secure operations. Dedicated DevOps and engineering teams handle infrastructure management, monitoring, and optimization. As a Product Manager, you stay closely aligned with these teams to understand infrastructure dependencies and constraints that impact product planning and delivery. Testing & Quality: User-centric design and testing are embedded in the product lifecycle. You’ll lead initiatives involving customer journey mapping and user testing sessions to validate product concepts and uncover pain points, ensuring solutions meet user needs before full release. Releases & CI/CD: We employ a hybrid release model, balancing scheduled weekly or monthly releases with continuous deployment for rapid iteration. Engineering teams own the CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, deployment processes, rollbacks, and hotfixes. Product Managers coordinate release schedules and communicate timelines to stakeholders, ensuring smooth delivery and alignment with business priorities. Our Culture WebPros is built on diversity, not just in principle but by design. We’ve grown through acquiring industry-leading brands, bringing together teams from 42+ nationalities, 20+ countries, and 10+ brands. Instead of enforcing a one-size-fits-all culture, we embrace unique perspectives, different working styles, and localized expertise to drive global innovation. We are a fully remote, async-friendly company where transparency, open communication, and collaborative problem-solving define how we work. Whether you thrive in the fast pace of a startup or the stability of an established product, WebPros offers a dynamic, evolving career journey that you can shape based on your strengths. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable workplace where every team member feels valued, heard, and supported because our diversity is our strength. Compensation & Benefits We believe benefits go beyond just perks. At WebPros, we invest in your growth, flexibility, and well-being, so you can do your best work and build a meaningful career. While we strive to provide equal global benefits for all team members, some may vary by location, and we’ll clarify the details with you during the interview process. Competitive salary Remote-first flexibility: Work from anywhere in US/Europe (or hybrid in available offices). Health Insurance: public or private coverage, depending on your location. Paid Time Off: Number of days depending on your location. Development Budget: Annual personal growth allowance. Learning Support: Udemy subscription & peer learning. Public Transport & Meal Vouchers: Location-dependent benefits. Team Culture: Regular team and on-site company events. Your Hiring Experience Hi, I’m Florian, your Talent Partner for EMEA at WebPros. I’ll guide you through the interview process, ensuring a clear, transparent, and meaningful experience. Before moving into talent and culture, I was a software engineer, so I understand what it’s like to navigate technical hiring. My goal is to make this process a genuine, two-way conversation where you feel informed, valued, and empowered to make the best decision for your career. Hiring is about relationships, not just resumes. You can expect honest, constructive feedback at every step, and I welcome yours as well. No matter the outcome, I want this to be a positive and insightful experience. If you’d like to connect, feel free to reach out on LinkedIn. Interview Process Screening Interview (30 min): An informal conversation with Florian (Talent Partner) designed to get to know you better. We’ll discuss your background, motivations, and career aspirations while providing a clear overview of WebPros, the team structure, and what you can expect throughout the hiring process. This is your chance to ask questions and ensure the role aligns with your professional goals. Technical Assessment: A practical evaluation of your hands-on experience with cPanel and Plesk, as well as your product thinking and problem-solving skills. Panel Interview (60-90 min): A comprehensive discussion with key team members to assess your technical expertise, self-reliance, and fit within the team. This stage includes a deep dive into product strategy, stakeholder management, and cross-functional collaboration. You’ll also face platform-specific technical questions related to cPanel and Plesk, and engage in a case study discussion focused on product strategy and roadmapping. Behavioral and cultural fit will be evaluated through STAR-based questions. Additionally, there will be a brief session exploring your experience with partner collaboration and go-to-market initiatives. Offer Talk (30 min): A final conversation with Hendrik and Florian to review the offer details, address any remaining questions, and discuss next steps. Our Commitment To a Diverse & Inclusive Culture At WebPros, we want every team member to feel excited to bring their full, authentic self to work. Our strength lies in the diversity of our people, with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences driving innovation and making us stronger together. We are committed to ensuring equitable opportunities, pay, and support for all employees, regardless of identity, background, or circumstances. We foster a culture of belonging, respect, and psychological safety, where everyone feels valued, heard, and empowered to contribute meaningfully and grow. Discrimination of any kind, including sexism, racism, xenophobia, homophobia, transphobia, ableism, and ageism, has no place here. By embracing differences and championing inclusivity, we create an environment where everyone can thrive. We are looking forward to your application! Best, Hendrik & Florian

title: Staff Product Designer (100% remote role in EMEA)
description: About the job Location: This is a 100% remote role open to those who reside in the EMEA region. Due to our compensation strategy, we are not considering applicants from high-cost-of-living locations such as Benelux, DACH, France, Nordics, or the UK. About The Job Testlio’s fully managed crowdsourced testing platform integrates expert, on-demand testers directly into your release process. Ship faster and more confidently with global coverage across 600,000+ devices, 800+ payment methods, 150+ countries, and 100+ languages. To learn more, visit www.testlio.com. We’re looking for a Staff Product Designer to own end-to-end design across our product and help define how design works at Testlio. Learn more about our Product team here. Why you will love this job? You’ll shape the product, not just design it. With no product managers, design leads the work. You’ll drive direction, own decisions, and collaborate directly with engineers who care about quality. You’ll work on everything. From redesigning legacy tools to launching new features and improving design systems. Your work will shape how the platform feels end to end. You’ll help define the design culture. You’re joining early and will set the standard for how we work. Why you will love being a part of Testlio? Great Culture: Testlio is a female-founded company, and half our team identifies as women. We’re proud of our inclusive, purpose-driven culture where people genuinely enjoy collaborating. As part of our team (we call ourselves TestLions), you’ll help create exceptional digital experiences for our customers, while also contributing to our freelance network and social impact initiatives like Ignite. Remote Work: Our culture is built around remote work. We’ve created systems to allow us to successfully work together asynchronously as a fully remote and globally distributed team. Testlio provides the tools and guidance for everyone to succeed in their careers in a fully remote setting. Our working style encourages everyone to make decisions, communicate effectively, and work at a sustainable pace. Investment in You: Your growth and well-being matter to us. You’ll have flexible paid time off—including national holidays, personal days, and sick days—plus stock options so you can grow with Testlio. We also provide a $300 annual learning stipend to support your personal and professional development. Winning Business: Testlio is growing, profitable, and cash-strong. We are leading our industry with exceptional clients who provide us with a high NPS score and a 4.7 rating on G2. Our business model is global, enterprise, and subscription-based. Several of our largest clients have been with us for 7+ years, and many spend $500K+/year with Testlio. What would your day look like? Leading cross-functional discussions to define product functionality and user flows. Making strategic product decisions alongside engineering. Crafting high-fidelity, production-ready designs that meet both user and business needs, with strong attention to detail, visual polish, and usability. Prototyping and iterating on new features to explore ideas and validate interactions Creating clear, useful documentation to support implementation and ensure alignment, helping to foster a culture of constructive critique and iteration. Collaborating with engineers to refine edge cases, ensure feasibility, and uphold design quality. You’ll evolve our design system to support scalability and consistency across the platform. What do you need to succeed? Technical Skills Extensive Design Experience: 7+ years in product design, with a portfolio showing end-to-end ownership of complex products, especially in B2B SaaS. Design Systems Expertise: Proven expertise in building and scaling design systems, evolving them without creating overhead. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Strong collaboration with engineering teams, with the ability to communicate design intent clearly and effectively. User-Centered Design: Confident application of UX principles to deliver user-focused solutions, balancing experience, intuition, and established patterns over formal research when appropriate. Human Skills Strategic mindset to connect design decisions with product and business outcomes. Comfort working in ambiguous situations, proactively driving projects forward without complete information. Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills, with openness to feedback and critical questions. Leadership through context and example, setting high standards through individual contributions and collaboration. Curiosity and commitment to continuous learning, staying up to date with tools and trends in design systems, front-end development, and AI. What is the application process? We do our best to bring on individuals who will be excited about their role and have the potential for a great future with Testlio. Since we are 100% distributed, we’d like you to meet with multiple people from our organization to give you an idea of who you would be working with, your role expectations, etc. Our interview process can take about 3 to 4 weeks to complete. Application Recruiter interview TestGorilla assessment ~ 3# Team and Stakeholder interviews Reference checks Offer Diversity and Inclusion Testlio is an equal-opportunity employer deeply committed to creating an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and identities. We are female-founded, and 46% of our team members identify as women. For more information, see the DEI section of our website.

title: Technical Product Owner - producto API - scrum, agile - remoto (*A)
description: About the job BETWEEN TECHNOLOGY es una consultora multinacional que cuenta con avanzadas capacidades tecnológicas en el ámbito de la Ingeniería y las TIC. Nuestros servicios llegan a todos los continentes y cubren varios sectores de la economía mundial, de la industria y las empresas de servicios. En la actualidad BETWEEN cuenta con un equipo de 1000 personas trabajando en los ámbitos de la industria del automóvil, Oil&Gas, retail, etc. Actualmente estamos ampliando nuestro equipo y seleccionamos un/a Product Owner especializado/a en producto API y con amplia experiencia velando por la entrega continua del Software de valor al negocio, para un proyecto estable e indefinido en el sector retail y en Ecommerce. La persona seleccionada colaborará en un gran proyecto tecnológico bajo metodología ágil, con equipos colaborativos y no jerárquicos, con alto grado de proactividad y responsabilidad. ¿Qué haré? Gestionar y negociar el roadmap con stakeholders de iniciativas propias y demandadas de los productos de Data Privacy y Fraud. Ser el último responsable del backlog del producto. Trabajar en la definición junto al equipo de desarrollo. ¿Cómo lo haré? Trabajarás con el UPO de la unidad o CPO de para conocer las necesidades de tus stakeholders y plantear un roadmap adecuado de los productos del equipo. Con el equipo de desarrollo formado por un TL y desarrolladores. Diseñarás y pensarás nuevas funcionalidades propias del producto que sean de utilidad. Entenderás bien las necesidades que vayan surgiendo de los clientes integradores del servicio y stakeholders. Aplicarás técnicas de priorización y medición de impacto de iniciativas para su negociación. Trabajarás con el equipo de desarrollo para conseguir las mejores soluciones trasladando las necesidades y resolviendo dudas y bloqueos funcionales. Objetivo: Impulsar el producto lo más lejos posible y asegurarse de que su equipo aporte valor al negocio. Tus Funciones Comunicar con las partes interesadas en todos los ámbitos relacionados con producto, incluido el equipo de desarrollo para asegurar que las metas son claras y la visión esté alineada con los objetivos estratégicos de la empresa. Ayudar al equipo a mantener esa visión mediante la creación de una hoja de ruta del producto. Trabajar con la dirección como parte interesada para crear un producto que se adapte a sus objetivos estratégicos. Trabajar en productos internos, identificar y ayudar a los clientes internos a comprender el modelo de negocio y la propuesta de valor. Sopesar las prioridades de acuerdo con las necesidades y los objetivos de las partes interesadas. Jugar siempre con las variables de alcance, presupuesto y tiempo. Con la visión, la estrategia y las prioridades del producto definidas, supervisarás el desarrollo real del producto. Definir métricas de productos y su uso durante el proceso de desarrollo de los mismos. Conocer en profundidad el producto para anticiparse/resolver a problemas o necesidades y buscar soluciones. Servir de voz del usuario, representando siempre sus necesidades e intereses. Para respaldar sus decisiones, deberá medir el éxito del producto con los datos reales del usuario. Entorno de trabajo Agile / Scrum. Además, trabajando para BETWEEN obtendrás los siguientes beneficios añadidos: Planes de formación con BTW University (Idiomas, Power Business School, Udemy, Certificaciones técnicas, Pharos). Seguro médico gratuito desde el primer día. Retribución flexible: tickets restaurante, guardería, etc. Acceso a variedad de descuentos (Viajes, tecnología y más). Precios reducidos en bienestar, fitness y nutrición con Gympass. ¡Cumplir años como Betweener tiene premio! Requisitos REQUISITOS Indispensables Experiencia como Product Manager o Product Owner. Experiencia de producto API: al ser un comercio electrónico construido como una plataforma de microservicio, y algunos de los productos se ofrecen a través de API. Si está familiarizado con la definición de API como un producto y está familiarizado con el enfoque APIFirst, será especialmente bienvenido en algunos productos. Experiencia en entornos de trabajo Agile / Scrum. Experiencia en la toma de decisiones basada en datos. Experiencia en negociación con stakeholders y consumidores. Experiencia trabajando en la orientación a objetivos y resultado. Deseables Experiencia en contextos de ecommerce. Experiencia previa trabajando con objetivos y resultados clave (OKRs). Conocimientos de DDD.

title: [Full Remote] Junior Marketing
description: About the job Nuestro objetivo es ayudar a todos los recién graduados del mundo a encontrar el trabajo que más se ajuste a sus ambiciones: ¡únete a nosotros para hacer realidad las aspiraciones de una comunidad de más de 1,000,000 usuarios! Buscamos constantemente estudiantes y graduados que aspiren a unirse a nuestro equipo de Marketing: postula para estos puestos y nuestro equipo de RRHH se comunicará contigo tan pronto como abramos un puesto en Marketing y tu CV sea adecuado al perfil buscado. Para todos los puestos Junior en el ámbito del marketing ofrecemos un contrato de prácticas o colaboración remunerada (1.000 € al mes) con el objetivo de conseguir un empleo fijo, tendrás la oportunidad de crecer exponencialmente gracias a la formación en el puesto, podrás para trabajar de forma totalmente remota todo el tiempo que quieras y te proporcionaremos una MacBook de última generación. ¡Nos vamos a España! Si quieres ayudar a Joinrs a crecer en tu país, envía tu CV para este anuncio: si tu perfil encaja en uno de nuestros futuros puestos, nos pondremos en contacto contigo ;) -- Dentro del equipo de Marketing podrás abordar diversas tareas como: Creación de la estrategia de Marketing Digital: junto con el CMO definirás la mejor estrategia para dar a conocer Joinrs a todos los estudiantes y egresados de los países de destino. Soporte de gestión de redes sociales: participará en la planificación y ejecución de estrategias de redes sociales, la creación de contenido atractivo y la interacción con nuestra comunidad en línea. Aprenderás a utilizar plataformas como Facebook, TikTok, Threads, Instagram y X para aumentar la visibilidad de la marca. Creación de contenido digital: participará en la creación de contenido digital, incluidas publicaciones de blog, artículos, marketing por correo electrónico y más. Tendrá la oportunidad de desarrollar sus habilidades de redacción y ayudar a mantener una presencia en línea relevante y atractiva. Análisis de Métricas de Marketing: junto con el Analista de Datos, utilizarás herramientas analíticas para monitorear el desempeño de las campañas digitales. Analizará métricas clave como el tráfico del sitio web, la conversión y la participación en las redes sociales, realizando mejoras basadas en datos. Performance Marketing, Campañas de Publicidad Online y Publicidad: Colaborarás en la creación y gestión de campañas de publicidad online a través de plataformas como Google Ads y publicidad en redes sociales. Participará en la elección de palabras clave, la creación de anuncios atractivos y la optimización del rendimiento. SEO (Search Engine Optimization): Aprenderás los conceptos básicos del posicionamiento en buscadores, ayudando a mejorar la visibilidad de nuestro sitio web. Te ocuparás de la investigación de palabras clave, la construcción de enlaces y otras prácticas de SEO para aumentar la clasificación en los motores de búsqueda. Diseño Gráfico: Si tienes habilidades en Adobe, Figma, Canva o similares, tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar con nuestros diseñadores gráficos para crear contenido para redes sociales, para nuestro sitio web, para campañas publicitarias y gadgets offline. Lo que te ofrecemos Trabajar en el equipo de Joinrs significa poder elegir siempre las mejores condiciones psicofísicas para estar sereno y productivo. Esto se traduce en: Trabajo remoto y flexibilidad. Tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar completamente a distancia todo el tiempo que desees, pero también apoyarte en una de nuestras oficinas. Ambiente de trabajo dinámico. Nuestras oficinas siempre están abiertas. Te garantizamos espacios de trabajo compartidos, salas de reuniones, áreas de descanso y un bar con frutas frescas y aperitivos de todo tipo. También encontrarás una mesa de billar y una estación de juegos. Queremos un ambiente de trabajo informal que fomente momentos de compartir, siempre respetando las actividades individuales. Team building y diversión. Organizamos a menudo aperitivos, juegos y momentos de recreo: son parte integral de la vida en Joinrs, tanto fuera como dentro de la oficina. Bienestar empresarial. Te garantizamos un bienestar empresarial privado a la altura de tus expectativas. Paquete tecnológico. Utilizarás software avanzado y tecnologías modernas, y se te proporcionará un MacBook de última generación. Formación. Siempre contarás con un tutor en tu trayectoria en Joinrs: tendrás un punto de referencia tanto para los aspectos técnicos como para los del equipo. Te aseguramos un crecimiento profesional constante que se traducirá en un aumento progresivo de tus responsabilidades. Podrás participar en eventos del sector y cursos de formación, además de recibir formación continua en las mejores plataformas de aprendizaje en línea. Impacto social. Tu contribución apoyará a miles de recién graduados a encontrar el trabajo al que aspiran: tendrás la oportunidad de interactuar con nuestra comunidad y descubrir el impacto social y la revolución que estamos llevando más allá de las fronteras italianas. Quiénes somos Nuestra misión es apoyar a cada recién graduado a lograr sus aspiraciones, permitiéndole comenzar su nueva carrera con el optimismo de una perspectiva clara. Somos un equipo unido que cree firmemente en el trabajo en equipo: juntos trabajamos, discutimos y obtenemos resultados que nos estimulan a alcanzar objetivos cada vez más ambiciosos. Nuestra comunidad cuenta con más de 1,000,000 miembros en Italia, Reino Unido, España, Brasil, Francia, Portugal y Alemania, incluyendo 300 empresas como PwC, Unilever, Gi Group, Danone, Siemens, y está creciendo de manera exponencial: ¡únete a nosotros! Contrato y Remuneración: Para todos los puestos de Junior Marketing ofrecemos un contrato de prácticas de 6 meses con un salario de 1,000 € al mes, con el objetivo de un contrato indefinido. Se programará una revisión salarial cada seis meses, y tu remuneración crecerá rápidamente a medida que acumules experiencia y la traduzcas en un impacto cada vez mayor. Proceso de selección: 1. Revisión del CV: el primer paso es una revisión del currículum (generalmente dentro de los 20 días posteriores a la solicitud). 2. Entrevista telefónica: el segundo paso incluirá una entrevista telefónica con nuestro Gerente de Recursos Humanos de aproximadamente 15 minutos. 3. Entrevista por video: el último paso será una entrevista por video con tanto el Gerente de Recursos Humanos como tu futuro supervisor. Prevemos al menos 45 minutos de entrevista. ¿Por qué unirte a nuestro equipo? Impacto social: tendrás la oportunidad de apoyar a nuestra comunidad para que logren sus aspiraciones. Y las tuyas. Startup exitosa: Joinrs fue seleccionada entre las 10 mejores startups del mundo en la Web Summit de Lisboa. Crecimiento personal exponencial: tendrás la oportunidad de crecer de manera exponencial, tanto en habilidades técnicas como en habilidades blandas, gracias a un programa de formación basado en la capacitación en el trabajo y el apoyo en línea.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description: About the job BioCatch is the leader in Behavioral Biometrics, a technology that leverages machine learning to analyze an online user’s physical and cognitive digital behavior to protect individuals online. BioCatch’s mission is to unlock the power of behavior and deliver actionable insights to create a digital world where identity, trust, and ease coexist. Today, 32 of the world's largest 100 banks and 210 total financial institutions rely on BioCatch Connect™ to combat fraud, facilitate digital transformation, and grow customer relationships.. BioCatch’s Client Innovation Board, an industry-led initiative including American Express, Barclays, Citi Ventures, and National Australia Bank, helps BioCatch to identify creative and cutting-edge ways to leverage the unique attributes of behavior for fraud prevention. With over a decade of analyzing data, more than 80 registered patents, and unparalleled experience, BioCatch continues to innovate to solve tomorrow’s problems. For more information, please visit www.biocatch.com. About the Role Reporting to the VP of Product Marketing, the Product Marketing Manager will support the execution of key product marketing initiatives. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who has a few years of Product Marketing experience under their belt to hone their skills in a fast-paced, highly innovative tech environment. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams—including Product, Program Management, Sales, and Marketing—and be hands-on with market analysis, content creation, product positioning, and sales enablement. Key Responsibilities Assist in developing marketing content and collateral such as product one-pagers, customer decks, FAQs, and training materials. Support sales enablement efforts by organizing product training sessions and maintaining up-to-date resources for go-to-market teams. Help translate technical product features into clear, compelling messaging tailored to different audiences. Coordinate competitive research and assist with gathering and synthesizing industry trends and insights. Collaborate with Product Management to help track product roadmaps and maintain updated demo materials. Participate in cross-functional team meetings to stay aligned on product updates and initiatives. Maintain shared documentation and internal tools to ensure consistency and access to marketing materials. Desired Skills and Experience Proven experience (3+ years) as a Product Marketing Manager/Product Manager or similar role in the B2B Technology Space (Cybersecurity is an advantage)Experience in market analysisFamiliar with product marketing tactics (e.g. integrated product launch)Excellent communication skillsStrong interpersonal skills; Team PlayerKeen eye for detailCreativityAnalytical mind and strong quantitative skillsBSc/BA in Marketing, Communications, Computer Sciences or equivalent; MBA an advantage Location: Preferred location Germany, Spain - remoteIsrael - hybridSecondary: France - remote

title: Product Manager ITIL
description: About the job Are you interested in working with a leading education technology player, the global leader in the assessment and certification of professional skills industry with presence in more than 200 countries worldwide? If so, this is the chance to apply now! 📥 PeopleCert is looking for a Product Manager to help take our ITIL portfolio of Best Practice to the next level of success - developing compelling propositions for globally recognised ITIL products that ensure wide adoption among senior audiences, new sectors and markets. You will be responsible for the success of the key products of the ITIL portfolio, including certifications, learning content and publications. As Product Manager for the ITIL portfolio, you will work closely with teams across the business in order to deliver the overall roadmap and achieve commercial success for the product set within the ITIL portfolio. As Product Manager ITIL your tasks will be the following: Product strategy and vision Define and articulate the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for your product set within the ITIL portfolio Conduct market research and analysis to identify trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape that will inform the product strategy Establish clear product goals, KPIs, and success metrics Product management Monitor and analyze product performance, making data-driven decisions to optimize and enhance your products Prioritise maintenance and improvement activities for your in-market products, to ensure continued relevance and positive customer experience New product development Work proactively and collaboratively with teams across the business to ensure all aspects of product development, launch and in-market support are considered early in the business case and product design phase Ensure the successful development and launch of new or updated products Participate in all aspects of Product design, including: persona development; full end-to-end user journeys; service blueprints; key content and technical specifications Design and manage the testing strategy for all products in development, to ensure they are consistently meeting the needs of our target audiences Stakeholder collaboration Contribute key elements to the go-to-market plans developed by Marketing, including positioning, key messaging, pricing, and more Engage with internal and external stakeholders to secure buy-in and understanding of the product vision What we look for: Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or related field. Minimum of 3 years' experience in a Product Manager or Product Owner role in one of the following sectors: education, training, professional qualifications (e.g. ACA / CIPD etc.) Knowledge of PeopleCert best practices and ideally familiar with ITIL or other similar service or product management certification products Proven track record of managing multiple products and delivering successful outcomes Demonstrable experience of managing ITIL products through their whole lifecycle Familiarity with all elements of product development, from discovery to delivery Proven ability to evaluate product feedback objectively, and propose solutions to address business needs Strong business/commercial acumen Excellent people and management skills to interact with colleagues, cross-functional teams, and third parties around the world Problem-solving and analytical capabilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, fluency in English is required (C2 level certification desired, LanguageCert C2 LTE or C2 IESOL certificate would be a plus) What we offer: The opportunity to shape globally recognized frameworks used by professionals around the world A collaborative, high-impact international team and a purpose-driven working culture Flexible working conditions (location and hours) Two free vouchers for all certifications from PeopleCert's Portfolio per year for all employees 🎓 Competitive compensation and personal development opportunities A global network of professionals and subject matter experts If you want to become a member of our international, dynamic and agile team that creates world leading software products, then we should certainly like to hear from you! About PeopleCert PeopleCert is a global leader in assessment and certification of professional skills, partnering with multi-national organizations and government bodies for the development & delivery of standardized exams. Delivering exams across 200 countries and in 25 languages over its state-of-the-art assessment technology, PeopleCert enables professionals to boost their careers and realize their life ambitions. Quality, Innovation, Passion, Integrity are the core values which guide everything we do. Our offices in UK, Greece, and Cyprus boast a culture of diversity, where everyone is different, yet everyone fits in. All of us at PeopleCert are committed to the reflection of the diversity and inclusion of our customers and the communities in which we do business. Working on Home Office (HO) Secure English Language Tests (SELTs) Any person who is engaged by PeopleCert to work on the SELT service must undergo a Background Check (the results of which must be acceptable to PeopleCert and the HO) prior to commencing their SELT duties. All SELT personnel will be required to complete a declaration (provided by PeopleCert) where the existence of any criminal record and/or bankruptcy must be declared. If working on the SELT service in the UK, background checks will include: A basic or enhanced Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) check Right to Work in the UK check (including nationality, identity and place of residence) HO security check (Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) or Counter Terrorist Check (CTC) Financial background check Employment reference check If working on the SELT service anywhere in the world (outside of the UK) personnel will undergo background checks that are equivalent to those stated for the UK In addition, if personnel are required to speak to SELT candidates they must be appropriately skilled in English language and, where SELT services are provided anywhere in the world (outside of the UK), the official language of the relevant country. All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

title: Product Manager - Supplements (Remote from Europe)
description: About the job Jobgether has ALL remote jobs globally. We match you to roles where you're most likely to succeed and provide feedback on every application to help you learn. No more guesswork, application black holes, or recruiter ghosting in your job search. For one of our clients, looking for a Product Manager, remotely from Europe, who will take ownership of improving their supplement products, focusing on taste, packaging, and customer experience. The ideal candidate will leverage customer feedback from surveys and calls to drive meaningful changes and ensure that our offerings exceed customer expectations. Key Responsibilities: Customer Feedback & Insights: Gather, analyze and act on customer feedback through surveys, reviews, and direct calls Product Optimization: Work closely with manufacturers and suppliers to enhance product taste, formulation, and packaging Market & Competitor Research: Conduct in-depth market research to understand industry trends and benchmark against competitors Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with marketing, supply chain, and design teams to align product improvements with brand positioning Data-Driven decision making: Utilize data analytics to measure the success of product improvements and iterate accordingly Regulatory Compliance: Ensure all product changes comply with industry regulations and quality standards Customer Experience Enhancement: Develop strategies to improve the unboxing experience, branding, and overall product experience Requirements Who you are: We are looking for someone who is proactive, strategic, and able to drive product innovation through customer insights. Must-Have Qualifications: 3+ Years of experience in product management within the supplements or health & wellness industry Proven experience in improving product taste, formulation, and packaging Strong understanding of customer behavior, survey methodologies, and product testing Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities Experience working remotely Strong project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional teams Excellent written and verbal communication skills Exceptional analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools (Excel, Google Analytics, or similar tools) Nice-to-Have Qualifications: Experience with -ecommerce platform (Shopify, amazon, or similar) Knowledge of packaging design trends and sustainable materials Familiarity with A/B testing and user experience (UX) research Hands-on experience as a Product designer Benefits Flexible, part-time, or hourly work - ideal for experienced professionals looking for project-base engagement Opportunity to shape innovative products in a growing e-commerce company Work directly with leadership to make an immediate impact Fast-paced and dynamic work environment where your contributions are valued Fully remote role with the ability to work from anywhere, overlapping hours with Central European time zone

title: Product Manager
description: About the job CoinsPaid offers ready-to-use crypto payment solutions tailored to business’ every need. Standing at the forefront of mass adoption, our products help businesses gear up for the new era of digital assets. We showed a tremendous growth in terms of transactions and volumes since 2019 and in 2023 were marked by Forbes as the "Best Crypto Payment Gateway for High-Volume Transactions". Headquartered in Estonia and having 3 international hubs, we are still a remote-first company with employees working from 30+ countries around the world. At CoinsPaid, we are passionate about crypto, fintech and are putting great effort into building a team that will get the world ready for every-day crypto use. If these feel close to you - give us a shout! We’re looking for a Product Manager to lead the development of our Crypto Aggregator, a product designed for seamless integration between crypto ecosystem and liquidity providers. In this role, you’ll prioritize and develop requests from multiple teams and stakeholders, evaluating and balancing their needs to determine which system components should be delivered first and why. Responsibilities: Participation in strategic planning and goals of the product line in the area of crypto services development Develop and maintain the product roadmap, including priorities and timelines Work closely with development and testing teams to ensure the successful implementation of product tasks Monitor the market and competitors to identify new opportunities and enhancements Describes and validates the business logic of solutions Understands the delivered value, and has a clear understanding of the ecosystem in which the service operates Identify and address problems promptly to ensure smooth product development Clearly and concisely communicate the business value of solutions to the team and stakeholders Requirements: 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager or Product Owner, preferably in the crypto, payments or fintech domain Solid understanding of the product development lifecycle, including experience in guiding projects from concept to delivery and coordinating across various stages of development Proven ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and various internal departments, to align on goals, priorities, and deliverables Skilled in evaluating and prioritizing requests from multiple teams, balancing competing needs, and making data-driven decisions to deliver the most impactful components Strong analytical skills to assess system requirements and user workflows, with excellent organizational skills to manage priorities and roadmap execution Knowledge of Centralized Exchanges (CEX) and familiarity with Decentralized Exchanges (DEX) and their principles of operation will be an advantage Nice to have: Experience in creating and managing products in the FinTech, Crypto or B2B space Knowledge of exchange operations: Understands how exchanges work, including order books, order execution, liquidity management, risk management, and hedging strategies Experience in technical projects and a focus on backend development, with no interface work, will be a plus Understanding of working with the acquiring / payment processing Understanding compliance requirements: knowledge of regulatory requirements for reporting and financial control Data analysis and BI tools: skills in working with business intelligence tools and building reports Why should you choose CoinsPaid? To become a part of this solid team, passionate about their jobs and the crypto industry as a whole. To feel a great team spirit and meet people supporting each other's growth and development. To become a part of a rapidly developing international company and a crypto payments leader. title: Senior Product Manager EdTech (H/M)
description: About the job ¡Sé el próximo Senior Product Manager que impulse el futuro de la educación! En Northius, grupo líder de formación online en España, estamos revolucionando la forma en que miles de personas acceden a la educación. Con +10 escuelas, +40.000 nuevos estudiantes cada año y presencia en más de 17 países, nuestra misión es clara: hacer que la educación sea accesible y aplicable para la inserción y el crecimiento laboral. Si eres un explorador de problemas, un innovador apasionado y crees que puedes ser parte de esta misión, ¡sigue leyendo!. Challenge: Convertir Northius en una compañía EdTech A nivel de Producto Digital podríamos decir que tenemos todo por hacer. Hasta ahora, hemos invertido en los portales de las escuelas (Wordpress), la plataforma de ventas (Salesforce), en las plataformas de formación (Moodle y DNN) y en la plataforma de facturación (Business Central). Somos conscientes de que el acompañamiento de nuestros alumnos es clave para acercarlos aún más a su objetivo: la empleabilidad. Ya sea a través de personas, AI agents, procesos automáticos o lo que el futuro nos traiga. Esto requiere de mucho trabajo de producto, entender los procesos actuales y proponer otros nuevos que mejoren la experiencia del alumno. Estamos haciendo crecer el equipo de Producto, Ingeniería y Datos que está construyendo estos Productos Digitales con un enfoque Lean. Dividimos nuestros Customer Journey en áreas, en cada una de ellas trabaja un squad multidisciplinar con personas de Producto (PM), Ingeniería (EM, FE, FS, BE) y Datos (DA, PD) que tienen OKRs por trimestre y un KPI principal. Cada squad trabaja en el día a día con metodologías ágiles (Scrum, Sprints de 2 semanas) y tiene la autonomía para identificar problemas y proponer soluciones que mejoren su KPI y OKRs. ¿Qué buscamos? Estamos en la búsqueda de un/a Senior Product Manager que lidere con visión y pasión la transformación de la educación. Queremos a alguien que pueda tomar decisiones con la misma confianza que tiene para liderar experimentos; una persona capaz de decir: "lo validamos con datos". Alguien que no teme cometer errores porque sabe que de ellos se aprende, y solo aprendiendo podemos crecer para ayudar a nuestros alumnos. En suma, una persona que esté lista para ayudar a Northius a construir una experiencia educativa moderna y de alto impacto. Tu misión Serás la piedra angular de un equipo product-led, user-centric y lean, con un enfoque total en mejorar la experiencia educativa a través de los Servicios Educativos. Junto al equipo de Producto, Data & Tecnología, tu trabajo será moldear y liderar cada etapa del ciclo de vida de nuestros productos del área, desde la concepción hasta el análisis post-lanzamiento. Trabajarás de la mano de ingenieros, diseñadores, marketers, y stakeholders para garantizar que los estudiantes de Northius reciban una educación que puedan aplicar en su vida, permitiéndoles cumplir sus sueños. ¿Qué harás? Liderar la gestión del ciclo de vida completo del producto enfocado en los servicios educativos que rodean a nuestras formaciones: Atención al Alumno, Tutoras, Docentes, Calidad, Secretaría Académica. Diseñar estrategias de producto basadas en procesos de Discovery, utilizando metodologías como OST o JTBD para entender cómo impactar directamente en la vida de nuestros usuarios. Trabajar de cerca con los equipos de ingeniería, marketing, ventas y soporte, para ofrecer una experiencia educativa moderna que realmente marque una diferencia en la vida de nuestros estudiantes. Si bien trabajarás codo a codo con profesionales de Data Science y Data Analytics, debes ser un referente en el análisis de datos, definiendo y midiendo los KPIs, utilizando insights para mejorar nuestros productos y tomar decisiones sólidas y bien fundamentadas. Mentorizar y colaborar con el equipo, ayudando a desarrollar talento y potenciando una cultura de aprendizaje continuo y liderazgo compartido. Evangelizar a los stakeholders y equipos de otras áreas importantes para avanzar hacia una experiencia impresionante para el alumno. Esto requiere soft skills de nivel senior para asistir en la transformación cultural de la empresa. ¿Qué necesitamos de ti? 5+ años de experiencia en gestión de productos digitales, idealmente en EdTech, SaaS o tecnología. Sólidas habilidades analíticas y experiencia en Continuous Discovery, capaz de diseñar y ejecutar experimentos que generen valor real. Pasión por resolver problemas complejos con soluciones creativas y basadas en datos, en especial aplicables a mejorar cómo damos servicio al alumno. Si es tu otra vida fuiste un Data Analyst o similar, ¡sumas punto extra! Habilidad para trabajar en entornos ágiles y colaborativos. No solo lo conoces; creen realmente en ello y no ves otra forma de trabajar. Experiencia trabajando con equipos interfuncionales y gestionando múltiples stakeholders, incluyendo altos directivos. Un enfoque claro hacia los resultados y la experiencia del alumno: student-centric y orientado a crear productos que aporten valor real. ¡También sumas si tienes experiencia o conocimientos profundos de process management! ¿Qué te ofrecemos? Formar parte del equipo de Producto, Data & Tecnología (PED) de una empresa que está transformando el sector educativo. Posibilidad de trabajar 100% remoto desde cualquier parte de España o asistir a nuestras oficinas en Madrid, A Coruña ó Barcelona. Horario flexible para que puedas equilibrar tus responsabilidades personales y laborales. Jornada intensiva en verano, todos los viernes y las vísperas de festivos. Un plan de formación y desarrollo para que sigas creciendo profesionalmente. Una cultura que valora la colaboración, el uso de datos para tomar decisiones, y donde equivocarse es parte del proceso de aprendizaje. Acceso a beneficios como seguro médico, cheque gourmet, y descuentos en servicios de bienestar. En Northius creemos que la educación cambia vidas. Ayúdanos a seguir construyendo esos cimientos que permiten a las personas soñar y crecer. Si quieres unirte a una empresa que no solo educa, sino que transforma, ¡este es tu lugar! ¿Con quién vas a trabajar? En Northius Trabajamos Más De 1400 Empleados, Pero El Equipo De Producto, Ingeniería y Datos Acaba De Crearse En 2023. Éstas Son Algunas De Las Personas Que Lo Lideran y Con Las Que Trabajarías En El Día a Día Federico Heinen (Head of Product): Ex-Mercado Libre y Ex-LATAM Airlines, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el mundo online, interacciones digitales y gestión de productos en entornos B2C, B2B y B2B2C. Alberto Baselga (CIO): Ex-Coverwallet y enamorado de los ecosistemas de producto. Es un Startup Advisor e Investor y toda su carrera ha girado en torno a compañías digitales de alta generación de impacto. Antonio Espinosa (Head of Engineering): Ex-Ontruck y Ex-Jobandtalent, con más de 6 años de experiencia liderando equipos de ingeniería. Está haciendo crecer el equipo de ingeniería. Daniel Ruiz (Head of Applied AI): Ex-Coverwallet y Ex-Cabify. Experto en inteligencia artificial aplicada con una sólida trayectoria en ciencia de datos y análisis de producto. Antonio Corzo (Head of Agile Ops): Ex- Capitole y Ex-Atlax 360. Apasionado por los retos, maximiza la productividad de los equipos y fomenta la colaboración. Cree en el valor de las personas y sus interacciones. ¿Estás listo/a para impactar el futuro de miles de personas? ¡Aplica ahora! #PeopleOnTop #Remoto #Northius

title: Product Manager - Group Meetings and Events
description: About the job About Duetto Duetto is a leading provider of revenue management solutions for the hospitality industry, delivering a modern, cloud-based platform that helps hotels, resorts, and casinos optimize pricing and profitability. Our solutions simplify distribution complexity, increase conversion rates, and enhance operational efficiency. With customers in over 60 countries, we are on a mission to be the most trusted and widely used hotel technology company in the world. About OpenSpace OpenSpace is Duetto's innovative revenue management solution and booking engine tailored for meeting and event spaces. It provides algorithm-based pricing for various events, enabling hotels to dynamically optimize all function spaces, including meeting rooms, conferences, and banquet spaces. The solution also includes a booking engine and quotation tool, streamlining the search process for event planners seeking spaces that match their budget and specific requirements. Role Overview We are seeking a Product Manager based in Germany, Spain or the UK to lead the development and enhancement of our OpenSpace product. This is a fully remote role, working closely with global teams across Product, Engineering, UX, and Customer Success. Key Responsibilities Product Strategy & Vision: Define and communicate the product vision and strategy for OpenSpace, aligning with Duetto's overall mission and goals. Market Research: Conduct thorough market analysis to understand the needs of the Meetings, Incentives, Conferences, and Events (MICE) industry, ensuring OpenSpace addresses current and future customer requirements. Product Development: Collaborate with engineering and design teams to develop features that enhance event space profitability and streamline booking efficiency. Customer Engagement: Engage with customers to gather feedback, identify pain points, and validate product enhancements. Ensure OpenSpace delivers real value to event planners and hospitality providers. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success teams to support go-to-market strategies, drive product adoption, and ensure a seamless customer experience. Performance Monitoring: Define, monitor, and analyze key performance metrics for OpenSpace, using insights to iterate and improve the product continuously. Qualifications Experience: 3+ years of B2B product management experience, preferably within the hospitality technology sector or related fields. Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with revenue management systems and the MICE industry is a strong plus. Analytical Skills: Proven ability to analyze complex data sets and make data-driven decisions. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present to and work with executives, partners, and customers. In German and in English. Technical Aptitude: Comfortable working closely with engineering teams to evaluate different approaches to implementing product features, weighing cost/benefit trade-offs, and breaking down large technical projects. Education: Bachelor's degree or higher in a relevant field. Why Join Duetto? Innovative Environment: Be part of a company that is revolutionizing the hospitality industry with cutting-edge technology solutions. Global Impact: Work with a diverse team serving clients across the globe, influencing how hotels and event spaces optimize their revenue. Professional Growth: Opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement in a fast-growing company. Flexible Work: Enjoy the benefits of a fully remote role with the flexibility to work from anywhere in Europe. If you are a passionate product leader looking to drive innovation in the hospitality tech space, we'd love to hear from you! About Duetto: Duetto delivers a suite of SaaS cloud-native applications for hospitality businesses to optimize every booking opportunity for greater revenue impact. The unique combination of hospitality experience and technology leadership drives Duetto to look for innovative solutions to industry challenges. The software as a service platform allows hotels, casinos, and resorts to leverage real-time dynamic data sources and actionable insights into pricing and demand across the enterprise. For more information, please visit https://www.duettocloud.com/.

title: Junior Product Manager
description: About the job Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution. The company is founder led, profitable and growing. Canonical’s product management team are technologists who have a passion for delivering products and solutions that help shape market demands while elevating open source software everywhere. This is a general application track for the product management positions at Canonical. You will set a clear vision, prioritize work effectively, and ensure the team delivers high-quality products that meet business and user needs. Apply here if you excel at leadership, communication, and technical vision, and believe you can drive product strategy for the business needs of tomorrow. During the interview process we will identify specific software products which would be a good fit for your interests. We believe that open source is transforming the way that enterprises solve their business needs. Although open source has been around for thirty years, it is only now fundamental to every corner of the software landscape. Going forward we believe open source will have an even bigger impact as it moves into specialised vertical markets. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of ‘most software to most companies’, starting with Ubuntu but expanding to cover every class of application on every class of compute. To deliver on that ambition, we select product managers for their intellect and strong drive to advance the open source community. Together, we aim to improve open source quality, outreach, and impact. Our product managers set the vision and the direction to ensure teams deliver the right products in the right markets at the right time. They push the boundaries of the technology landscape to identify and deliver products into new and existing market opportunities. Our product managers are technology professionals with a software engineering background who strive to become business executives and entrepreneurs. We discuss strategy, plan product development, drive engagement, and promote the open source way. We oversee the entire product lifecycle from conception to delivery, blending technical expertise, strategic thinking, analytics, project management skills and effective communication to ensure products meet both user needs and business objectives. We have open product manager roles across a wide range of product domains, including: Ubuntu Platform - Our Ubuntu experience on Desktop, Server, Windows (WSL), Multipass, Gaming, Enterprise, & Hardware Enablement Ubuntu Pro Services - Our key commercial offerings Ubuntu Pro, Compliance, Standards, Security Engineering, and Managed Services on cloud and on prem AI/ML & MLOps - Open source AI/ML solutions, AIOps automation, model lifecycle management, Kubeflow, MLFlow, KServe, and AI infrastructure on cloud and edge IoT - Ubuntu on embedded devices and/or edge servers, device management, and robotics Cloud - Ubuntu in public and private clouds, promoting automation frameworks, and including technologies such as Kubernetes, MAAS, and LXD Telco - Open source for Telco's including technologies and standards related to Core Network, RAN/vRAN, SoNIC, DENT, and SmartNICs Finance - Open source solutions for financial institutions including trading platforms, blockchain technologies, regulatory compliance, and AI-driven analytics Automotive - Open source solutions for autonomous driving, in-vehicle infotainment, connected vehicles, and compliance with automotive industry standards such as ISO 26262 and ISO 21434 Application Management - Open source solutions in the enterprise including Observability, IAM, App Stores and technologies such Grafana, GitOps, and Juju Charms If your domain of expertise isn’t listed above, yet you feel it’s relevant to Canonical, then feel free to apply anyway. We will route you to the most suitable team. Location: These roles are home based in the EMEA time zone. You will be expected to be located in this region. The role entails Lead the product development lifecycle, reviewing the priorities and goals for your product Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as engineering, design, marketing, and sales Address common challenges across projects, align on priorities, enable informed decisions, and keep business execution on track Conduct market research, analyse industry trends, and gather customer feedback to identify opportunities Communicate your product vision, status updates, and key decisions to ensure alignment and manage expectations Conduct usability testing, analyse user feedback, and iterate on the product to improve the user experience Collaborate with marketing, sales, and support teams to develop go-to-market strategies, create product documentation, and provide training Contribute to the success of our sales team in winning new opportunities, reviewing customer feedback and participating in customer meetings Oversee the work of a product line, ensuring consistency in strategy and execution across different teams Facilitate collaboration and resolve conflicts within different teams and across other departments What we are looking for in you Exceptional academic results at high school and university Understanding of Linux and the wider open source software community Understanding of computer architecture, application development, datacenters, cloud or devices Passion to write about technologies and the tech landscape A strong work ethic, and personal interests aligned with the open source movement Curiosity, and the habit of continuous learning A strong sense of ownership Problem solving and the ability to innovate Outstanding communications skills in English, both verbal and written Ability to manage multiple projects or product lines while maintaining focus on key priorities Willingness to travel internationally up to 4 times a year for company events up to two weeks long Additional Skills That We Value Familiarity with a particular verticals (e.g. Telco, Finance, Industrial, Automotive) Familiarity with the technology ecosystem including Silicon, IHV, ISV, ODM/OEMs, cloud service providers and channel Familiarity with cloud native technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker containers & Snaps Familiarity with embedded and connected device technology and ecosystems Familiarity with networking technologies - ethernet, IPv4 and IPv6, routing, firewalling, overlays such as OVN/OVS, VPNs, SR-IOV, infiniband Familiarity with telco networking - RAN, Core, CPE Experience in leading distributed teams across different time zones Demonstrated ability to foster collaboration and innovation in team settings What we offer you We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally. Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual holiday leave Maternity and paternity leave Employee Assistance Program Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events About Canonical Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical is an equal opportunity employer We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Funnel Strategy Mananger
description: About the job ¿Eres una persona con mentalidad analítica, pasión por los funnels y obsesionada con la conversión y la eficiencia en marketing digital? Entonces esta posición es para ti 🚀 En Monest Capital estamos buscando una persona estratégica y ejecutora que lidere la evolución de nuestro funnel de captación de clientes. Serás la figura clave para maximizar la conversión, reducir costes y asegurar que todas las iniciativas de captación funcionen como un reloj suizo. Te moverás entre datos, tecnología y operaciones. Tendrás ownership total del funnel y del cumplimiento de los KPIs, liderando proyectos, implantando nuevas herramientas, y proponiendo mejoras con foco en performance. Si te apasiona la mejora continua, las herramientas digitales y el impacto directo en negocio, este es tu sitio. 🎯 Responsabilidades Principales Ser el responsable absoluto del funnel de captación: control de métricas, análisis diario y reporting riguroso. Identificar cuellos de botella, detectar oportunidades de mejora y definir planes de acción concretos. Liderar la implementación de nuevas herramientas, sistemas y metodologías para escalar el funnel. Impulsar acciones especiales fuera del evergreen (directos, lanzamientos) con foco en conversión. Introducir y aplicar nuevas tecnologías (automatización e inteligencia artificial) en procesos de captación. Coordinar equipos internos y externos, asegurando entregas eficientes y en plazo. ⚡ Habilidades Técnicas (Hard Skills) Dominio de performance marketing multicanal: Google, Meta, TikTok, LinkedIn, YouTube Experiencia gestionando funnels evergreen y lanzamientos digitales. Manejo avanzado de herramientas de tracking, atribución y análisis de conversión. Conocimiento funcional en automatización e inteligencia artificial aplicada al marketing (deseable). Capacidad de liderar proyectos de mejora con foco en eficiencia y resultados. 🧠 Habilidades Blandas (Soft Skills) Mentalidad analítica, estratégica y orientada a resultados. Autonomía y sentido de la responsabilidad: tú mandas sobre tu funnel. Proactividad constante y velocidad de ejecución. Capacidad de simplificar lo complejo y tomar decisiones basadas en datos. Liderazgo transversal, incluso sin jerarquía formal. 🧡 Encaje Cultural Te sientes cómodo/a en entornos cambiantes, con ritmo alto y foco claro. Tienes hambre de mejora constante y no esperas a que te digan qué hacer. Eres directo/a, transparente y te importa más el resultado que el proceso burocrático. Buscas un sitio donde confiar en ti signifique darte libertad… y también responsabilidad. 🚀 ¿Qué ofrecemos? Salario competitivo, adaptado a tu experiencia y perfil. Proyecto estable, con visión de largo plazo y vinculado al sector inmobiliario. 100% remoto y flexible: trabaja desde donde quieras (España o Andorra). Cultura ágil, cero burocracia, y un equipo donde las cosas se hacen. 22 días laborables de vacaciones + conciliación real. Posibilidades reales de crecimiento dentro del grupo. Formación continua y exposición a herramientas y metodologías punteras. Teambuildings presenciales varias veces al año en distintas ciudades. Sobre nosotros Monest Capital es una empresa de inversión especializada en el sector inmobiliario. Ayudamos a personas a invertir de forma rentable y segura, poniendo el foco en la estrategia, el análisis y la ejecución profesional. Dentro del grupo, contamos con Inversor PRO, nuestra comunidad y academia de formación donde miles de personas aprenden a invertir en inmuebles de forma práctica, clara y con resultados! Creemos en el trabajo bien hecho, la mejora constante y la transparencia como pilares para crecer. Somos un equipo joven, ambicioso y con muchas ganas de transformar el mundo de la inversión inmobiliaria en España. ¿Te suena a ti? Entonces inscríbete. Queremos que seas parte del motor de crecimiento de Monest Capital.

title: Technical Product Manager | Remote
description: About the job Technical Product Manager Our client is looking to hire a strong Product Manager to join them on a 12-month remote contract. The client requires someone that has good technical understanding - able to engage well with development units and collaborate with senior stakeholders (up to C-level) to ensure the success of the product vision. You must have worked with mobile applications, ideally B2C. The role requires working hours of 2pm-10pm CET, to overlap with global stakeholders. Responsibilities Defining the roadmap of engineering team through deep research and understanding of business goals. Draft, collect feedback on, and finalize requirements docs and functional specifications for projects to be built by the engineering team. Working with third parties to evaluate APIs and capabilities, map out integration plans. Manage and prioritize a backlog of issues Run sprints along side the engineering lead. Work cross-functionally with other product teams, marketing, operations team, customer team, and others as needed. Effectively manage dependencies to ensure that the right steps are taken in the right order. Manage new feature development including deliverables, timelines and scope of work related to new feature development. Keeping all project documents up to date, provide weekly and ad hoc project status reports. Funneling down change requests and priorities from various teams to engineering team to ensure project vision and tech roadmap is on track Improving documentation for mission-critical systems and processes. Requirements 4+ years experience with strong technical or product expertise including the ability to manage multiple Product roadmaps Strong understanding of system architecture, networks, and integration. Strong ability to communicate and collaborate across broad organizations including engineering, marketing, customer, operations, and finance. Successful experience collaborating with engineers, designers, and researchers preferably with a focus on consumer software. Ability to weigh competing priorities, manage tradeoffs and evaluate new ideas with stakeholders. Comfortable with new challenges, managing uncertainty and ambiguity with a positive can-do attitude, ability to solve issues and find solutions proactively and independently. Ability to maintain a clear focus on overarching business priorities understanding the customers’ needs and crafting improvements to meet those needs. Familiar with product development in Agile and OKR methodologies preferably with squad or tribe structures. Experience putting lean methodologies into practice: capable of finding creative ways to quickly validate assumptions underlying both problems and solutions.

title: Product Strategy Manager
description: About the job About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day. As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role In the Revolut RocketShip, there’s not many teams more important than Product. To put it simply: there’s no lift off without these guys. Frankly, there’s no rocket. Every one of our award winning features started here and all our future ones will too. This is an individual contributor role in the Strategy team, part of the CEO Office at Revolut. The team aims to identify market gaps, opportunities and actionable product initiatives that drive mass adoption of Revolut in core and expansion markets. 🚀 Its ultimate goal is to ensure that Revolut has a company-wide, consistent Product Strategy that develops the company’s vision and that each department has a Product Strategy that maximises the value of the company as a whole 🏆 What You’ll Be Doing You will be supporting senior executives and the CEO on the following areas: Developing a point of view on specific fintech verticals and defining a cohesive long term strategy for the company and product departments Acting as the eyes and ears of the company, feeding information from the market back into company strategy and department roadmaps Tracking and analysing competitive position and product performance globally Helping scope and launch new verticals for the company Defining initial product proposition and go-to-market strategies for new expansion markets together with Expansion and Territories teams What You'll Need A STEM or other highly quantitative degree from a top-tier university A track record of outstanding achievement in different areas 3+ years of experience in a top-tier strategy consulting, investment bank/PE/VC, or fast-growing technology company in a business / product / strategy role Love for problem solving and strong empathy for customers and an unwillingness to compromise on user-centred design (Good to have) Track record of building successful products (ideally financial) using data, customer feedback, common sense, and / or machine learning Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. Important notice for candidates: Job scams are on the rise.
