Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles. Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain. We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately. By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

title: Product Delivery Manager
description: About the job What‘s it like working at Koltiva? At Koltiva, we embodied honest, open, and upfront communication. We always seek and continuously improve existing tech solutions while focusing on our business users. Here, delivering value and making an impact on our customers while insisting on great standards are what we are aiming for. Who is the Koltiva Product Delivery Manager? Product Delivery Manager will be responsible leading the end-to-end delivery of our SaaS products and solutions / KoltiTrace MIS, ensuring that client requirements are met with high quality, on time, and within scope. PDM will coordinating across cross-functional teams and manages the overall delivery strategy, implementation planning, and client satisfaction throughout the product rollout process. What are the key responsibilities of the Product Delivery Manager? Develop and execute product delivery strategies aligned with product goals and client needs. Build and manage detailed delivery plans, timelines, and resource allocation. Ensure effective coordination between internal teams to meet delivery targets. Act as the primary contact for key clients during the implementation phase. Collect and tailor client feedback into continuous improvement initiatives. Liaise with Product Management, Global Market, Engineering, Customer Support, and other relevant teams to ensure a smooth handoff from development to delivery. Ensure timely communication of project status, risks, and escalations to internal and external stakeholder. Evaluate current delivery practices and identify opportunities for continuous improvement. Lead and mentor Product Delivery Officers and other implementation staff. What are the Requirement of the Position? Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (business, project management, computer science, etc.). Minimum 6 years experiences in handling product SaaS Proven experience in SaaS product delivery or similar roles. Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects concurrently. Familiarity with tools like JIRA, Confluence, Trello, or other project tracking systems is a plus. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Familiarity with Agile methodologies. Problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities. Knowledge of SaaS industry trends and best practices. This position offers flexible remote work opportunities and is open to candidates beyond Spain How do you apply? Let’s start your new journey and join our dynamic team by sending the cover letter and CV to recruitment@koltiva.com or submit it through our career portal: https://career.koltiva.com

title: Product Owner for Apps - Android (Remote)
description: About the job We are looking for an experienced Product Owner to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the end-to-end management of our Android applications, ensuring their successful execution from concept to launch and continuous improvement. You will act as the central communication point between various stakeholders, such as marketing, ASO, CRO, and development teams, to create a cohesive strategy that maximizes the app's value and profitability. Your role will focus on designing product roadmaps, documenting features, and overseeing the product life cycle, always keeping user experience and business goals in mind. How Will You Make a Difference Product Strategy & Roadmap: Develop and maintain a clear product vision and roadmap aligned with business objectives and user needs Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive product documentation, including user stories, acceptance criteria, and detailed feature specifications Stakeholder Management: Serve as the main point of contact for cross-functional teams, ensuring effective communication and collaboration between development, marketing, ASO, and CRO Feature Planning & Prioritization: Prioritize product backlog based on user feedback, analytics, and business priorities to ensure timely delivery of key features and improvements Market Analysis & Research: Conduct regular competitive analysis and user research to inform product decisions and strategy Performance & Monetization Oversight: Monitor KPIs, app performance, and monetization strategies to optimize app profitability and user engagement Quality Assurance: Coordinate testing and validation of new features to maintain high standards of product quality User Experience Focus: Collaborate with UX/UI designers to ensure the app delivers a seamless and engaging experience Requirements What will make you stand out from the crowd: Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Marketing, or a related field 5+ years of experience in Product Ownership or Product Management, specifically within the mobile app industry Strong understanding of Android app development and the mobile product lifecycle Proven experience working with Agile/Scrum methodologies Excellent communication skills with the ability to work across diverse teams and manage multiple stakeholders Data-driven mindset with experience in using analytics tools for decision-making Familiarity with app monetization strategies, including in-app purchases, subscriptions, and advertising models Proficient in using project management and documentation tools like JIRA, Confluence, or similar Benefits Perks of being one of us: Full-time, permanent contract Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer! Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m) Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!) Enhanced career path designed just for you External training budget Budget for team-building activities We celebrate all company landmarks Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you. Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project! Location Our exceptional offices are in Barcelona's Blue Building, right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and will be able to take part in our game competitions. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. The personal data you provide will be used solely to manage your candidacy for the purposes of this position. You can exercise your rights of access, rectification, or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005. Additionally, you can email us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including documentation proving your identity.

title: Digital Product Manager
description: About the job This position is 100% remote. What are we looking for? CobbleWeb, a leading developer of custom online marketplaces, is looking for an ambitious mid-career Product Manager, who would like to grow their skill-set and expertise by working on more complex and challenging e-commerce projects. We expect you to have previous hands-on experience as a frontend engineer or UX designer - this requirement is a must. This role is a good fit for someone who can balance previous methodologies and insights with new ways of working. A capacity and willingness to adapt means that you will be adept at learning from delegated tasks and feedback, supported by some coaching on the more complex marketplace-related aspects. As a critical lynchpin you are skilled at cross-functional collaboration. In conjunction with clients and technical teams, you enjoy designing optimal solutions by analysing, discussing, and aligning business goals with product specifications that are technically feasible and user-friendly. You are a curious leader who interrogates all aspects of the product development process to identify potential improvements or resolve potential conflicts. You believe that information-sharing is a valuable tool for teams to shape best-in-class solutions. If this is you, CobbleWeb may be a good fit: An independent and profitable business that is doubling in size. More than 12 years of experience in designing, building, and optimising high-growth online marketplaces. Technically complex projects often present unique business challenges that need solving. A distributed company, headquartered in London, UK, with a strong documentation and iteration culture that supports remote team members based in Europe, Africa, the Middle East, and the Caucasus region. We take full ownership of marketplace projects in close collaboration with our clients. We’re a close-knit in-house team who love working together. We don’t outsource core functions. Work-life balance Team support Career development Job fulfilment Innovative projects Responsibilities Discovery and Planning Phase: Collaborate with clients to understand their business goals and user expectations. Advocate for a lean approach, driving principles such as formulating and testing assumptions, shipping often, and incorporating user feedback. Gain client buy-in through effective use of written documents, user flow diagrams, wireframes, and design mockups. Evaluate and propose best-in-class solutions, understanding the pros and cons of different approaches. Document and update functional specifications based on feedback and contributions from team members. Development Phase Maintain a healthy product backlog, prioritising tasks based on factors such as budget, return on investment, and product-market fit. Monitor project budgets, identifying potential overspending and recommending adjustments to scope or specifications. Ensure development aligns with documented specifications and assist the testing team with test case preparation. Own the software development life cycle, ensuring well-planned and executed sprints that align with project goals. Job Requirements 5+ years of experience in a relevant role. Background and previous hands-on experience as a frontend engineer or UX designer is a must. Relevant qualifications (e.g. computer science, information technology, or business degree). Deep understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC). Experience in managing and collaborating with multiple stakeholders. Proficiency with diagramming, and project management tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence). Familiarity with Agile principles, Lean startup methodology, and the platform economy. Proven experience in the design and documentation of user journeys that consider user personas and key touchpoints in order to accomplish business goals (e.g. The buying funnel could entail selecting, comparing, ordering and paying for an item.) Proven ability to deliver projects within meticulously planned scopes, budgets and time frames, manage risk and avoid bottlenecks. Strong interpersonal and collaborative skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Your Mindset & Approach User-centric and business-goal focussed A big-picture thinker who doesn’t lose sight of the details Highly organised, thorough, analytical, and deadline-focussed Consistent in your execution of tasks Uphold high levels of productivity by not reinventing the wheel THIS JOB IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR AGENCIES.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job Job Description What We Do TraceAir - #1 Platform for the top US Homebuilders and Land Developers. TraceAir Surveying - Tech-enabled surveying services for the top US Homebuilders. TraceAir provides technology solutions that streamline construction for the US homebuilders and land developers. Our platform combines software, drone data, and geospatial analytics to automate workflows, reduce costs, and improve decision-making. Trusted by top US homebuilders, we deliver practical, end-to-end solutions that drive eﬃciency and profitability in site development and construction. About The Role A Product Manager will expand our software-based revenue, identifying the best strategies to deliver value to our clients — US homebuilders and land developers, whether through developing new products, integrating existing solutions, or leveraging other innovative approaches. TraceAir is expanding into new stages of the construction lifecycle and engaging with a broader range of roles and stakeholders within the industry. The mission of this role is to understand the unique needs of these new stakeholders, rapidly validate hypotheses, and implement the fastest and most effective technology solutions. By combining deep user research with a creative approach to problem-solving, you will ensure TraceAir continues to offer cutting-edge, impactful solutions that address real-world challenges while achieving our company goals. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams, including business strategy, engineering, GIS, operations, and customer success, to develop, test, and deliver scalable products. Job requirements Key Responsibilities Revenue Diversification Strategy: Develop and execute strategies for diversifying product revenue streams, with a strong focus on software-based solutions for homebuilders and land developers. Product Development: Validate hypotheses through rapid prototyping and testing. Define user stories and product requirements that align with company goals and market needs. Innovation & Workflow Automation: Identify opportunities to automate traditional workflows and design solutions that bring real, applicable value in a fast-paced environment. User Research & Feedback: Conduct user interviews and analyze feedback to deeply understand customer pain points and opportunities for improvement. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, GIS, operations,and customer success teams to align on product goals and ensure timely delivery. Metrics & Reporting: Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track the success of new products and inform iterative improvements. Market Awareness: Stay informed about industry trends and competitor offerings, especially in GIS, CAD, UAS, construction, surveying, and related fields. Must-Have Qualifications Experience: 3+ years in product management or a related role in a tech-focused, B2B environment. Experience with construction technology, GIS, CAD, UAS, or surveying is strongly preferred. Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with at least one of the following domains: GIS, CAD, UAS, construction, surveying, or coordinate reference systems (CRS). Rapid Prototyping: Proven experience validating or invalidating hypotheses with creative, iterative approaches. Process Automation: Ability to design solutions that replace manual workflows with automated, scalable alternatives. User-Centric Design: Successfully gathered insights through interviews and translated them into impactful product features. Data Proficiency: Strong ability to use data analysis tools and metrics to make informed decisions. Project Management: Expertise managing multiple projects, balancing priorities, and delivering results under tight timelines. Remote Collaboration: Experience working effectively with distributed teams across time zones. Hard Skills Education: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as business, technology, or geospatial disciplines. Geospatial Technology: Familiarity with construction management, CAD software, drone data acquisition, or geospatial concepts/tools. Agile Development: Knowledge of agile principles and methodologies certifications like PSPO are a plus. Spec Writing: Skilled at writing detailed product specifications and user stories. Interviewing Skills: Expertise in conducting structured interviews to identify client pain points, validate ideas, and gather actionable insights. Prototyping: Experience creating prototypes to rapidly test and iterate on solutions before full-scale development. Soft Skills Creativity & Problem-Solving: Innovative thinker capable of finding solutions that deliver value in practical, scalable ways. Critical Thinking: Strong analytical skills for navigating complex, multifaceted problems. Interviewing Skills: Ability to uncover deep insights and validate user needs through structured, compelling interviews. Resilience: Comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment with shifting priorities. Communication: Strong ability to articulate ideas, goals, and updates to diverse stakeholders in a clear, organized manner. Some Of Our Perks/benefits Include Remote work Brand-new equipment for your convenience Unlimited vacation English lessons Paid personal therapy session 1/week Special bonuses for life’s big moments, like weddings and welcoming a new baby. Company events Other benefits may be offered based on your location. Why Join Us? At TraceAir, you can shape the future of construction technology. As a key contributor to our team, you’ll design and launch products that solve real-world problems for leading homebuilders and land developers. Join us in a dynamic, collaborative environment where innovation, impact, and creativity thrive.

title: Product Marketing Manager (AI Assistant)
description: About the job We’re looking for an experienced Product Marketing Manager (PMM) to strengthen the JetBrains IDE marketing team and lead marketing efforts for one of our highest-priority projects – AI Assistant (JetBrains AI in IDEs). In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with marketing and product teams to tackle key challenges and go after opportunities to make JetBrains AI Assistant the first choice for AI in JetBrains IDEs. You'll also work to enable and enhance IDEs marketing as competition shifts from AI plugins towards AI-powered IDEs. The great challenge comes with complexity, and here’s what makes this role exciting: You’ll have a direct impact on one of JetBrains’ most important strategic initiatives. As this is a high-priority project, you’ll have access to extensive resources and the opportunity to experiment with bold, innovative ideas. You’ll work on a product in one of the fastest-evolving markets right now, anchored in tangible product-related goals. Key responsibilities: Lead marketing efforts for AI Assistant, from strategic campaigns to ongoing features promotions. Work closely with the product team to align marketing initiatives with roadmaps and priorities and become the center of knowledge about AI Assistant for marketing teams. Define and refine AI Assistant’s market positioning and messaging, ensuring consistency across all JetBrains channels and products. Measure, analyze, and optimize marketing performance using data-driven insights. Build and strengthen relationships with influencers, contributors, and the developer community through close collaboration with other PMMs to drive advocacy and loyalty. Manage marketing budget allocation and track expenses. Help improve user onboarding to increase trial-to-license conversion rates and overall product adoption. What we’re looking for: Fluency in English with excellent communication skills. Proven experience in marketing and/or product marketing, ideally in the software development or tech industry. Experience writing product-specific content. Strong understanding of the developer ecosystem and AI tooling, along with their nuances. Ability to craft and execute strategic marketing initiatives, from positioning to campaign execution, with measurable outcomes. Analytical mindset with the ability to derive insights from data and optimize performance. Creativity and innovation in marketing strategies, with a results-driven approach. Self-motivated and organized, with a track record of delivering impactful projects on time and within budget. What would be especially great to have: Proven experience in brand/awareness marketing to support AI Assistant’s major relaunch. Active use and knowledge of various AI tools.

title: Business Analyst / Product Owner procesos bancarios (Wealth) (100% remoto desde España)
description: About the job 🚀 ¡Seguimos buscando talento…y nos encantaría que te unieras a nuestro equipo! Para que nos conozcas algo mejor, UST es una multinacional norteamericana certificada como Top Employer y Great Place to Work con más de 35.000 empleados a nivel global y con presencia en más de 35 países. Somos líderes en servicios de tecnología digital y proporcionamos soluciones tecnológicas de gran alcance a grandes compañías. 🔎 ¿Qué buscamos? Para nuestro equipo estamos buscando un Product Owner / Business Analyst con experiencia en el mundo de desarrollo (idealmente conocimiento de APIs) con experiencia en procesos bancarios (Wealth+tecnología) para colaborar en diversos proyectos de nuestro cliente del sector bancario. Colaboración 100% en remoto desde cualquier provincia de España. ⚙ Funciones: Toma de requerimientos. Planificación de requerimientos. Dimensionamiento de equipos. Seguimiento de los desarrollos de los equipos. Preparación, seguimiento y validación del testing. Paquetización de requerimientos para subidas a entornos Pre / Pro. Gestión de incidencias Reporting interno y seguimiento de KPIs. 💡 Requisitos mínimos: Aportar más de 5 años de experiencia como Business Analyst y/o Product Owner que aporten: Background técnico, con experiencia en el mundo de desarrollo, idealmente conocimiento de APIs (ser capaz de leer y entender logs y revisar código). Conocimiento de uno o varios productos / procesos bancarios (Wealth+tecnología) . Experiencia en Canales Digitales, si pueden ser bancarios mejor. Experiencia en proyectos bajo metodología Agile (Skrum, Kanban, etc..) Experiencia con Jira, Confluence. Buenas habilidades comunicativas para trabajar en equipo de forma colaborativa. Experiencia en comunicación efectiva con stakeholders digitales: comunicación fluida y transparente con todas las partes interesadas digitales, incluyendo clientes, equipos de desarrollo, equipos financieros y reguladores, asegurando una comprensión compartida de los requisitos, expectativas y progreso del proyecto digital. Experiencia técnica en colaboración con desarrolladores y APIs, entendimiento de arquitectura cloud y modelado de datos: Trabajar estrechamente con equipos de desarrollo, comprendiendo los requisitos técnicos del proyecto y colaborando en la integración de APIs y sistemas para garantizar la funcionalidad y la interoperabilidad del producto digital en el contexto de préstamos, así como la capacidad para comprender y contribuir al diseño de arquitecturas cloud y al modelado de datos para optimizar el rendimiento y la escalabilidad del producto. Inglés y Español: B2/C1 💰 ¿Qué te ofrecemos? -✈️ 23 días laborables de vacaciones y el 24 y 31 de diciembre. -❤️ Numerosos beneficios sociales (seguro médico, ayuda al teletrabajo, seguro de vida y seguro de accidentes). -🍴 Programa de Retribución Flexible (tarjeta comida, cheques guardería, tarjeta transporte, clases de inglés online, seguro médico para tu familia…). -🎓 Acceso gratuito a varias plataformas de formación. -🚀 Estabilidad y carrera profesional. -🚶 Tenemos implantado un plan de compensación de referencias internas. -🔗 Posibilidad de elección de percibir tu salario en 12 o 14 pagas. -🏡 Medidas de conciliación (horario flexible, teletrabajo, asesoramiento de especialistas (psicólogo, nutricionista, entrenador personal), jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano según proyecto). -🎁 Plataforma UST Club descuentos y descuentos en gimnasios. 📧 Si quieres conocer más, no dudes en inscribirte y nos pondremos en contacto contigo para ampliarte información de la posición ¡Te estamos esperando! En UST nos comprometemos con la igualdad de oportunidades en nuestros procesos de selección y no realizamos ningún tipo de discriminación por razón de raza, género, discapacidad, edad, religión, orientación sexual o nacionalidad. Estamos comprometidos con la discapacidad y apostamos por la incorporación de personas con certificado de discapacidad.

title: Product Owner – Data Privacy & Fraud | Entorno API-First y Agile
description: About the job ¿Te apasiona construir productos tech con impacto real en negocio? ¿Te sientes cómodo/a liderando el roadmap de soluciones críticas como privacidad de datos o prevención de fraude? Buscamos un/a Product Owner para liderar el desarrollo de productos internos en un entorno de ecommerce altamente tecnológico, orientado a plataformas de microservicios y API-first. Tu misión Impulsar los productos de Data Privacy y Fraud Prevention maximizando su valor, alineando el equipo con los objetivos de negocio y asegurando su evolución con una visión clara, datos en mano y foco en cliente. Responsabilidades Liderar el roadmap del producto negociando con stakeholders Gestionar el backlog y las prioridades Definir nuevas funcionalidades junto al equipo de desarrollo Traducir visión estratégica en historias de usuario claras Medir el impacto de las iniciativas y tomar decisiones basadas en datos Representar la voz del usuario y el valor del producto internamente Asegurar la entrega de valor y la calidad en cada iteración Estar al día en tendencias, competencia y mejoras aplicables Requisitos imprescindibles Experiencia como Product Owner o Product Manager Experiencia en productos basados en API-first Conocimiento sólido del entorno Agile/Scrum Capacidad de toma de decisiones basadas en datos (data-driven mindset) Experiencia en ecommerce o plataformas digitales Habilidad para negociar y alinear con stakeholders Conocimiento de DDD (Domain Driven Design) Experiencia previa trabajando con OKRs Background en privacidad de datos o fraude digital Visión de negocio, empatía hacia equipos técnicos y usuarios, pensamiento crítico y orientación al resultado

title: Consultor/a Funcional & Product Owner – Banca Privada (CJE)
description: About the job We are One Team. We make it happen. We are Unstoppable. BABEL es una consultora tecnológica multinacional especializada en aplicar sus servicios y conocimiento tecnológico en los procesos de aceleración digital de sus clientes, grandes empresas y organismos públicos. ¿Cuál es nuestro plan estratégico? ¡Miramos hacia el futuro! Nuestro plan estratégico Hiperespacio 2029 promete ser un viaje emocionante, lleno de oportunidades para crecer y desarrollarse profesionalmente. Alcanzar 1000 millones de facturación, un reto que estamos seguros de que con la colaboración y el talento de nuestra gente, será otra historia de éxito que escribiremos juntos y juntas. ¿Qué buscamos? En Babel, buscamos un/a Customer Journey Expert (CJE) con un perfil híbrido técnico-funcional, para trabajar en iniciativas clave dentro del ámbito de banca privada. El objetivo del rol es impulsar mejoras en los recorridos de cliente, colaborando estrechamente con los equipos de negocio y tecnología. Responsabilidades Participar activamente en la definición y evolución del Customer Journey en productos y servicios de banca privada. Intermediar entre el equipo de negocio y el equipo técnico, asegurando una correcta comprensión de los requerimientos funcionales. Identificar oportunidades de mejora en procesos existentes vinculados a fondos, intercambio de ficheros, DPM, y otros servicios de banca privada. Gestionar stakeholders internos y externos, asegurando una comunicación fluida y alineación de expectativas. Trabajar en un entorno ágil y colaborar con equipos multidisciplinares. Requisitos 3 a 5 años de experiencia funcional en el sector financiero, especialmente en banca privada. Experiencia en la interacción entre equipos de negocio y tecnología (perfil híbrido). Deseable conocimiento en tareas de un Asset Manager (fondos, intercambio de ficheros) y en gestión discrecional de carteras (DPM). 3 a 5 años de experiencia en gestión de stakeholders. 3 a 5 años de experiencia trabajando en el sector bancario. 3 a 5 años de experiencia trabajando en equipos colaborativos. Conocimiento práctico de metodologías ágiles (Scrum). Se ofrece Participación en proyectos estratégicos de transformación en banca privada. Entorno de trabajo dinámico, colaborativo y con impacto directo en la experiencia del cliente. Modalidad híbrida/remota según necesidades del proyecto. Estabilidad, proyección profesional y formación continua. #babel ¿Qué ofrecemos? Babel, the great way to achieve the success. ¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo en expansión, comprometido e innovador que hace historia cada día? En Babel te acompañamos en tu camino hacia el éxito. Creemos en el talento de las personas y lo queremos potenciar ofreciéndote un gran entorno de trabajo basado en la colaboración y la solidaridad. Trabajar en Babel es mucho más que trabajar en una empresa, es unirse a un equipo de personas con una misión compartida y a un modelo de compañía centrado en valores. Además, Apostamos por la flexibilidad laboral-personal. (Sistema de vacaciones por puntos, teletrabajo y flexibilidad). Invertimos en la formación de nuestros Babelievers. Invertimos en tu salud física y emocional. (Seguro Médico Privado/ Seguro de vida, entrenador personal y programa de wellbeing). Invertimos también en tu tiempo libre (Actividades en la naturaleza, campeonatos deportivos, suscripción a plataforma streaming (por Ej. Netflix) Participamos del crecimiento de la compañía y reconocemos la participación de cada persona (Bono de Beneficios). Ponemos foco en trabajar con últimas tecnologías y proyectos innovadores, pero sobre todo, acompañamos a la transformación digital y acercamos la tecnología a la sociedad. ¿Aceptas el desafío? ¡Te esperamos! En cumplimiento de la normativa vigente en materia de protección de datos te informamos que el responsable de tus datos personales es GRUPO BABEL (consultar empresas en la política de privacidad), y los utilizará para gestionar tus procesos de selección, tanto actuales como futuros y el resto de finalidades descritas en la web. Este tratamiento está basado en el consentimiento del candidato. Los datos personales recabados no serán en ningún caso cedidos a terceros salvo por obligaciones legales expresas. Puedes ejercer los derechos que te asisten sobre protección de datos en la dirección data.protection@babelgroup.com. Toda la información sobre política de privacidad en nuestra web.

title: Product Data Analyst
description: About the job At Phrase, we help open the door to global business by providing the world’s most comprehensive localization platform. We’re transforming language technology with our AI platform to give people the content they need, in the language they speak. Whether it's for digital products like an app or website, marketing comms, legal literature, internal comms or customer service messaging, Phrase ensures that content always hits its mark by being on brand, consistent, and culturally resonant. With a global team working from our offices in Hamburg and Prague—or from home across Europe, the UK, the US, and the APAC region—we help organizations like Uber, Shopify, Puma, Snowflake, Volkswagen and thousands of others engage their customers at scale to accelerate growth. As a Product Data Analyst at Phrase, you will play a pivotal role in guiding product prioritization through data-driven insights. You will collaborate closely with Product Managers to implement analytics functionalities that empower our customers to make informed decisions. You will influence the development of data products for customers, participate in strategic discussions, respond to input from our customers to address their needs.Your work will be instrumental in bringing our Product vision to life and driving the success of Phrase's innovative localization solutions. What you’ll be responsible for: Collaborate with Product Managers to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights. Develop and implement analytics functionalities within the Control Hub domain to support data-driven decision-making for customers. Conduct detailed statistical analyses and data visualizations to inform product strategy and prioritization. Manage competing priorities while navigating a high-context-switching environment. Collaborate with customers to understand their data needs and gather feedback to help improve the product continuously. Work closely with the BI/Data team and other stakeholders to ensure data integrity and optimize analytics solutions. Influence strategic decision-making by providing evidence-based insights and recommendations. What you need: Proven experience in analytical thinking and problem-solving within a product-oriented environment. Proficiency in data visualization, statistical analysis, and SQL. Hands-on experience with data tools and platforms commonly used for product analytics. Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to manage competing priorities effectively. A strategic mindset with a basic understanding of product management principles. Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence stakeholders across teams. Experience in customer-facing roles or participating in customer calls is a plus. What you’ll get: Work experience in a successful and growing global SaaS company Be part of an international team of 300+ in Europe, APAC, and the Americas Expert colleagues in their field who are determined to build the best localization platform on the market, creating a world where language never limits opportunity An agile work environment, where it is encouraged to take smart risks Take part in a culture full of trust, support and loyalty, where respectful and open feedback is valued, and diversity is fully embraced A positive, open-minded, and innovative atmosphere Support in your professional development and personal career goals What's on top: 4 Company holidays additional to your regular holidays (1 day per quarter where the entire company is off to celebrate our achievements). In addition, the company also provides employees with a Christmas break to allow you to spend time with family and friends without use of your vacation allocation. Your birthday is off because it is important to celebrate you as well. 2 Giveback days where you can support the local community, volunteer, and/or participate in charity events and activities. Professional and extensive onboarding. Learning & development through Phrase learning and a dedicated ChatGPT Plus user license Additional local benefits depending on the entity you're hired at, just ask your Talent Acquisition Partner At Phrase we believe in the critical importance of diversity in all its forms and intersectionalities, and are committed to ensuring that the people we interview reflect this diversity. We therefore strongly encourage people of any identity to apply for our exciting career opportunities. We have taken an active decision to make our work environment inclusive every day, starting at the very beginning of your Phrase experience. We value and welcome different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds as we believe that these differences make our team even stronger on our mission of opening the door to global business by giving everybody access to the content they need in the language they speak.

title: Product Support Specialist - EMEA
description: About the job 👋 Hello! I’m Laura, Support Manager at Ashby. I'm excited to share that we're hiring a Product Support Specialist in EMEA 🎉. Please note: at this time, we are seeking Product Support Specialists to cover weekend shifts, as a tradeoff for a weekday. Our available shifts cover a Sunday through Thursday schedule, or a Tuesday through Saturday schedule. Occasional schedule changes may be required to accommodate holidays, coverage gaps, or business demands. You may let us know your preferred working hours in the application. Over the past few years, we’ve built a team of Ashby experts who delight our customers with their keen attention to detail, deep product knowledge, and fast service. In joining us, you’d bring that same level of world-class support to our customers based in Europe and Asia. In this role, you will spend a lot of time working directly with customers. Ashby’s product encompasses a wide breadth, and is quite complex. In this role, you can expect to work on tickets requiring complex integration troubleshooting, to providing customers with detailed workflow instructions. You’ll Also Spend Time On Projects That Make The Work That We Do Better. Past Projects Our Team Has Taken On Include Absorbing and synthesizing highly technical work from our Engineering Team to create enablement for technical up-leveling of the broader Support Team Developing workflow automation allowing for better team cohesion and efficacy As a company, we value a strong sense of ownership, principled thinking over experience, and thoughtful communication. These and other values we’ll discuss in more detail during the interview process inform how we do the work. You Should Apply If You have experience with and are excited to learn the ins and outs of a complex and rapidly evolving product You’re curious—both in addressing customers and creating solutions that improve our workflows. You seek the answers beyond what’s on the surface. You have strong problem-solving skills. You’re skilled at both defining the scope of a problem and creating a comprehensive solution. You delight customers. You possess keen attention to detail, ensure your responses are thorough and clear, and are empathetic along the way. You prioritize ownership in finding solutions for customers. When given a problem, you proactively make decisions rooted in principled thinking to solve it. You have offered B2B support to customers, ranging from Small Business through Enterprise organizations. You Should Not Apply If You avoid getting in the weeds of solving technical problems: each member of our support team is highly technical and capable of solving deeply complex tickets You prefer to triage tickets swiftly; if tagging in Engineering early on (without attempting comprehensive solutions) is an exhale moment, this is likely not a great fit You prefer to support a product you can know the ins and outs of quickly (such as a point solution) rather than a product that is rapidly evolving with quite a bit of surface area You value in office culture for motivation; this role is remote (given our office is in San Francisco) so we're seeking self-starters! About Ashby We’re building the next generation of enterprise software, and we’re starting with a suite of products that help talent leaders, recruiters, and hiring managers run their hiring process significantly better. Learn more on our website: https://www.ashbyhq.com/ We are well-funded and backed by great investors, including Y Combinator, Elad Gil and Lachy Groom. We publicly launched in October 2022 and are already work with amazing companies we're proud to partner with. We’ve built an incredible team and exceptional product over the past few years, and we truly are just getting started. In short, this is the perfect time to join 🚀 About Go To Market We view our Support team as an extension of the product itself, one that ensures an optimal customer experience for customers ranging across all market segments. Here are a few points that should give you an idea of what it is like to work with us: We spend a lot of time building best-in-class products since we believe a highly differentiated product is easier to sell. We also spend a lot of time building a best-in-class customer experience. We aim to offer deep expertise whenever we interact with prospects and customers. We strongly believe that small teams with very talented people and the right work environment deliver much better performance than teams with large headcount. Interview Process Role Our interview process is thorough — we aim to ensure each person that joins the team is the right fit for Ashby and will provide ample information for you to assess if Ashby is the right fit for you. The process for this role is as follows: Intro Call with Recruiting - 30 Minutes Take Home Assessment - 1 week to complete Hiring Manager Interview - 45-60 Minutes Virtual Onsite - 90 Minutes Onboarding Process Ashby is a highly complex product, and we invest a lot of time in ensuring our support team members are experts on the platform. Your first 30 days will primarily focus on learning the finer points of the products; you may not respond directly to a customer in that time but don’t worry, you’ll be plenty busy learning! Benefits 10-year exercise window for stock options. You shouldn’t feel pressure to purchase stock options if you leave Ashby —do it when you feel financially comfortable. Unlimited PTO with four weeks is recommended per year. Expect “Vacation?” in our one-on-one agenda until you start taking it 😅 Twelve weeks of fully paid family leave in the US. We plan to expand this to employees in other countries as situations arise. Generous equipment, software, and office furniture budget. Get what you need to be happy and productive! $100/month education budget with more expensive items (like conferences) covered with manager approval. Ashby provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

title: ECom Project Manager
description: About the job Happy Mammoth is a fast-growing natural food tech business selling across the United States, Australia and Europe. We specialize in formulating, producing, and marketing gut, digestive and microbiome health foods and natural supplements, designed to help our clients make long-lasting positive health changes and start living very full lives again. Currently, we are looking for an E-commerce Project Manager to join our vibrant international team of experts. This is a full-time remote contractor position. As our E-commerce Project Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and optimizing our online presence. You will be responsible for managing the end-to-end process of creating new landing pages, funnels, website projects, and marketing campaigns — including coordinating copy, images, and page building. In addition, you will oversee updates to the website, ensuring it runs smoothly and reflects the latest initiatives. This role also involves close collaboration with the Localization Project Manager to ensure all relevant pages are properly prepared and translated for global audiences. Responsibilities: Lead the development and optimization of new landing pages and funnels for our e-commerce platform Generate and analyze performance reports, identifying areas for improvement and implementing enhancements to maximize conversion rates Email Marketing team project management — helping them stay on track with timelines, supporting asset delivery, and ensuring campaigns are fully completed and aligned with other initiatives Project management for the Email Marketing team: ensuring timely completion of campaigns, management of asset delivery, and alignment with other initiatives Manage internal and external staff, fostering collaboration and ensuring project timelines are met Maintain the website by overseeing regular updates and ensuring ongoing functionality, accuracy, and performance Manage project documentation, timelines, and task tracking in project management tools, preferably Asana (but experience with similar tools like Trello or Monday.com is also valuable) Conduct quality assurance (QA) before launching new pages or campaigns to ensure everything is working correctly, is visually consistent, and aligns with brand standards Qualifications: Proven track record in managing e-commerce projects, with a focus on landing pages and funnels Preferred knowledge of Klaviyo or similar email marketing platforms Experience with e-commerce platforms - preferably Shopify Experience working with agencies and collaborating with brands or industries Strong project management skills, with the ability to drive projects from inception to completion Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment Strong organizational and documentation skills Detail-oriented, with the ability to spot inconsistencies and ensure accuracy across copy, visuals, and functionality Excellent communication and leadership skills Familiarity with page-building apps and others (like quizzes) What You Will Get A strong salary package The flexibility of remote work from any location worldwide, whether it's your home, a co-working space, or a cafe A vibrant, inclusive, and nurturing work environment with talented colleagues from across the globe The chance to contribute to the ongoing expansion of our global presence Flexible working hours Opportunities for professional growth and development Free access to books, courses, and other resources to enhance and broaden your skill set A dynamic work environment filled with diverse challenges, ensuring each day is infused with excitement and variety The chance to be part of our thrilling and number one mission to foster positive health changes for clients, guiding them towards rediscovering profoundly fulfilling lives CVs must be in English Powered by JazzHR k1U39iaQB5

title: Product Catalog & Research Analyst
description: About the job Uvation is focused on the wellbeing and ongoing success of our clients, their communities, and the environments that support us all. The Role Job Description We are seeking a highly experienced and detail-oriented Senior E-commerce Catalog & Market Research Specialist to manage end-to-end e-commerce listings for IT hardware and electronic products from top brands like HP, Dell, Lenovo, and others. This role requires in-depth market research skills, content optimization expertise, and hands-on experience with catalog tools and platforms. Key Responsibilities Conduct thorough market research and competitor analysis across leading e-commerce platforms (Amazon, Flipkart, etc.) Create, manage, and optimize product listings across internal platforms and partner channels Work closely with the design team to ensure high-quality, brand-aligned product images, banners, and A+ content Ensure accurate product titles, bullet points, specs, pricing, taxonomy, and SEO-rich descriptions Maintain compliance with category-specific guidelines for electronic/MSP products Monitor listing performance, identify issues (e.g., suppressed listings, poor visibility), and resolve them Coordinate with procurement and brand teams to onboard new products efficiently Stay up-to-date with industry trends, e-commerce policies, and algorithm changes Ideal Profile Required Skills Product Research of North America/Global Catalogue. Proven experience with e-commerce platforms (Amazon Seller Central, Shopify, Magento, etc.) Deep understanding of catalog structure, listing best practices, and platform compliance Strong knowledge of electronics/IT product specs and positioning Basic design sense and experience coordinating with graphic designers for product creatives Excellent Excel and data handling skills for bulk uploads Strong research and analytical skills to map competitive benchmarks Familiarity with GTINs, ASINs, barcoding, inventory mapping, and PIM systems Preferred Experience in B2B or MSP product listings Hands-on knowledge of product data sheets, brand manuals, and warranty documentation Understanding of SEO for product listings Experience 5–7 years minimum in e-commerce catalog management, product research, and marketplace operations (preferably in electronics or IT hardware categories). What's on Offer? Work alongside & learn from best in class talent Opportunity within a company with a solid track record of performance Strong opportunities to progress your career

title: Payments Product Analyst
description: About the job About The Company About Cleo At Cleo, we're not just building another fintech app. We're embarking on a mission to fundamentally change humanity's relationship with money. Imagine a world where everyone, regardless of background or income, has access to a hyper-intelligent financial advisor in their pocket. That's the future we're creating. Cleo is a rare success story: a profitable, fast-growing unicorn with over $200 million in ARR and growing over 2x year-over-year. This isn't just a job; it's a chance to join a team of brilliant, driven individuals who are passionate about making a real difference. We have an exceptionally high bar for talent, seeking individuals who are not only at the top of their field but also embody our culture of collaboration and positive impact. If you’re driven by complex challenges that push your expertise, the chance to shape something truly transformative, and the potential to share in Cleo’s success as we scale, while growing alongside a company that’s scaling fast, this might be your perfect fit. Follow us on LinkedIn to keep up to date with new product features and insights from the team. What You'll Be Doing As a Senior Product Analyst in our Payments Intelligence team, you’ll use data to drive Cleo’s profitability. You’ll play a key role in shaping and prioritising both the strategic and tactical roadmaps that power the development of a world-class payments retry engine. You’ll define and take ownership of the core metrics that track the efficiency of our payments system. With these metrics in hand, you’ll identify high-impact opportunities to optimise the timing and methods of payment collection - striking the right balance between revenue generation and cost control. This is a rare opportunity to directly influence profitability in a meaningful way. You’ll also sit within the wider data function here at Cleo; a hotshot chapter of 65 Data Scientists, Product Analysts, and Analytic Engineers with significant industry experience who are at the heart of everything we do at Cleo. Key Responsibilities Lead in-depth analysis of the payments retry system to identify high-impact growth opportunities Conduct root cause analysis on on unexpected metric movements by examining user behaviour and payments data Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track the efficiency of our payments platform Collaborate cross-functionally with Engineering, Product, and Data Science teams to build a market-leading payments intelligence system Design and analyse A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of product changes Work with Analytics Engineering to prioritise and contribute to the development of reliable, well-structured data models Must-Have About you A systems thinker: You approach challenges by understanding the interconnected nature of the payments ecosystem, recognising how changes in one area affect the broader system Several years of experience performing quantitative analysis in a digital product environment Strong SQL skills with the ability to extract insights from complex data sources Proven experience contributing to strategic planning, including roadmap development and initiative prioritisation A track record of using data to proactively optimise processes and improve performance Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests Nice To Have Experience working with payment systems, collections or billing What You'll Get For Your Hard Work This is a level 3 position. Cleo has 5 internal levels of competency within Product Analytics. See our skills framework for how we differentiate on seniority. A competitive compensation package (base + equity) with bi-annual reviews, aligned to our quarterly OKR planning cycles. You can view our public progression framework and salary bandings here: https://cleo-ai.progressionapp.com/ Work at one of the fastest-growing tech startups, backed by top VC firms, Balderton & EQT Ventures A clear progression plan. We want you to keep growing. That means trying new things, leading others, challenging the status quo and owning your impact. Always with our complete support. Flexibility. We can’t fight for the world’s financial health if we’re not healthy ourselves. We work with everyone to make sure they have the balance they need to do their best work Work where you work best. We’re a globally distributed team. If you live in London we have a hybrid approach, we’d love you to spend one day a week or more in our beautiful office. If you’re outside of London, we’ll encourage you to spend a couple of days with us a few times per year. And we’ll cover your travel costs, naturally. Other Benefits Company-wide performance reviews every 6 months Generous pay increases for high-performing team members Equity top-ups for team members getting promoted 25 days annual leave a year + public holidays (+ an additional day for every year you spend at Cleo, up to 30 days) 6% employer-matched pension in the UK Private Medical Insurance via Vitality, dental cover, and life assurance Enhanced parental leave 1 month paid sabbatical after 4 years at Cleo Regular socials and activities, online and in-person We'll pay for your OpenAI subscription Online mental health support via Spill Workplace Nursery Scheme And many more! We strongly encourage applications from people of colour, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, parents, carers, and people from lower socio-economic backgrounds. If there’s anything we can do to accommodate your specific situation, please let us know. UK app access The Cleo app is no longer downloadable in the UK (but only until next year). If you’re an existing user, you’ll still have access to the app. But some features won’t be available (just for a little while). Why? 99% of our users are based in the US – where financial health is often overlooked. We’ve decided to shift our focus to where we can provide the most value and make the greatest impact for users who need it most. Then we’ll be able to apply what we learn to better support our UK users in the future. By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with CLEO. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with CLEO may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with CLEO's Candidate Privacy Notice

title: Product Manager
description: About the job Job Description We’re looking for a Product Manager to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally. Who We Are At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we’ve grown to over 700 Seedtaggers across 17 countries, raising €250M to revolutionize digital advertising. Your Challenge Market analysis and trends: Maintain a deep understanding of the latest trends in the AdTech world, including emerging technologies, privacy policy changes, and market best practices. Use this knowledge to guide strategic decision-making and keep us at the forefront of the industry. Build up from a rock to a castle: As Product Manager, the ideal candidate will become part of a squad including multiple Backend Engineers. Together with the Engineering Manager, the ideal candidate will need to understand development timings and uncertainty around these, be comfortable around MVPs to find possible short-cuts while understanding the tradeoffs made in the resulting technology, define future iterations to build up the best technology while ensuring its producing impact from the very beginning. Collaboration with external partners: Work closely with our strategic partners, such as DSPs and SSPs, to establish and maintain strong integrations. Collaborate on identifying partnership opportunities, resolving technical issues, and optimizing platform performance. Internal and External evangelisation: As Product Manager for Ad Exchange you will be the point of contact for explaining (and sometimes selling) our capabilities to get the best out of our publishers inventory. The ideal candidate will need to adapt technical developments to non-technical language, properly communicate our developments and innovation to internal teams (partnerships/success/etc.) and externally to clients. Continuous improvement and optimization: Drive continuous improvement of our AdExchange by identifying areas of opportunity to optimize algorithms and increase efficiency. Conduct tests and experiments to validate new ideas and approaches. Establish product metrics, KPIs and indicators for success: Together with the Engineering Manager, the Product manager will need to be responsible for the roadmap, the developments of the squad, ensuring and measuring the success of the projects, improving ways-of-working, etc. What You’ll Need to Succeed Is very entrepreneurial, not afraid to take risks and has great communication skills. Has an educational background in Engineering, maths, tech or a related area. Has 5+ years of experience as a Product Manager or another relevant role. Knows how to make data-driven decisions and work on complex technical problems. Has a proven track record of working effectively under high pressure environments. Speaks fluent in English and Spanish, this is a must for this role. Is eager to work in a dynamic, innovative and fast-changing environment. It would be a plus if you Have previous experience in Web and CTV AdTech ecosystems. Why Join Seedtag? Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more! Additional Perks Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers. Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included. Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes. Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future. Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together! At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

title: Service Product Manager (Remote - Spain)
description: About the job This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of Everyday Health Group. We are currently looking for a Service Product Manager in Spain. As a Service Product Manager, you will lead the strategy, design, and continuous evolution of service-based offerings across cross-functional teams. With a clear focus on customer satisfaction and business growth, you'll translate user insights into high-impact services and launch strategies. From defining product roadmaps to coordinating launches with marketing, sales, and delivery, you'll be responsible for driving innovation and performance across the full service lifecycle. This is an opportunity to shape services that truly resonate with clients in a fast-paced, global environment. Accountabilities: Define and execute the vision, roadmap, and strategy for service-based products in line with business goals Analyze market trends, competition, and technology to ensure services remain innovative and differentiated Collaborate with engineering, delivery, marketing, and sales teams to develop new service offerings and enhance existing ones Specify service requirements, success KPIs, and ensure delivery teams are set up for scalability and execution Gather and prioritize customer feedback to shape feature development and drive engagement Lead go-to-market efforts including pricing strategies, promotional plans, and internal sales enablement Track service performance and recommend improvements based on customer adoption and satisfaction metrics Act as a liaison across teams to ensure alignment, transparent communication, and efficient execution Requirements Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or related field; MBA or similar advanced degree is a plus Minimum 8 years of experience in product management with a strong focus on service offerings Proven experience in successfully developing and launching service-based products Familiarity with Agile methodologies and working with cross-functional teams Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, including customer-facing experience High proficiency in analyzing customer needs and translating them into actionable solutions Ability to manage performance metrics and pivot services based on evolving business needs Benefits Competitive salary package and performance-based incentives Hybrid or flexible working arrangements for better work-life balance Comprehensive healthcare coverage and wellness support Learning and development opportunities for professional growth Inclusive and supportive company culture that values diversity Opportunity to work on global, high-impact projects with industry leaders Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching. When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly. 🔍 Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience and achievements. 📊 It compares your profile to the job's core requirements and past success factors to determine your match score. 🎯 Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the 3 candidates with the highest match to the role. 🧠 When necessary, our human team may perform an additional manual review to ensure no strong profile is missed. The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias — focusing solely on your fit for the role. Once the shortlist is completed, we share it directly with the company that owns the job opening. The final decision and next steps (such as interviews or additional assessments) are then made by their internal hiring team. Thank you for your interest!

title: Junior Project Manager - Gerente de Proyectos Junior
description: About the job Nuestro objetivo es ayudar a todos los recién graduados del mundo a encontrar el trabajo que más se ajuste a sus ambiciones: ¡únete a nosotros para hacer realidad las aspiraciones de una comunidad de más de 1,500,000 usuarios! Buscamos constantemente estudiantes y graduados que aspiren a unirse a nuestro equipo de Project Management: postula para estos puestos y nuestro equipo de RRHH se comunicará contigo tan pronto como abramos un puesto en nuestro equipo y tu CV sea adecuado al perfil buscado. Para todos los puestos Junior ofrecemos un contrato de prácticas o colaboración remunerada (1.200 € al mes) con el objetivo de conseguir un empleo fijo, tendrás la oportunidad de crecer exponencialmente gracias a la formación en el puesto, podrás trabajar tanto en una de nuestras oficinas como de forma completamente remota durante el tiempo que desees. y te proporcionaremos una MacBook de última generación. -- Dentro del equipo de Project Management podrás abordar diversas tareas como: Planificar, coordinar y supervisar todo el ciclo de vida de los proyectos asignados, desde su inicio hasta su finalización, asegurando una gestión eficiente y orientada a objetivos. Gestionar de manera óptima la asignación de recursos para las actividades relacionadas con el proyecto, manteniendo constante alineación con el presupuesto establecido. Seguir cuidadosamente el progreso de las actividades dentro de los proyectos asignados, interviniendo con prontitud para garantizar el cumplimiento de los plazos y estándares de calidad. Asegurar la entrega oportuna y precisa de los proyectos asignados, cumpliendo estrictamente los plazos acordados con los clientes y asegurando el cumplimiento de los requisitos de calidad preestablecidos. Gestionar eficazmente la comunicación con todos los stakeholders y partes interesadas implicadas en los proyectos, manteniendo un constante intercambio de información y asegurando un alto nivel de implicación y comprensión por parte de todos los actores implicados. Algunos proyectos en los que podrías trabajar: Organización, supervisión y gestión de las traducciones de nuestro sitio web y App; Organizar eventos B2B con el objetivo de incrementar las ventas; Organización, supervisión y gestión de actividades de marketing offline. Lo que te ofrecemos Trabajar en el equipo de Joinrs significa poder elegir siempre las mejores condiciones psicofísicas para estar sereno y productivo. Esto se traduce en: Trabajo remoto y flexibilidad. Tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar completamente a distancia todo el tiempo que desees, pero también apoyarte en una de nuestras oficinas. Ambiente de trabajo dinámico. Nuestras oficinas siempre están abiertas. Te garantizamos espacios de trabajo compartidos, salas de reuniones, áreas de descanso y un bar con frutas frescas y aperitivos de todo tipo. También encontrarás una mesa de billar y una estación de juegos. Queremos un ambiente de trabajo informal que fomente momentos de compartir, siempre respetando las actividades individuales. Team building y diversión. Organizamos a menudo aperitivos, juegos y momentos de recreo: son parte integral de la vida en Joinrs, tanto fuera como dentro de la oficina. Bienestar empresarial. Te garantizamos un bienestar empresarial privado a la altura de tus expectativas. Paquete tecnológico. Utilizarás software avanzado y tecnologías modernas, y se te proporcionará un MacBook de última generación. Formación. Siempre contarás con un tutor en tu trayectoria en Joinrs: tendrás un punto de referencia tanto para los aspectos técnicos como para los del equipo. Te aseguramos un crecimiento profesional constante que se traducirá en un aumento progresivo de tus responsabilidades. Podrás participar en eventos del sector y cursos de formación, además de recibir formación continua en las mejores plataformas de aprendizaje en línea. Impacto social. Tu contribución apoyará a miles de recién graduados a encontrar el trabajo al que aspiran: tendrás la oportunidad de interactuar con nuestra comunidad y descubrir el impacto social y la revolución que estamos llevando más allá de las fronteras italianas. Quiénes somos Nuestra misión es apoyar a cada recién graduado a lograr sus aspiraciones, permitiéndole comenzar su nueva carrera con el optimismo de una perspectiva clara. Somos un equipo unido que cree firmemente en el trabajo en equipo: juntos trabajamos, discutimos y obtenemos resultados que nos estimulan a alcanzar objetivos cada vez más ambiciosos. Nuestra comunidad cuenta con más de 1,500,000 miembros en Italia, Reino Unido, España, Brasil, Francia, Portugal y Alemania, incluyendo 300 empresas como PwC, Unilever, Gi Group, Danone, Siemens, y está creciendo de manera exponencial! Contrato y Remuneración: Para todos los puestos de Junior Project Manager ofrecemos un contrato de prácticas de 6 meses con un salario de 1200 € al mes, con el objetivo de un contrato indefinido. Se programará una revisión salarial cada seis meses, y tu remuneración crecerá rápidamente a medida que acumules experiencia y la traduzcas en un impacto cada vez mayor. Proceso de selección: 1. Revisión del CV: el primer paso es una revisión del currículum (generalmente dentro de los 20 días posteriores a la solicitud). 2. Entrevista telefónica: el segundo paso incluirá una entrevista telefónica con nuestro Gerente de Recursos Humanos de aproximadamente 15 minutos. 3. Entrevista por video: el último paso será una entrevista por video con tanto el Gerente de Recursos Humanos como tu futuro supervisor. Prevemos al menos 45 minutos de entrevista. ¿Por qué unirte a nuestro equipo? Impacto social: tendrás la oportunidad de apoyar a nuestra comunidad para que logren sus aspiraciones. Y las tuyas. Startup exitosa: Joinrs fue seleccionada entre las 10 mejores startups del mundo en la Web Summit de Lisboa. Crecimiento personal exponencial: tendrás la oportunidad de crecer de manera exponencial, tanto en habilidades técnicas como en habilidades blandas, gracias a un programa de formación basado en la capacitación en el trabajo y el apoyo en línea.

title: Product Manager - Fusion Model-Based Manufacturing
description: About the job Job Requisition ID # 25WD88151 Position Overview The Autodesk Product Design and Manufacturing Solutions (PDMS) portfolio connects the top floor to the shop floor and supply chain so customers can move seamlessly through each phase of a product's development lifecycle — from design and validation to production engineering, manufacturing execution, and operation — with a best-in-class Fusion Industry Cloud platform and market-leading specialist products. Reporting to our Director of Product Management – Fusion Manufacturing, we are seeking an ambitious Product Manager - Fusion Model-Based Manufacturing. This position is a fantastic opportunity for experienced professionals from the domain who are looking to start their career in Product Management or Product Managers seeking for a great challenge. The role offers a unique opportunity to gain knowledge in multiple areas of Fusion, including Mold & Die, Complex Aerospace cases, Production Machining, Sheet Metal, Automation, and End-to-End Design to Manufacturing workflows. Additionally, this role will be heavily involved in promoting and integrating Model-Based Manufacturing (MBM) and Model-Based Definition (MBD) disciplines, which are essential for streamlined and efficient Design to Manufacturing workflows in modern industry. As a hybrid-first workplace, you will collaborate with teammates globally and travel up to 20% of the time for face-to-face meetings, including conferences, team offsites, and customer engagements. If you prefer office life, we have offices in various cities in Germany. (The position is also opened in other EMEA Countries) Responsibilities Support the definition and execution of product strategy and roadmap for Fusion’s Manufacturing Solution, with a strong emphasis on Model-Based Manufacturing (MBM) and Model-Based Definition (MBD) disciplines Embrace a customer-centric approach to define objectives and initiatives by focusing on business value and liaising with the development teams to create innovative capabilities Balance tactical and strategic priorities, managing tech debt along with business-critical features to ensure delivery of rich and robust experiences to customers Support the prioritization of the product backlog to ensure incremental delivery of business value over time Collaborate with our Fusion Design, Fusion Operations, and Fusion Manage teams to streamline and automate manufacturing workflows across the entire process chain Partner with the Autodesk partnership team to create and expand relationships in the market Communicate status and deliverables to stakeholders and gather feedback for the engineering team Create high-quality marketing assets Engage and communicate actively with the Fusion community Minimum Qualifications Extensive experience in the Design and Manufacturing industry, with a strong understanding of the challenges and opportunities within these fields Strong skillset in Mold & Die Design and Manufacturing processes, including Electrode Design Proven track record of executing CAD and CAM skills, demonstrating proficiency in designing and manufacturing processes using advanced software tools Ability to define initiatives focusing on business value and customer needs Strong planning and dependency management skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively engage with the Fusion community, stakeholders, and engineering teams Ability to work with teams distributed across multiple locations and time zones Experience working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including development, experience design, operations, sales, service, and management Preferred Qualifications Broad understanding of market trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies in the CAD/CAM market, especially in automation Experience as an Application- or Presales Engineer in the CAD-CAM Industry Skills in Design, CAD for Manufacturing, and Model-Based-Definition (MBD) Familiarity with scrum/agile methodologies Familiarity with programming and executing machining programs on the shop floor If you are an ambitious individual looking to start your career in Product Management and have experience in the Design and Manufacturing world, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at Autodesk. Join us in shaping the future of manufacturing! #AC-1 Learn More About Autodesk Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made. We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – it’s at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world. When you’re an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us! Salary transparency Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, our compensation package may include annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package. Diversity & Belonging We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).

title: Execution Manager

Valorable formación en metodologías ágiles, gestión de proyectos o estrategia corporativa. 💼 Experiencia: Experiencia previa como Project Manager o PMO en banca corporativa o entornos financieros. Gestión de portfolios de proyectos end-to-end: desde el análisis inicial, planificación, seguimiento, hasta la entrega y cierre.
