title: Web Content Specialist
description: About the job Job Title: Content Specialist Location: Barcelona preferably (Remote flexibility within EU time zone) Team: Marketing Reports to: Head of Growth About Wamo Wamo is a financial platform built for business owners across Europe. We provide a modern business account experience with features like international transfers, virtual and physical cards, and smart financial tools. We’re growing quickly, expanding into multiple markets, and building a brand that resonates with real businesses and their everyday challenges. Role Overview We’re looking for a hands-on Content Specialist to join our Marketing team. You’ll be responsible for overseeing the creation, publishing, and management of high-quality content across multiple touchpoints: landing pages, blog and marketing campaigns. You’ll also coordinate the localization of this content with external partners as we scale across European markets, focused on Italy and Nordics. This is a new role on the team, with the opportunity to shape our content function from the ground up. The right candidate will eventually take on responsibility for building and leading a content team. This is a mid-level role for someone who thrives on execution, takes ownership, and can push projects forward in a fast-paced environment. What You’ll Do Oversee the creation of compelling content in English landing pages, paid campaigns and CRM/email campaigns. Manage and update content with the suppot in the CMS (Framer or similar). Collaborate with design, product, and performance teams to bring landing pages and campaigns to life. Coordinate translation/localization workflows with our external localization partner. Ensure consistency in tone, voice, and messaging across all channels. Use GA4 dashboards to monitor and report on content performance. Conduct basic content research to inform new pages and campaigns (e.g. competitor scans, topic relevance, tone calibration). Contribute to evolving our content guidelines and messaging frameworks. What We’re Looking For 2–4 years of content experience in a startup or B2B environment. Native-level or equivalent proficiency in English, with excellent writing and editing skills. Hands-on experience managing content through a CMS (e.g. Framer, Webflow, Ghost). Comfortable working across teams and managing content workflows independently. Ability to interpret GA4 dashboards and understand content impact. Experience collaborating with localization partners. Fintech or SaaS experience is a plus. Why Join Us Be part of a growing fintech company solving real problems for real businesses. Work remotely with a collaborative and pragmatic international team. Own impactful content projects from day one, with the opportunity to grow into a leadership role. Interested? Apply now or reach out to learn more about the role!

title: Business Analyst (ServiceNow CSM)
description: About the job Buscamos un/a Business Analyst para una compañía tecnológica internacional, especializada en soluciones corporativas sobre plataformas como ServiceNow. La persona seleccionada colaborará en proyectos estratégicos de transformación digital, trabajando con equipos multidisciplinares y dando soporte a entidades españolas en la adaptación e implantación de soluciones IT a nivel corporativo. Funciones: Apoyar a las entidades españolas en su proyección sobre la plataforma ServiceNow. Diseñar gaps (brechas funcionales) y proponer soluciones alternativas (workarounds). Asistir a los equipos en la preparación de sus datos maestros (master data). Dar soporte en las pruebas y en la organización operativa de los despliegues. Proporcionar formación. Requisitos: Mínimo 4 años de experiencia en roles similares Orientación a soluciones. Conocimientos del módulo CSM o sólidos conocimientos en la plataforma ITSM Español fluído + Inglés o Francés. Trabajar con nosotros te aportará: Participar en proyectos desafiantes en un entorno dinámico. Posición estable con plan de carrera dentro de la empresa. Tendrás contratación indefinida desde el primer momento. Modalidad de trabajo en remoto. Dispondrás de retribución flexible y ticket restaurant entre otros beneficios. Si te interesa la oportunidad y conocer todos los detalles, no dudes en aplicar al puesto para que podamos contactarte y hablar mejor sobre la posición, darte todos los detalles y resolver cualquier duda que te pueda surgir. Agap2 es una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades, por ello nos comprometemos a tratar todas las candidaturas por igual en función de sus capacidades, logros y experiencia. Animamos a cualquier persona a presentar su candidatura que será tratada con igualdad de oportunidades independientemente de su raza, nacionalidad, sexo, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad de género o cualquier otra característica.

title: HQ - Product Marketing Manager
description: About the job About The Role As Product Marketing Manager at Job&Talent, you’ll help define and deliver the go-to-market strategy for our most strategic products—led by our AI agents like Clara, Teo, Maria and Sara. Moving fast and leaning heavily on AI tools to deliver more with less, you’ll own campaign execution across product launches, sales enablement, and in-market performance. You’ll turn complex innovation into customer-ready narratives that scale globally. This is a hands-on, cross-functional role that requires both strategic thinking and flawless execution. You’ll collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams to launch, measure, and iterate. What You’ll Do Own and execute multi-channel launch campaigns for product and AI agent releases Develop positioning, messaging, and value props for a range of verticals and buyer personas Use AI tooling to accelerate tasks: from writing and editing to competitor analysis and campaign iteration Build and maintain sales collateral, one-pagers, training decks, internal FAQs Working with Product and Analytics team to extract data into compelling sales stories Partner with designers, AI writers, and analysts to develop campaign assets Collaborate on content creation across blog, social (LinkedIn), and podcast channels Work closely with local sales organizations to understand objections and feed that into messaging and support with local adaptations What You Bring 3–5 years in B2B product marketing, ideally in SaaS or tech-led environments Experience launching multiple products or features end to end Outstanding writing and storytelling skills Great with numbers and loves turning data into slides that speak for themselves Proven practical obsession with AI tools and how to apply them to marketing workflows Strong project management and ability to juggle priorities across teams Fluent in English and if you have an additional language, it’s very highly regarded A bias for clarity, simplicity, and speed About Us Job&Talent is a true pioneer in the staffing industry, leveraging AI and technology to revolutionize how temporary labor is sourced and managed. With a mission to empower the people who make the world go round, we are reshaping how workforces are managed globally. Our cutting-edge technology delivers unmatched productivity for clients, connecting top talent with visionary employers and streamlining the hiring process with unparalleled efficiency, transparency, and accessibility. Last year alone, we put 300,000 people to work with over 3,200 clients across 3 continents - including some of the biggest names in logistics, retail, and hospitality. Backed by powerhouse investors like Atomico, Goldman Sachs, Kinnevik, BlackRock, and SoftBank, we’re building something massive. And we are just getting started.

title: Jefe de equipo de desarrollo de producto
description: About the job Product Owner – Jefe de equipo producto SW Buscamos una persona que le guste los retos y trabajar en un entorno en el que su iniciativa le permita trabajar con libertad y confianza a la vez de ser responsable de los resultados de sus funciones. La creación de equipo y de modelos de seguimiento/planificación para la compañía le permitirá estar en primera línea de trabajo con los responsables de una de las líneas de negocio y contribuir en las decisiones que permitan la consecución de una de las líneas estratégicas de la compañía. Creemos firmemente en el trabajo deslocalizado y la organización del mismo desde una perspectiva de máxima eficiencia operativa con la flexibilidad que se requiera para crear un entorno de trabajo que permita el crecimiento personal y profesional. Como jefe de equipo de desarrollo de producto, desarrollará sus funciones en los siguientes ejes: Colaborar en la definición del plan de producto y ser responsable de la planificación y ejecución del mismos Reportar a la dirección el estado del plan y las medidas que se adoptan para la consecución del mismos Ser responsable del equipo de desarrollo de producto que es una de las líneas estratégicas de la compañía Generar cultura de empresa transmitiendo los valores de la misma y conformando un entorno de crecimiento personal y profesional del equipo. Colaborar de manera activa con el responsable de operación y el responsable tecnológico para tener en cuenta las necesidades de cara a la evolución del producto. Garantizar el cumplimiento de los planes de desarrollo de los clientes. Garantizar la correcta definición funcional y técnica de los desarrollos, así como los planes de prueba y de despliegue que garanticen la correcta consecución sin impactar a la operación. Las capacidades que se consideran necesarias para el cumplimiento de estas funciones son las siguientes: Experiencia en la gestión proyectos de desarrollos y su ciclo (definición, planificación, seguimiento, pruebas y despliegue). Experiencia en la gestión de clientes y en la demanda de desarrollo Experiencia en la gestión de equipos y en la capacitación de los mismos para fomentar un entorno de crecimiento, a la par de la consecución de los objetivos. Experiencia en herramientas de seguimiento y control de ciclo de vida de desarrollos. Experiencia en la definición de metodologías y procedimientos de seguimiento y ejecución de desarrollos de producto. Diseño y evolución de aplicaciones web Conocimiento de arquitecturas web basadas en microservicios Conocimientos en PHP, especialmente framework Symfony 2 y superiores, valorable conocimientos en JavaEE y Node.js MUY VALORABLE: Conocimiento en desarrollo de pruebas unitarias y funcionales, principios SOLID, TDD y/o arquitecturas CLEAN Conocimiento de Interfaces Rest y Soap Conocimiento de bases de datos (MySQL) Deseable conocimiento funcional del mundo Telco. Se valorará tener conocimientos en el sector de las Telecomunicaciones en los procesos de catalogación, venta, contratación, tramitación, provisión, facturación, cobro, recobro e incentivos. Se ofrece: Contrato Indefinido Salario competitivo, en función de la experiencia aportada Teletrabajo o trabajo híbrido en alguna de nuestras oficinas. Tú eliges. Jornada completa de lunes a jueves con horario flexible en entrada y salida Viernes jornada intensiva. Jornada continua en julio y agosto

title: Inbound Marketing Account Executive
description: About the job ¡Hola! 🙋 En InboundCycle, buscamos personas interesadas por el marketing digital que se puedan incorporar como Inbound Marketing Account Executives, liderando proyectos de marketing digital para nuestros clientes, aplicando la metodología Inbound y trabajando con una amplia variedad de sectores. ¿Cuáles serán las tareas principales? 📄 Diseñarás estrategias de Inbound Marketing para empresas de todo tipo y sector. Ejecutarás diversas acciones para alcanzar los objetivos previstos. Dominarás diferentes herramientas de marketing digital: HubSpot, Google Analytics, Wordpress, SE Ranking, etc. Analizarás resultados y extraerás conclusiones para mejorar futuras acciones. Trabajarás en estrecho contacto con el cliente y gestionarás los recursos necesarios para cada proyecto. ¿Con qué beneficios podrás contar? 😉 Horario flexible y modalidad 100% teletrabajo desde cualquier lugar de España. Disponibilidad para jornada completa. Mínimo nivel B2 de inglés. Habilidad para trabajar con números. Tener estudios finalizados o estar a punto de finalizarlos. Una vez ahí, haz clic en "Iniciar el proceso" y completa un breve formulario para iniciar tu candidatura. Este paso es imprescindible ya que sólo iniciamos procesos a través de nuestra página web. Una vez completado el formulario, te informaremos de los próximos pasos por correo electrónico. Si consideras que tienes el perfil adecuado y te ha interesado lo que has leído hasta ahora, ¡te estamos esperando! 🚀

title: Product Marketing Manager
description: About the job About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day. As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role Product Marketing is what propels us past the competition in the eyes of our customers. Working with Product, Design, Data Science, Engineering, Growth, and just about any other team you can think of, our world-class Product Marketers help develop jaw-dropping features, then show off how beneficial they are to millions of people through top-notch campaigns. We’re looking for a motivated Mid -Senior Product Marketing Manager to elevate our core banking products, establish Revolut as the main account for millions globally, and communicate the positive impact of Revolut to build customer trust. Up to shape the future of finance? Let's get in touch. What You'll Be Doing Understanding customer needs and how our core banking products function globally Leveraging feedback loops and trends to extract data-driven, actionable insights that inform product marketing strategy Creating and owning the product marketing strategy across all channels for our core banking products Designing impactful, data-driven quarterly roadmaps to forecast, prioritise, and deliver creative projects that increase usage of Revolut as a main account Leading the development and execution of effective launch strategies for Revolut’s core banking products Crafting value propositions, formulating clear messaging, briefing creatives, and orchestrating launches across marketing channels and geographies Developing solid cross-functional relationships in a fast-paced environment to effectively bring new products and campaigns to market What You'll Need Experience in either B2B or B2C product, brand, or consumer marketing in a fast-paced environment, preferably in a hyper-growth tech company A passion for Revolut’s products Knowledge of markets and the competitive landscape in fintech or the payments industry Experience setting strategic direction and project managing complex go-to-market campaigns that require input from cross-functional teams To have been recognised for generating highly original ideas The ability to set the standard for creative excellence while maintaining brand integrity A solid track record in consumer marketing and understanding of channels, including in-product, digital, PR, and offline activations Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to talk to anyone and work in an ever-changing, high-performance environment An exceptional eye for detail and quality Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. Important notice for candidates: Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles. Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain. We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately. By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

title: Product Owner for Apps - Android (Full remote within Spain)
description: About the job We are looking for an experienced Product Owner to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the end-to-end management of our Android applications, ensuring their successful execution from concept to launch and continuous improvement. You will act as the central communication point between various stakeholders, such as marketing, ASO, CRO, and development teams, to create a cohesive strategy that maximizes the app's value and profitability. Your role will focus on designing product roadmaps, documenting features, and overseeing the product life cycle, always keeping user experience and business goals in mind. How Will You Make a Difference Product Strategy & Roadmap: Develop and maintain a clear product vision and roadmap aligned with business objectives and user needs Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive product documentation, including user stories, acceptance criteria, and detailed feature specifications Stakeholder Management: Serve as the main point of contact for cross-functional teams, ensuring effective communication and collaboration between development, marketing, ASO, and CRO Feature Planning & Prioritization: Prioritize product backlog based on user feedback, analytics, and business priorities to ensure timely delivery of key features and improvements Market Analysis & Research: Conduct regular competitive analysis and user research to inform product decisions and strategy Performance & Monetization Oversight: Monitor KPIs, app performance, and monetization strategies to optimize app profitability and user engagement Quality Assurance: Coordinate testing and validation of new features to maintain high standards of product quality User Experience Focus: Collaborate with UX/UI designers to ensure the app delivers a seamless and engaging experience Requirements What will make you stand out from the crowd: Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Marketing, or a related field 5+ years of experience in Product Ownership or Product Management, specifically within the mobile app industry Strong understanding of Android app development and the mobile product lifecycle Proven experience working with Agile/Scrum methodologies Excellent communication skills with the ability to work across diverse teams and manage multiple stakeholders Data-driven mindset with experience in using analytics tools for decision-making Familiarity with app monetization strategies, including in-app purchases, subscriptions, and advertising models Proficient in using project management and documentation tools like JIRA, Confluence, or similar Benefits Perks of being one of us: Top-notch private health insurance — includes dental and psychological services Full-time, permanent contract Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer! Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m) Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!) Enhanced career path designed just for you External training budget Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets Budget for team-building activities We celebrate all company landmarks And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you. Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project! Location Our exceptional offices are in Barcelona's Blue Building, right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and will be able to take part in our game competitions. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Additionally, you can email us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including documentation proving your identity.

title: Senior Product Manager
description: About the job We are an iGaming company with over 4+ years of experience and a team of more than 1300+ specialists. Our achievements include 10+ major projects that are popular among our clients and successfully operate in Tier 1-3 countries. The company attracts and values highly qualified specialists, which allows us to efficiently build processes and successfully expand our presence in new locations. title: Senior Product Designer (Remote)
description: About the job The role We are an early-stage startup that is hiring an experienced Senior Product Designer to support our growing Product team. We are looking to bring on an individual who wants to positively impact the customer experience through the design of our products. From designing brand new product experiences to collaborating with engineers during implementation, you will be the go-to person for complex design challenges at B12. As a Senior Product Designer, you will: Tackle complex and/or cross-team design challenges by: Thinking systematically about all elements of the customer experience. Independently designing completely new product experiences. Contributing to our design system. Support engineers as new designs are implemented. Providing guidance and consultation, creating additional wireframes as needed. QAing and product reviewing your new designs as they are rolled out. Collaborate closely with Product Leadership to define the overall direction of the product. Identify user needs and desires through qualitative research and quantitative insights. Create user flows, wireframes, visual designs, and clickable prototypes. Identify and experiment with new design tools for the team to use. You'd be a good fit if: You have 5-8 years of experience in product design. You have experience as an independent contributor owning all aspects of the design process from inception to implementation. You have worked effectively with cross-functional teams, including Product Management, Engineering, Marketing, Customer Success, and Sales. You are attentive to detail and apply a data-driven approach to understanding what's required for great user experiences. You are confident working with Figma. You have experience or interest in using AI design tools. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You have a BA/BS/BFA or equivalent industry experience. You have experience in web design. You have experience working and collaborating with diverse teams in a high-growth environment. Don't fear We're somewhat flexible on the number of years of experience for this role. We highly favor talent, depth of experience, and interest. Some candidates may see this list and feel discouraged because they don't match all the items. Please apply anyway: there's a good chance you're more wonderful than you think you are. B12 is a safe place for human beings. We particularly encourage you to apply if you identify as a woman, are a person of color or other underrepresented minority, or are a member of the LGBTQIA community. How to apply Please provide: A pointer to your CV, resume, LinkedIn profile, portfolio, and any other summary of your career so far. Some informal text introducing yourself and what you are excited about. About B12: Our mission is to empower people to do meaningful work. B12's AI-powered website builder has been used by over a million businesses and allows users to create a professional website in seconds. Our platform also provides tools for scheduling, payments, and email marketing. We're a fully remote company, founded in 2015, and supported by investors like Breyer Capital, General Catalyst, SV Angel, and Tola Capital. Visit https://www.b12.io to learn more.

title: Digital Product Manager
description: About the job This position is 100% remote. What are we looking for? CobbleWeb, a leading developer of custom online marketplaces, is looking for an ambitious mid-career Product Manager, who would like to grow their skill-set and expertise by working on more complex and challenging e-commerce projects. We expect you to have previous hands-on experience as a frontend engineer or UX designer - this requirement is a must. This role is a good fit for someone who can balance previous methodologies and insights with new ways of working. A capacity and willingness to adapt means that you will be adept at learning from delegated tasks and feedback, supported by some coaching on the more complex marketplace-related aspects. As a critical lynchpin you are skilled at cross-functional collaboration. In conjunction with clients and technical teams, you enjoy designing optimal solutions by analysing, discussing, and aligning business goals with product specifications that are technically feasible and user-friendly. You are a curious leader who interrogates all aspects of the product development process to identify potential improvements or resolve potential conflicts. You believe that information-sharing is a valuable tool for teams to shape best-in-class solutions. If this is you, CobbleWeb may be a good fit: An independent and profitable business that is doubling in size. More than 12 years of experience in designing, building, and optimising high-growth online marketplaces. Technically complex projects often present unique business challenges that need solving. A distributed company, headquartered in London, UK, with a strong documentation and iteration culture that supports remote team members based in Europe, Africa, the Middle East, and the Caucasus region. We take full ownership of marketplace projects in close collaboration with our clients. We’re a close-knit in-house team who love working together. We don’t outsource core functions. Work-life balance Team support Career development Job fulfilment Innovative projects Responsibilities Discovery and Planning Phase: Collaborate with clients to understand their business goals and user expectations. Advocate for a lean approach, driving principles such as formulating and testing assumptions, shipping often, and incorporating user feedback. Gain client buy-in through effective use of written documents, user flow diagrams, wireframes, and design mockups. Evaluate and propose best-in-class solutions, understanding the pros and cons of different approaches. Document and update functional specifications based on feedback and contributions from team members. Development Phase Maintain a healthy product backlog, prioritising tasks based on factors such as budget, return on investment, and product-market fit. Monitor project budgets, identifying potential overspending and recommending adjustments to scope or specifications. Ensure development aligns with documented specifications and assist the testing team with test case preparation. Own the software development life cycle, ensuring well-planned and executed sprints that align with project goals. Job Requirements 5+ years of experience in a relevant role. Background and previous hands-on experience as a frontend engineer or UX designer is a must. Relevant qualifications (e.g. computer science, information technology, or business degree). Deep understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC). Experience in managing and collaborating with multiple stakeholders. Proficiency with diagramming, and project management tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence). Familiarity with Agile principles, Lean startup methodology, and the platform economy. Proven experience in the design and documentation of user journeys that consider user personas and key touchpoints in order to accomplish business goals (e.g. The buying funnel could entail selecting, comparing, ordering and paying for an item.) Proven ability to deliver projects within meticulously planned scopes, budgets and time frames, manage risk and avoid bottlenecks. Strong interpersonal and collaborative skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Your Mindset & Approach User-centric and business-goal focussed A big-picture thinker who doesn’t lose sight of the details Highly organised, thorough, analytical, and deadline-focussed Consistent in your execution of tasks Uphold high levels of productivity by not reinventing the wheel THIS JOB IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR AGENCIES.

title: Product Analytics Lead (w/m/d)
description: About the job Be our next roadsurfer! We’re looking for a Product Analytics Lead (m/f/d) to drive insights across the entire digital customer journey — from first click to feature usage. You’ll work closely with our Product, Design, and Engineering teams to understand how users interact with our platform, identify drop-offs and bottlenecks, and uncover opportunities to improve the user experience and increase conversion. Your work will shape how customers discover, explore, and experience our digital products. Most importantly, you will lead the development of our experimentation (A/B testing) strategy to ensure product decisions are data-informed and user-centered. WHY ROADSURFER? TEAM SPIRIT & TEAM EVENTS: Look forward to a collegial atmosphere with flat hierarchies, lots of fun and great team spirit, as well as regular team events such as joint sports sessions, pizza & beer evenings, etc. FLEX WORK & WORKATION: You are flexible in terms of working hours. Our Flex Work Policy enables you to switch between office days and home office days and work from abroad in Europe for one month per year PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT: We support your personal and professional development through an individual Growth Plan and our Inhouse Academy CAMPER BUDGET: You get an annual camper budget to experience the #happyroadsurfing lifestyle for yourself DISCOUNTS: Use our Corporate Benefits Platform, the Travel Industry Card and Family & Friends Discounts THE ROLE - YOUR PASSION? We’re looking for a Product Analytics Lead (m/f/d) to own and grow the insights function within our Product organization. You will lead a team of analysts, define our experimentation strategy, and work closely with cross-functional teams to improve product performance, user experience, and retention. This is a leadership position where you’ll shape how we collect and interpret behavioral data, define product KPIs, and turn analysis into clear product decisions. Lead and Develop a High-Performing Product Analytics Team Manage and grow a team of Product Analysts. Provide regular feedback, career development support, and mentorship. Promote a strong data culture focused on curiosity, impact, and product understanding. Build and Scale Our Experimentation Program Define and lead the A/B testing and experimentation strategy across platforms. Ensure statistical rigor and clarity in test setup, evaluation, and interpretation. Partner with Product Managers and Designers to embed experimentation into product development workflows. Turn Behavioral Data into Product Insights Build and maintain self-serve dashboards and deep-dive analyses to answer product questions. Uncover trends in onboarding, feature adoption, engagement, and churn using tools like GA4, Amplitude, or Mixpanel. Conduct funnel analysis, cohort analysis, and retention modeling to identify pain points and opportunities. Define and Align on Product KPIs Establish and maintain a clear product measurement framework across the customer journey. Define key metrics for success across product features and initiatives. Partner with Product Leadership to track performance and inform prioritization. Be a Strategic Advisor Work closely with Product, Engineering, UX, and Leadership to align on goals and roadmaps. Translate complex analyses into actionable insights and clear product narratives. Advocate for data-informed decision making at all stages of product discovery and delivery. WHAT YOU NEED TO SURF THE WAVE WITH US 5+ years of experience in analytics, with at least 2+ years in product analytics and people management. Proven experience leading A/B testing programs and experimentation platforms. Strong communicator who can collaborate cross-functionally and align stakeholders. Proficient in SQL and comfortable guiding analysts on query logic and data modeling. Deep experience with web and product analytics tools (e.g., GA4, Amplitude, Mixpanel). Familiar with funnel analysis, retention/cohort analysis, segmentation, and feature adoption metrics. Experience with dashboarding tools (Looker, Power BI, Metabase) — you know how to deliver insights that drive decisions. Bonus: experience with experimentation tools like Google Optimize, VWO, Optimizely, or home-grown platforms. READY TO SURF? We are looking forward to your application! If you have any questions, please drop a message to our recruiting team via: team@roadsurfer.com.

MEDDICC is a proven B2B sales framework, and trusted by the world’s top tech companies for over 25 years. What began as a learning and enablement business - founded by Andy Whyte, best-selling author of MEDDICC: The ultimate guide to staying one step ahead in the complex sale - is now evolving into a next-generation sales enablement platform. 2025 will be about building the operating system for modern sales teams—anchored around Adaptive Enablement, Applied Execution, and Actionable Insights. Lead a high-performing Scrum team: Run all agile ceremonies (planning, standups, retros) and help your team stay aligned, focused, and moving fast. You remove blockers and raise the bar. Communicate and influence: Articulate the “why” behind your roadmap. Defend trade-offs, align stakeholders, and educate the org on the impact of what’s been shipped. Qualifications 4+ years of product management experience Skilled in discovery, user research, and engaging with Sales to find signal Strong grasp of agile product development and running high-velocity teams Experience building and owning a roadmap that drives measurable outcomes Data-driven mindset: you define success, track it, and act on what you learn Excellent communicator and collaborator across disciplines Additional Information This role will report to the Chief Product Officer (laura@medddicc.com) This roles is fully remote but may require occasional travel to our studio in Cambridgeshire or Barcelona Candidate process: CV Screening > First Case Interview > Second Case Interview > Cultural Fit (C8) & References

Estamos acompañando a una compañía multinacional referente en soluciones para arquitectura, diseño y construcción, con más de 20 años de actividad en el mercado ibérico. Buscamos una figura estratégica para liderar la especificación técnica y creativa en Baleares, conectando la innovación con quienes diseñan, proyectan y transforman los espacios. ✨ Tu impacto: Serás el nexo entre producto, prescriptores y grandes proyectos. Posicionarás soluciones de alto valor ante arquitectos, interioristas, promotoras y constructoras. Impulsarás la marca en proyectos icónicos: hoteles, retail, oficinas, espacios educativos y residencias premium. Mapearás relaciones clave e influirás en la decisión técnica y estética desde la fase de diseño hasta la ejecución. Activarás el mercado con lanzamientos, eventos, formaciones y visitas a obra. Colaborarás con equipos de marketing, producto, ventas y servicio para llevar cada propuesta al siguiente nivel. 🧩 ¿Quién encaja aquí? Profesionales con experiencia en prescripción o especificación técnica, ya sea desde el lado del fabricante o desde el mundo del diseño y la arquitectura. Perfiles con sensibilidad estética y criterio técnico. Personas autónomas, estratégicas y con vocación comercial. Conocimiento de herramientas CRM (idealmente Salesforce). Valorable: catalán/mallorquín e inglés. 🧭 Se requiere disponibilidad para viajes locales (3 días en terreno / 2 en remoto). 🌍 Lo que ofrece el proyecto: Formar parte de un grupo internacional con +10.000 personas y alrededor de 5000 millones de euros de facturación. Un entorno de filial ibérica reconocida como referente dentro del grupo, con un crecimiento constante. Entorno creativo, transversal y con mucha autonomía. Visibilidad real y participación activa en decisiones clave para la zona. 📩 Si te inspira dejar huella en el sector y trabajar codo a codo con quienes diseñan los espacios del futuro... este reto es para ti.

title: Head of Product - (Remote, Spain)
description: About the job About Bark Bark is revolutionising the way people find professionals in over 1,000 unique categories. As the UK's largest and fastest-growing services marketplace, we're on a mission to make finding the right professional quick and easy. With a presence in eleven countries and plans for further expansion, joining us at this genuinely exciting time will be a journey like no other. Our cutting-edge technology ensures that you can always find the best professional for any job. With a talented team of over 250 dedicated individuals, we're committed to providing exceptional service and ensuring that our customers are satisfied every step of the way. This is an exciting time to join our scaling business, we recently placed in the Sunday Times Best Places to Work 2024. As a profitable scale-up, Bark is in a unique position to offer the best of both worlds; the excitement and agility of a start up combined with the financial security and backing of a renowned private equity firm, EMK Capital. You'll have ownership, agility, responsibility and stimulation without any of the worry. *Please note you must be based in Spain to be considered for this fully remote role About the role We are looking for a gifted Head of Product to join our team and take ownership of our Professional proposition. They are at the heart of Bark, fulfilling the jobs our Consumers come to us to get done, and their success is our success. Reporting into the CPO, your role will be to define how we attract the best service providers to our platform, and how we provide them value through winning jobs and helping to grow and manage their business. This is a fascinating time to join, as we transform our already highly profitable lead-gen model into a hybrid Marketplace, with the goal of generating more business between Consumers and Professionals across nearly 1,000 categories. You’ll focus on driving user satisfaction and retention, with huge scope to define the future of our platform achieve this - we’re open to big changes to achieve our big ambitions! Your remit will span 3 cross-functional squads focused on the success of our Professionals, but this is likely to expand as we continue to increase the focus on the Professional side of our Marketplace. Your target user will be 2-10 person SMEs, You’ll fit right in if you’re obsessed with understanding and solving these businesses’ problems at scale, love thinking big but relish data and detail, and are passionate about building high-performing teams. We’d love to hire someone with a track record of having worked across multiple Product teams in a marketplace context before, and especially so if you’ve got experience of delivering Product-led growth. We’re already profitable and incredibly proud of what we’ve achieved so far, but we know that most of our work is ahead of us. We have huge aspirations, and our growth plans are product-led, so it’s a great time to join and contribute to revolutionising how people buy and sell services online, in the way that Amazon did for physical products. Responsibilities Set the vision and strategy for Bark’s Professional experience, ensuring it’s aligned with our overall vision and optimised for the success of 2-10 person SMEs Align and inspire across the Product team and the wider business, from C-suite to Customer Support teams, including leading cross-functional working groups as part of Bark’s operational structure Manage and coach a team of Product Managers, helping them to be exceptional across all 4 of our Product Management competency areas - Business Impact, Execution, User Insight and Strategy & Leadership Assist in designing an organisational structure that maximises our chances of success Accelerate autonomous decision-making within our agile squads through clarity of priority and strategy Contribute to the efficiency of our outcome-centric discovery and delivery processes, providing impactful feedback on work at all stages Obsess over our users and lead others to do the same. Use qual and quant inputs to understand them better than anyone and shape our strategy Take real ownership of the impact of your squads, helping them balance iterative wins with longer-term strategic change Required skills and experience Proven track record as a leader in Product Management working in a fast-paced and successful online business Experience in working on a Marketplace product, and an understanding of the needs of SMEs that provide services Experience building effective Product strategies, supporting teams to deliver them and driving Product-led growth (growth Marketing expertise are a bonus) Expert in using both qual and quant data points to form user understanding, and conclusions, and guide decision making Collaborated and managed a diverse range of stakeholders outside across Design, Engineering, Insights, Marketing, Sales, Finance, Customer Support and HR Excellent communicator - you’re able to clearly present your ideas, explain your thinking, and discuss detail confidently at all levels Well-versed in lean approaches and agile methodologies to minimise waste and maximise impact A self-starter that is comfortable working autonomously, whilst always remembering collaboration is key to success Driven, ambitious and keen to grow with the company Nice to have: Experience building products for small businesses, or service businesses. Perks and Benefits Fully remote working Personal annual L&D Budgets with 600€ to spend on your development Being at the forefront of an industry with new and exciting problems to solve Interview Process Screening Call with Talent Partner (30 mins) 1st Stage - Interview with CPO or Director of Product (30 mins) 2nd Stage - Technical Task (120 mins) 3rd Stage - Final interview (60 mins) 4th Stage - Interview with stakeholders (can be combined with final interview) Diversity Statement At Bark, we are a platform for people, revolutionising the way professionals and individuals connect since 2014. Our culture is defined by excitement, ambition, and a commitment to raising the bar. We value diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) and are dedicated to embedding these principles into everything we do. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, and our focus is on hiring, retaining and developing a globally diverse workforce that is passionate about excelling our platform and supporting our customers succeed. Be part of our dynamic team, where bold ideas thrive, and create a future worth shouting about.

title: Product Assessor / Senior Product Assessor - Active Devices
description: About the job We are SGS – the world's leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for sustainability, quality and integrity. Our 99,600 employees operate a network of 2,600 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world. Job Description Are you ready to take your career to the next level? If you have a strong background as a Product Assessor within an EU notified body conducting MDD/MDR technical documentation review, then we have an exhilarating opportunity for you! Join our dynamic team at SGS and become a Senior Product Assessor - Active Devices. This role will allow you to make a significant impact in the field of certification. As a member of our Medical Device team, you will not only manage a small team of globally based Product Assessors but also dive deep into the exciting world of Active Medical Devices. Your responsibilities will include: Supporting and guiding your team of talented Product Assessors Conducting thorough technical documentation reviews and ensuring compliance with EU regulations and standards. Collaborating with cross-functional teams to increase efficiency and quality Monitoring the team's technical competence, KPIs, and wellbeing and providing feedback and support when there are concerns. Conduct recruitment, including reviewing CVs and undertaking interviews and supporting with onboarding of new starters Develop training and present the training to others in SGS or externally as deemed necessary. Assist with technical queries and those related to sales within the Active Medical Devices field. Ensure that the highest level of service is provided throughout the SGS network offering medical devices certification and stakeholders through efficient service delivery. Qualifications For application, please submit English CV. To be eligible for this role, you should have prior experience as a Product Assessor/Specialist/Technical File Reviewer within another Notified Body for active devices, conducting reviews against MDD and/or MDR. Additionally, you must possess: Four years of professional experience in the field of healthcare products or related activities, such as design, manufacturing, auditing, or research, of which two years shall be in the design, manufacture, testing, or use of the device or technology to be assessed or related to the scientific aspects to be assessed; Active Medical Devices knowledge (monitoring equipment, therapeutic devices, devices utilizing radiation, stand-alone software devices, etc.) through designing, manufacturing, or testing of such devices; Thorough knowledge and understanding of related standards: EN 60601, EN 62304, EN 62366, etc.; Good written English skills (as reports will be reviewed/queried in English); Knowledge of the following Technical File codes desirable (as per COMMISSION IMPLEMENTING REGULATION (EU) 2017/2185 of 23 November 2017): MDA0201, MDA0202, MDA0203, MDA0204, MDA0301, MDA0302, MDA0303, MDA0304, MDA0305, MDA0306, MDA0307, MDA0308, MDA0309, MDA0310, MDA0311, MDA0312, MDA0313, MDA0314, MDA0315, MDA0316, MDA0317, and MDA0318. Additional Information Why SGS? Join a globally recognized and stable company, a leader in the Testing, Inspection, and Certification (TIC) industry. Enjoy a flexible schedule and remote work model. Access SGS University and Campus for continuous learning options. Thrive in a multinational environment, collaborating with colleagues from multiple continents. Benefit from our comprehensive benefits platform. Join Us: At SGS, we are dedicated to fostering an open, friendly, and supportive culture that thrives on teamwork. We value diversity and provide endless opportunities to learn, grow your expertise, and fulfill your potential.

title: Product Marketing Specialist (m/f/d)
description: About the job About Buynomics: At Buynomics, we transform how companies understand their customers through our groundbreaking Virtual Shoppers AI technology. By leveraging large-scale simulation technologies, we predict purchase behavior with unmatched speed and precision, enabling data-driven, transparent, and customer-centric commercial decisions. Our mission is to become the operating system for commercial decisions, providing a single source of truth for all market-facing questions, including pricing, product offers, and promotions. Join us and be a part of the next-generation SaaS company in pricing and product optimization. We are seeking a creative and results-oriented Product Marketing Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will focus on three key areas: executing high-impact account-based marketing (ABM) campaigns, developing compelling content for product marketing and sales enablement, and designing structured learning experiences for the Buynomics Academy. You will work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Customer Success teams to ensure our go-to-market efforts are aligned, our teams are equipped to close deals, and product adoption continues to grow. ABM Campaigns: Plan, execute, and optimize account-based marketing (ABM) campaigns in collaboration with the growth marketing team, leveraging multiple channels including email, paid media, and dedicated content (e.g., sales enablement materials). Partner closely with the sales team to craft personalized outreach strategies for high-value accounts. Monitor ABM performance metrics and apply insights to continuously refine campaign strategies. Content Creation and Sales Enablement: Lead the creation of impactful product content such as case studies, landing pages, email copy, blog posts, and product or industry one-pagers. Ensure alignment between product messaging and all marketing content, delivering clear value to target audiences. Produce content rooted in a deep understanding of our ideal customer profile (ICP) and industry trends. Conduct market research to support go-to-market strategies, product positioning, and expansion into new verticals and geographies. Utilize data and analytics to optimize content and campaigns, ensuring alignment with business objectives and customer needs. Educational Content Development: Own the end-to-end design and delivery of structured learning paths tailored to clients and internal stakeholders. Collaborate with subject matter experts to develop high-quality course materials, scripts, and assessments. Partner with clients to create customized educational programs for key accounts. Analyze learner engagement and feedback to iterate and enhance educational content continuously. What you'll need: 2–3 years of experience in product marketing; B2B SaaS background preferred. Demonstrated success in executing or supporting marketing campaigns. Exceptional writing and storytelling abilities. Familiarity with learning management systems (LMS) or educational content development is a plus. Strategic thinker with a hands-on execution mindset. Strong collaborator with a data-driven approach. What we offer: Dynamic Environment: Join a truly international and diverse team where your ideas matter. Flexible Work Model: Enjoy a remote setup with offices located in Cologne and Barcelona. Learning Budget: Take advantage of our employee development and education budget to enhance your skills. Local Language Classes: Participate in language lessons to support your integration and personal development. Health insurance package Personal and professional growth opportunities Regular company events To ensure a smooth and efficient process and that no applications are overlooked, please apply directly to the role. While we'd love to respond to everyone who reaches out, applying ensures that your application is properly tracked and considered. Buynomics is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. This means that we don’t discriminate based on race or ethnic origin, color, the language(s) you speak, where you (or your parents) are from, or whether or not you consider yourself to have a disability. Neither will your age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, beliefs, or political opinions play a part in your application with us. We’re a diverse team in so many ways, and we love it that way.

title: Research Analyst
description: About the job Freelancer opportunity! Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online. Our journey began with Proton Mail, the world’s largest secure email service, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their data, escape Big Tech surveillance, and protect themselves from censorship and interference. Proton supports more than 100 million accounts globally, is profitable and independent, and is home to a diverse team of 500+ people from over 50 countries. You’ll work alongside some of the brightest minds from top companies, startups, and universities, united by a mission to build a better internet. If you're driven by impact and excited to work on privacy-first technology used by journalists, governments, activists, and everyday citizens around the world — join us. 🎯 Purpose of the role As Research Analyst, you will support fast-paced qualitative and quantitative research initiatives across marketing and product teams. Working closely with Proton’s Senior Researcher, you'll help scale insights work across brand tracking, messaging tests, campaign evaluation, audience segmentation, and content research. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in hands-on research operations, has strong tooling knowledge, and is motivated by meaningful, privacy-driven work. 💼 What you will do Support ongoing qualitative interviews and usability research: Transcribe and clean interview recordings Tag themes and extract insights Identify powerful quotes and create highlight reels Prepare and manage research materials: discussion guides, surveys, and creative stimuli Assist with brand/campaign tracker fieldwork: survey setup, QA, panel logistics Coordinate with vendors: recruitment, incentives, screener design, GDPR consent Draft and edit surveys for PR, blog, or product marketing use Contribute to research deliverables: Summary documents and slide decks Charts, coded data outputs, and insight tables Help ensure that insights are well-organized, stakeholder-friendly, and actionable 🧠 Job requirements 2+ years of hands-on experience in UX or market research (agency, in-house, or freelance) Fluency in English (written and spoken); Spanish and/or French are a plus Comfortable with tools like: Qualitative: Dovetail, Lookback, Condens, Maze, UserTesting Survey: Typeform, Qualtrics, SurveyMonkey Design: Figma, Miro, Canva Data: R, SPSS, Stata, or Python (basic level for data wrangling or analysis) Familiarity with participant recruitment platforms such as Cint, Toluna, Dynata, User Interviews Understanding of screener development, GDPR/CCPA consent collection, and data hygiene Strong organizational skills, responsiveness, and comfort in a distributed team Clear communicator who can document and translate insights for diverse audiences 🚀 Bonus skills Experience moderating interviews or usability tests Background in diary studies or longitudinal research Experience in privacy-tech, developer, or B2B user research Ability to brief or evaluate third-party research vendors 🤝 Our commitment to diversity and inclusion At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission. We are committed to building an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, ability, or background, feel respected and empowered. If you require accommodations during the hiring process, please let your Talent Partner know. 🔒 Candidate Privacy Notice By applying to Proton Technologies AG, you agree to the processing of your personal data for recruitment purposes as outlined in our Privacy Policy. Your information will be stored in Greenhouse and retained only as long as needed for current or future role consideration.

title: Sr. Product Manager Servicios Financieros (H/M)
description: About the job ¿Quieres liderar el diseño de productos que optimizan el corazón financiero de una EdTech en plena transformación? En Northius, el mayor grupo de formación online en España con +10 escuelas, +40.000 nuevos estudiantes cada año y presencia en más de 17 países, estamos revolucionando cómo miles de personas acceden a educación práctica y orientada a la empleabilidad. Nuestro compromiso es facilitar esa transformación vital que permite cambiar de carrera, crecer profesionalmente, y construir un futuro más estable. Para lograrlo, también debemos transformar desde dentro. Y ahí entras tú. Estamos buscando un/a Senior Product Manager que lidere la creación de productos potentes, útiles y transformadores para nuestras áreas Financieras, Administrativas y Legales. Una persona que combine visión de producto, capacidad analítica avanzada, profundo conocimiento financiero y pasión por resolver problemas complejos. Challenge Northius no es una empresa financiera, pero sin finanzas no hay impacto educativo. Queremos rediseñar desde cero los productos que dan soporte a nuestra operación financiera: desde la contabilidad hasta la gestión de cobros, desde las compras hasta los sistemas de recobro, pasando por la facturación, la tesorería y la gestión de contratos. Una parte clave del reto será diseñar e implementar herramientas inteligentes basadas en IA o potenciadas por IA, que nos permitan anticipar comportamientos de pago, optimizar la gestión de deuda, automatizar flujos operativos y tomar mejores decisiones. Esto implicará colaborar estrechamente con nuestros equipos de Applied AI y Product Science para crear productos donde la inteligencia artificial sea parte del diseño, no un añadido posterior. Tu reto será identificar oportunidades de mejora reales, mapear procesos actuales (a veces caóticos), proponer soluciones sostenibles, y liderar productos que permitan eficiencia, control y escalabilidad sin fricciones internas. Puede que no suene muy glamuroso. Pero no lo dudes: es vital porque es lo que nos permitirá crecer con orden y ofrecer mejores experiencias a nuestros alumnos, empleados y proveedores. ¿Qué buscamos? Estamos en la búsqueda de un/a Senior Product Manager que lidere con visión y pasión la transformación de la educación. Queremos a alguien que pueda tomar decisiones con la misma confianza que tiene para liderar experimentos; una persona capaz de decir: "lo validamos con datos". Alguien que no teme cometer errores porque sabe que de ellos se aprende, y solo aprendiendo podemos crecer para ayudar a nuestros alumnos. En suma, una persona que esté lista para ayudar a Northius a construir una experiencia educativa moderna y de alto impacto. ¿Qué harás? Liderarás el ciclo completo de productos asociados a finanzas y pagos: desde la ideación hasta la puesta en marcha y evolución posterior, validando siempre con datos y KPIs de negocio. Diseñarás soluciones centradas en procesos internos críticos: facturación, morosidad, recobro, pagos a proveedores, conciliaciones, fiscalidad, auditoría, etc. Colaborarás con equipos de Administración, Compras, Legal, Tesorería, Finanzas y Control de Gestión, convirtiéndote en su socio estratégico y agente de cambio. Trabajarás mano a mano con nuestros especialistas en Applied AI y Data Analytics, por lo que se espera de ti una sólida capacidad para definir, analizar y transformar métricas financieras complejas. Serás un referente en diseño de procesos, ayudando a modelar operaciones que pueden ser human-centric, AI-centric o human-AI augmented, y definiendo cuál es el enfoque más adecuado en cada caso. Participarás en la co-creación de la cultura de producto en un entorno en pleno crecimiento, donde el liderazgo de producto va mucho más allá de la gestión de tickets. ¿Qué necesitamos de ti? 5+ años de experiencia como Product Manager en entornos de alta complejidad financiera, idealmente en empresas B2B, SaaS, FinTech o similares. Conocimiento sólido de conceptos de contabilidad, conciliación bancaria, fiscalidad, deuda y gestión de cobros, así como sensibilidad por los temas legales y regulatorios. Background o familiaridad profunda con áreas como Recobro, Risk Management, Backoffice financiero o herramientas tipo ERP (como Business Central, SAP o similares). Alta capacidad analítica y comodidad trabajando con modelos financieros, cohortes de deuda, márgenes y rentabilidad operativa. Experiencia trabajando con equipos técnicos, legales y financieros, con capacidad para traducir sus necesidades en soluciones reales, no solo “requisitos”. Dominio real y aplicado de herramientas de Inteligencia Artificial generativa y analítica para mejorar tu productividad, toma de decisiones y capacidad de descubrimiento. En nuestro equipo, el uso avanzado de IA ya no es un diferencial: es el nuevo ofimático. Capacidad para navegar procesos cambiantes, identificar puntos de fricción y orquestar la evolución organizativa necesaria para escalar. ¿Qué te ofrecemos? Formar parte del equipo de Producto, Data & Tecnología (PED) de una empresa que está transformando el sector educativo. Posibilidad de trabajar 100% remoto desde cualquier parte de España o asistir a nuestras oficinas en Madrid, A Coruña ó Barcelona. Horario flexible para que puedas equilibrar tus responsabilidades personales y laborales. Jornada intensiva en verano, todos los viernes y las vísperas de festivos. Un plan de formación y desarrollo para que sigas creciendo profesionalmente. Una cultura que valora la colaboración, el uso de datos para tomar decisiones, y donde equivocarse es parte del proceso de aprendizaje. Acceso a beneficios como seguro médico, cheque gourmet, y descuentos en servicios de bienestar. En Northius creemos que la educación cambia vidas. Ayúdanos a seguir construyendo esos cimientos que permiten a las personas soñar y crecer. Si quieres unirte a una empresa que no solo educa, sino que transforma, ¡este es tu lugar! ¿Con quién vas a trabajar? En Northius Trabajamos Más De 1400 Empleados, Pero El Equipo De Producto, Ingeniería y Datos Acaba De Crearse En 2023. Éstas Son Algunas De Las Personas Que Lo Lideran y Con Las Que Trabajarías En El Día a Día Federico Heinen (Head of Product): Ex-Mercado Libre y Ex-LATAM Airlines, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el mundo online, interacciones digitales y gestión de productos en entornos B2C, B2B y B2B2C. Alberto Baselga (CIO): Ex-Coverwallet y enamorado de los ecosistemas de producto. Es un Startup Advisor e Investor y toda su carrera ha girado en torno a compañías digitales de alta generación de impacto. Antonio Espinosa (Head of Engineering): Ex-Ontruck y Ex-Jobandtalent, con más de 6 años de experiencia liderando equipos de ingeniería. Está haciendo crecer el equipo de ingeniería. Daniel Ruiz (Head of Applied AI): Ex-Coverwallet y Ex-Cabify. Experto en inteligencia artificial aplicada con una sólida trayectoria en ciencia de datos y análisis de producto. Antonio Corzo (Head of Agile Ops): Ex- Capitole y Ex-Atlax 360. Apasionado por los retos, maximiza la productividad de los equipos y fomenta la colaboración. Cree en el valor de las personas y sus interacciones. ¿Estás listo/a para impactar el futuro de miles de personas? ¡Aplica ahora! #PeopleOnTop #Remoto #Northius

title: Product Marketing - Associate Manager/Manager
description: About the job Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead. At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors. As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment. Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities. The Role We are in search of exceptional product marketing talent to help us promote highly scalable, true multitenant cloud solutions that are significantly impacting life sciences. Our focus is on customer satisfaction, employee success, and growth. The Product Marketing Associate Manager/Manager will be an important addition to our growing marketing team and will help support demand generation, field enablement, and customer marketing activities. This person will collaborate with global Marketing, Product Strategy, Product Management, Sales, and Professional Services to drive Veeva’s growth and our customers’ success. What You’ll Do Support go-to-market programs for new offerings, market segments, and geographies Gain a deep understanding of buyer needs and how Veeva solutions meet those needs Develop product messaging to be used across all media and customer engagement channels Partner closely with product and market strategy to gain a deep understanding of product vision, upcoming functionality, and determine how best to communicate this externally Build product awareness through PR, article placements, and social media Proactively identify customer success and bring those stories to life for use in marketing Create content (e.g. thought leadership, videos, website copy, blog posts, infographics) to articulate the benefits of the solution to the marketplace Create and maintain a library of sales tools, such as customer presentations and competitive materials Requirements 2+ years of B2B product marketing experience; demonstrated success marketing complex enterprise cloud software solutions Able to work independently with little management oversight Exceptional written and oral communication skills with a demonstrated ability to develop clear, concise, compelling messaging and a persuasive writing style Strong presentation skills Fast learner, detail-oriented, and must enjoy fast-paced work environments Proven ability to build relationships with other teams and across all levels Self-motivated, innovative, collaborative, creative, and analytical Strong project management skills with exceptional attention to detail Nice to Have Life sciences industry experience Fluency in French or Spanish Perks & Benefits The chance to work with a genuine market leader Incredible support from the wider team, and a best-in-class tech stack to help you be successful in your role. Work anywhere policy – You can utilise our office spaces or work remotely when you need to. Health & wellness reimbursements Veeva Giving 1% #RemoteSpain Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. As an equal opportunity employer, Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

title: Advanced Product Manager - Digital Trust
description: About the job Feedzai is the world’s first RiskOps platform for financial risk management, and the market leader in safeguarding global commerce with today’s most advanced cloud-based risk management platform, powered by machine learning and artificial intelligence. Feedzai is securing the transition to a cashless world while enabling digital trust in every transaction and payment type. The world’s largest banks, processors, and retailers trust Feedzai to protect trillions of dollars and manage risk while improving the customer experience for everyday users, without compromising privacy. Feedzai is a Series D company and has raised $282M to date. With a valuation of +$1.5B, the company's technology protects 900 million people in 190 countries. The Product Team builds our product to disrupt the financial crime industry from a data-led approach. We partner with our clients using a holistic lens and have result-driven solutions to manage financial risk with a cloud-first platform and a world-class UX interface. Being part of this team, you have a voice in planning, strategizing, and challenging the status quo. Your thoughts and ideas are valued. Our fast-paced and open environment encourages us to lean in, try new things, and discover our potential. We define and act on what could be in tomorrow's world, not on what is today. Join Us! You We are looking for an Advanced Product Manager with a strong customer focus and a passion for building great products to join us in this exciting journey and support the definition and execution of Feedzai’s Digital Trust Product vision & strategy. As a highly motivated and enthusiastic Advanced Product Manager at Feedzai you will play a crucial role in the development of our Digital Trust solution, working across Research and Labs, Engineering, Data Science, Business and Design, and Feedzai customers. Understanding both the technical and business side of Feedzai’s Digital Trust solution, you will be responsible for developing technologically advanced capabilities that utilise device, behavioural biometric and cyber threat intelligence signals to build out a persistent re-identification of customer trust / customer threats, and practically drive forward the Digital Trust roadmap. You will be a self-starter with an ability to think strategically, act pragmatically, and have the tenacity, energy and passion to innovate and implement change within the time and resource constraints of an ever changing domain and environment. Furthermore, supporting customer facing teams within Feedzai, and customers themselves, you will be responsible for ensuring that the Digital Trust solution is responsive to changing technology standards and real-world problems. Keeping up-to-date with new threats, new trends and new techniques in signal gathering and processing you will help drive the development of Digital Trust capabilities around Network, Device and Threat / Malware related analysis and detection, and help ensure their practical real-world application and usability. Your Day-to-Day Research and analysis of key risks within the digital fraud landscape; analysing, developing, building and testing new detection capabilities that utilise data and risk signals from device, behavioural biometric and cyber threat intelligence to recognise user persistency, threat indicators and behavioural anomalies Develop product scope and definition for features on the Digital Trust product roadmap, working with all Feedzai teams (e.g. Research/Labs, Engineers, SME, Data Science, etc.) to ensure that technical and PRD documentation is managed through initiation to completion Be responsible for actively managing customer feedback through a documented and tracked REQ’s process, promoting resolution through the roadmap and providing evidence to demonstrate that key customer requests are progressing into the Digital Trust product releases Consult with wider stakeholders to ensure that Product, Customer and Industry requirements are referenced and documented in the roadmap, escalating where necessary any deviation from these requirements in the development lifecycle Help coordinate and support the development of sprint / multi-sprint activities across the engineering development team, ensuring all contributors are clear on the scope of feature delivery, and the role that feature plays within our wider Solution ecosystem Partner with cross-functional teams and key internal and external stakeholders to define, prioritise and align product roadmap. Work closely with other departments to ensure alignment on the vision and execution (Research, Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, etc) Work with UX/UI Designers, utilise product analytics to develop a deep understanding of user behaviour and identify opportunities for rapid experimentation and product enhancements You Have & You Know-How BSc / MSc in Computer Science, Cyber Threat Intelligence, or similar technical degree 5+ years of experience in Product Management for a Digital or Cyber Intelligence product, or platform with exposure to Device, Network and/or Malware signals and Intelligence Proven experience working with cross-functional teams to prioritize and deliver a roadmap with modern software development practices Language skills: English and preferably Spanish and/or Portuguese Your First 30-Days At Feedzai You will be immersed in our brand with training, connections, and one-on-one time with your manager. You may shadow your colleagues virtually or onsite at an office depending on where you work as you are supported through your Feedzai journey. In addition, you will have access to a ton of information to give you history, context, and all the knowledge you can handle about Feedzai and the team. Finally, you will start working on projects and collaborating on work currently being done. We can't wait to have you join the team! Life at Feedzai Instagram Feedzai Culture Feedzai is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Feedzai does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. Feedzai will use the personal data you provide us with by filling out this form for reviewing your application and to potentially negotiate a contract with you. Your personal data will be retained by Feedzai for 24 months following your application. Please see our Privacy Notice available at https://www.feedzai.com/legal/feedzai-candidate-privacy-policy/ and https://www.feedzai.com/legal/feedzai-california-candidates-privacy-policy/ for more information on how we process your personal data.

title: Data Product Owner
description: About the job ¡Hola! 🙋 ¿Todavía no conoces HIBERUS? Somos una empresa de #tecnología construida con un ingrediente diferencial, la HIPERESPECIALIZACIÓN. Formar parte de hiberus significa crecimiento, pasión por la tecnología, interés por la innovación, ambiente laboral flexible y colaborativo, compañerismo, aprendizaje, formación continua, motivación y superación ante nuevos retos...y esto es solo el principio. Somos más de 3.700 profesionales y no paramos de crecer!🙌 Actualmente contamos con 36 hubs de desarrollo en España, Europa, Latinoamérica, Estados Unidos y África. ¡Estamos redefiniendo el mapa tecnológico mundial! 🌐 💻 Trabajamos muy duro, para transformar nuestra vida a través de la tecnología y queremos contar contigo para seguir creciendo. Si lo tuyo es el mundo IT, te gusta estar al día en las últimas tecnologías y quieres asumir un nuevo reto profesional ¡Sigue leyendo, te estamos buscando!! 🔎¿Qué estamos buscando?
