Buscamos una persona que nos ayude a seguir creciendo, con ganas de aportar y seguir evolucionando de la mano de los mejores profesionales, pero sobre todo... ¡en Hiberus buscamos buena gente! 😉 🖋️ Requisitos y funciones Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería o campo relacionado Más de 5 años de experiencia como Product Owner o puesto similar en proyectos de Data. Gran conocimiento del almacenamiento y la gestión de datos, especialmente con Databricks. Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y colaboración, con expeiencia trabajando con clientes internos y partes interesadas dentro de un programa de IoT Inglés C1 Deseable conocimiento del sector industrial Tareas y responsabilidades Definir y priorizar las características y requisitos del producto según las necesidades internas del cliente y las tendencias de la industria. Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con el equipo de desarrollo para garantizar la entrega oportuna de las características del producto. Colaborar con las partes interesadas internas dentro del programa IoT para garantizar la alineación con la visión y la hoja de ruta del producto. Identificar nuevas oportunidades y áreas de mejora. Desarrollar y mantener la documentación del producto, incluidas historias de usuarios, cartera de productos y planes de lanzamiento. Supervisar el rendimiento del producto y los comentarios de los usuarios para identificar áreas de mejora. Gestionar problemas técnicos y tickets dentro del equipo de desarrollo. Trabajar con equipos multifuncionales para garantizar el lanzamiento y la adopción exitosos del producto 🙌¿Qué te ofrecemos? 💼 Contrato indefinido en una compañía puramente tecnológica, que forma parte de un gran grupo, solvente y en crecimiento. 💰 Salario fijo competitivo + bonificación 🏠 Acuerdos de teletrabajo 🏖️ Ambiente familiar, cercano, ¡como una gran familia! ⏰ Conciliación con nuestra vida personal y laboral mediante horario flexible, acuerdos de teletrabajo, desconexión digital, jornada intensiva viernes y verano. 🤙 Cultura “techie”, nos gusta estar en contacto con la tecnología, herramientas, y últimas novedades! 📚 ¡Formación! Siempre que quieras, disfrutarás de un amplio catálogo de cursos formativos, adaptados a tu perfil profesional, inquietudes y novedades del sector. Para ello, pondremos a tu disposición todo el potencial de nuestra Hiberus University y los acuerdos con los principales fabricantes. 💳 ¡Benefíciate! Programa de retribución flexible a medida: seguro médico, tarjeta de transporte público, cheques guardería, tarjeta restaurante, etc. En Hiberus estamos viviendo un crecimiento explosivo 💥 y queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo. Suena bien, ¿verdad? Si quieres saber más, ¡inscríbete y te contamos! Si quieres saber más busca nuestros hashtag #somoshiberus #lascosasocurrenaquí y conoce todo lo que hacemos. Hablamos? www.hiberus.com #somosHiberus y tú? Te animas?🚀

title: Manager, Product Delivery
description: About the job THE ORGANIZATION The Entrepreneurs’ Organization (EO) is a high-quality support network of 18,000 business founders and owners in 220 chapters and 80 countries worldwide. EO’s purpose is to move the world forward by unlocking the full potential of entrepreneurs. Since 1987, EO has helped entrepreneurs achieve transformational growth through the power of life-enhancing connections, shared experiences, and collaborative learning. Guided by EO’s core values: trust and respect, thirst for learning, think big, be bold, and together we grow, EO’s international staff collaborates successfully across diverse cultures. As an EO employee, you will gain access to the world’s top experts in entrepreneurship, grow beyond your perceived limits, and make breakthroughs as you refine and realize your personal goals. EO’s competitive total rewards package, flexible work environment, and generous professional development resources are frequently cited as among the most popular benefits of working at EO. Position Summary The Manager of Products is part of the team that helps to plan, co-design, and execute global programs (in-person and hybrid) within the products department including global learning, forum, and communities. This individual partners with top content providers and top higher education institutions and vendors, develops and executes virtual programs (such as Nano Learning, Powerhouse speakers series), and forum events among other initiatives. This team member adds value by acquiring and overseeing programs from start to finish including negotiating with vendors, advocating and negotiating new partnerships, prepping speakers, HEI and service providers for our unique audience, seeing tailor-made executive education programs through to execution, and conducting needs assessments for providing training opportunities according to member challenges. Staying cool under stress and pressure, delivering on deadlines, demonstrating agility, creative thinking, a can- do attitude, global mindset, and a thirst for continual learning are all musts. The Products Manager liaises with various member teams to deliver on action plans and works cooperatively with learning colleagues for a range of Products initiatives from live to virtual events. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Product Program Management Manage assigned products and programs from needs assessment to execution and evaluation. Evaluate learning, forum, and community programs across the world, conducts RFPs, and manage the vendor selection process. Serve as product owner and event organizer requiring oversight of product data, financial records, marketing, etc. Liaise with the products team and products portfolio to gather stakeholder input and adjust product delivery according to plan and budget. Co-design tailor-made programs that fit our members' needs and provide input to curriculum delivery including agenda, content, and speakers. Conduct site visits as necessary. Negotiate partnerships with Higher Education Institutions (HEI) and content providers (including international speakers and speaker bureaus). Market products to users. Oversee registrations and member inquiries. Evaluate programs, conduct program debriefing, suggest program improvements and implement changes. Track program analytics and reports. Maintain an active learning component, including competitor analyses, new learning technologies, and best practices across the industry; as well as being knowledgeable of future trends in the learning industry. Virtual Learning Plan and produce NanoLearning series from start to finish: curate and contract speakers and video vendors, project management, provide video editing feedback Produce new contents for the LMS as needed Manage the LMS and Products video content Portfolio Work Align with Portfolio Marketing initiatives and participate in developing the product journey and product archetypes Liaise with analysis teams to provide support and insights for quarterly and annual reports and product reviews. Oversee all program process documentation to create consistency across all learning and portfolio products. Participates in the Products Portfolio projects and meetings as needed. Qualifications, Skills, And Knowledge Required Bachelor’s degree Experience with adult learning, event, instructional design, project management, contract negotiation, and associations all pluses. Must have strong ability to work in teams with high accountability, willingness to work with ease across cultures, geographies, and time zones, and strong written and verbal communication skills in English. Fluency in a second language and international experience are all pluses. Exceptionally strong organizational and time management skills required. Ability to travel up to 20% of the time, both domestic and cross borders. ADA SPECIFICATIONS Professional workplace where business casual attire is required. Ability to work in a fast paced and global complex environment. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties and responsibilities of the role.

title: Product Owner (People Product)
description: About the job About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day. As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role Revolut People is an all-in-one performance management platform meticulously crafted to meet the HR, Recruitment, and Performance needs of small and medium-sized businesses. We're looking for a product leader who'll be the driving force in elevating our people, tools, and processes to unparalleled excellence. You'll take charge of driving the product strategy and development of Revolut People. It's not just about product management; it's about shaping the future of how our people work, learn, and grow. Your strategic vision will reshape the employee experience, optimize internal processes and propel us towards new heights. What You’ll Be Doing Crafting the strategic vision for our internal tools, with a focus on enhancing the employee experience and optimizing internal processes Leading a cross-functional team of product owners, engineers, designers, and other stakeholders. Taking complete ownership of the product lifecycle – from ideation and development to launch, growth, and ongoing maintenance. Collaborating closely with Design and UX Research teams to ensure the creation of an exceptional user experience, aligning with employee needs and expectations. Working collaboratively with various business functions to align product goals with overall business objectives. What You'll Need 5+ years of proven experience managing entire products or a family of products, preferably in the HR, Performance, or Recruitment tool domain. Demonstrated success in managing people, leading cross-functional teams, and fostering a culture of innovation. Strong product vision and strategy, with a track record of formulating and driving a focused product vision. High analytical acumen with a strong business sense that guides ROI-based prioritisation. Significant experience with Software as a Service (SaaS) and B2B products, ideally in related fields such as HR, Performance, Recruitment tools, or productivity tools. Nice to have STEM degree from a leading university/college. An MBA degree is a plus. Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. Important notice for candidates: Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles. Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain. We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately. By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

title: Senior UX/ UI Product Designer
description: About the job About Us At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration. We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before. We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. About the role As the Senior Product Designer, you will be responsible for the UX/UI across multiple websites, executing a robust UI/UX architecture with a strong focus on the design systems to streamline the design process and promote collaboration and alignment between the product and development teams. This will also involve working very closely with the product Owners and Product Manager to prioritise objectively the goals to ensure business growth, scalability, and excellence in delivery. Your Role and Key Responsibilities: Work closely with Product Owners to define the UX/UI product requirements: user journeys, flows, usability, and designs. Ability to research and analyze markets and competitors, including types of devices and responsiveness, to create solutions that meet UX/UI requirements and goals. Define, plan, and execute a robust UI/UX architecture process for multiple websites on desktop, tablet, and mobile, including dynamic and static features, which also include multiple versions. Define, maintain, and optimise a strong UX/UI design system, with components, style guides, and libraries, which ensures consistency, efficiency, and scalability to ensure complete collaboration within the team and an improved User experience. Provide support to the Product Owners and Developers during the development phase. Including the UX/UI presentation, technical refinement, and QA of the development. Ability to dive deep into both qualitative and quantitative data in order to bring forward new insights that generate product innovations. Communicate UX/UI opportunities, new trends, and innovation to the product team and Product Manager. Requirements 5+ years of experience in UI/UX design in a software or tech-driven environment. Strong portfolio of design projects and UI/UX processes. Bachelor's degree in design, related field, or equivalent professional experience. Solid knowledge of Figma, Illustrator, and Photoshop tools, with attention to detail. Experience in interaction design for devices, typography, color, and page layout. Experience carrying out usability and product research, and the product development lifecycle. Strong organizational skills and experience working with multiple designs and versions in parallel. Familiarity with data analysis and comprehension. Excellent communication skills, a team player with a positive attitude. Problem solver and results-driven, with a can-do attitude. Advanced proficiency in English and Spanish (written and spoken), ideally with experience in international environments. Benefits Top-notch private health insurance — includes dental and psychological services Full-time, permanent contract Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer! Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m) Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!) Enhanced career path designed just for you External training budget Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets Budget for team-building activities We celebrate all company landmarks Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you. Location Our exceptional offices are in Barcelona's Blue Building, right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and will be able to take part in our game competitions. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. The personal data you provide will be used solely to manage your candidacy for the purposes of this position. You can exercise your rights of access, rectification, or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005. Additionally, you can email us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including documentation proving your identity.

title: Senior Manager - Marketing intel

Our clients invest in transformational technologies and scale them across global markets. Our team operates at the intersection of innovation, finance, and growth — and we’re on the lookout for a Snr Manager – Market Intel for their team. This role will be identifying commercial opportunities arising from our cutting-edge research and technology labs. This position will be the critical link between our labs and the business units, providing strategic insights and recommendations to guide successful go-to-market strategies About the Organization Our client is a leading innovation-driven organization that operates at the intersection of advanced research and real-world application. Their team includes top-tier strategists, technologists, and commercial leaders committed to reshaping industries through cutting-edge development. Position Overview Our client is seeking an accomplished Senior Manager – Market Intelligence to serve as a strategic bridge between their R&D labs and commercial business units. This role will be instrumental in identifying and advancing opportunities that arise from frontier technologies, helping to shape go-to-market strategies for innovations with significant commercial potential. Key Responsibilities Gain a deep understanding of the client’s research and innovation pipeline, including technologies in AI, cybersecurity, defence, industrial systems, and advanced materials Conduct comprehensive market and competitive analyses to identify unmet needs, white space opportunities, and future trends Collaborate closely with researchers, scientists, and internal stakeholders to evaluate the commercial viability of early-stage technologies Develop robust business cases, valuation models, and commercialization strategies for selected innovations Identify and recommend suitable commercialization pathways, including licensing, partnerships, or spin-out ventures Advise internal teams on best practices for technology transfer and innovation strategy Experience & Qualifications Minimum of 6-8 years of experience in technology commercialization, product marketing, or innovation strategy A minimum of 3 years’ experience with a top-tier management consulting firm (Like -McKinsey, Bain, or BCG) is mandatory Strong strategic and analytical abilities, with demonstrated skill in simplifying and communicating complex technical content Proven track record in developing business models, assessing market potential, and driving innovation to market Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills across technical and commercial audiences Entrepreneurial mindset and a strong passion for converting innovation into scalable commercial success Bachelor's degree required; advanced qualifications in business, science, engineering, or related fields strongly preferred Proficiency in financial modelling and market analysis techniques Hiring Process 2-3 Interviews with the leadership teams 1 Presentation / Case Study Offer (subject to clearance – takes 3-5 weeks) This is a rare opportunity for a commercially minded strategist to influence the trajectory of high-impact innovation and support the commercialization of technologies with global relevance. Package Tax Free Salary (£100-£115K a year equivalent Tax Free – Same as £200K UK pre-tax Hotel (4 weeks) – Flights out and home once a year for you and family Double 1st months salary (for relocation) 25 days holiday + 14 days public holiday Free Private Healthcare & Dental for you and family Nursery & Education allowance for children (upto 18yrs old) Yearly pay review

title: Product Marketing Manager - 100% remote - Europe
description: About the job Job Description NOTE: This is a FULLY remote role, but the candidate must be within Europe to collaborate with their team, peers, and internal customers. You do not have to be in the specific city shown in this listing, but please only apply if you are physically based within Europe. Hostaway is a SaaS startup that is transforming the vacation rental industry. With innovative solutions and partnerships with giants like Airbnb, VRBO, and Booking, we're taking on the competition and winning. Leveraging our customer-centric core values, we consistently deliver results that encourage growth, learning, and innovation for our team, our customers, and the industry. As a profitable and growing company, this role is necessitated by our continued growth. Check out more about our recent funding round of $365 million here. We are seeking an experienced Product Marketing Manager to help accomplish mission-critical growth goals in the European market. This is a great opportunity to join a fun and dedicated team and make a meaningful contribution in a collaborative work environment and will report directly into the VP of Marketing. About The Role Develop go-to-market plans; including planning, product positioning, value proposition, messaging, related assets and sales enablement, to deliver against outcomes and achieve business goals. Create on-brand, best-in-class content, tailored to target ICP customers, including in-product messaging, website content, landing pages, launch material, emails, training, education materials, etc. Define and execute new product and features launches, including measuring their impact and increasing their adoption. Define and evolve product positioning, branding, and messaging in cooperation with product management, design, data and analytics, sales and other partners across the organization. Enable sales, marketing, support, customer success, and other internal teams to tell a compelling story about our product’s benefits. Create compelling presentations to effectively communicate complex issues to the leadership team and to external stakeholders. Be able to identify ambiguity and work to systematically drive clarity through strategic framing and stakeholder alignment. Conduct thorough market research and competitive analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and threats. Develop a comprehensive understanding of competitor products, pricing, marketing strategies, and sales tactics. Speak to our customers to gain new perspectives and feedback on our products. Build experiments, testing theories, and share learnings with cross-functional teams. Job requirements 3+ years of experience in product marketing, preferably in a B2B SaaS environment. You have experience conducting qualitative and quantitative customer and market research. You have experience across a full lifecycle product marketing strategy and execution. You're a storyteller. You have a proven track record of creating compelling product narratives and applying them in written and visual form. Proven track record of scaling high-impact, multi-channel go-to-market efforts for B2B. You love your customers. You have a passion for understanding customer motivations, behaviours, and needs. You're collaborative. You enjoy working together with your team and cross-functionally to drive stronger outcomes. Fluency in English and at least one of: Spanish, French, or Italian. Strong work ethic and self starter - must be able to juggle multiple projects. What We Offer Competitive Compensation: We offer competitive pay based on market rates in the country of the applicant. 100% Remote: Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere within your country of residence—be it a co-working space, your home office, or even your dining room table. The choice is yours. Just don’t ask to work in our office (we don’t have one). Equity: Every role in our company comes with valuable stock options in a fast-growing and profitable company. This ensures we all share in the company’s success. Values-Driven Leadership: Our Core Values are not just words we’ve written to make us feel good. We leverage them daily when making strategic and tactical decisions. Professional Growth: Our rapid growth offers unparalleled learning and development opportunities, along with a multitude of career advancement opportunities. Annual Paid Leave: The specific amounts vary by country and are aligned with country and/or contract-specific norms. Geographic Specific Benefits: As an international employer, we offer different country-specific benefits such as Health Insurance and Pensions in countries where these perks are customary. The specifics depend on the country of the applicant. Dynamic Team Culture: As a global company with team members in over 40 countries, our diverse and international culture fuels our innovation and creativity, providing a key pillar to our success (and making it a lot of fun to work here). If you apply for this role, you will receive an email from our Talent Acquisition team after your application has been reviewed alongside the qualifications for this role and the qualifications of others who have applied.

title: Technical Product Owner - producto API - scrum - remoto (*M)
description: About the job BETWEEN TECHNOLOGY es una consultora multinacional que cuenta con avanzadas capacidades tecnológicas en el ámbito de la Ingeniería y las TIC. Nuestros servicios llegan a todos los continentes y cubren varios sectores de la economía mundial, de la industria y las empresas de servicios. En la actualidad BETWEEN cuenta con un equipo de 1000 personas trabajando en los ámbitos de la industria del automóvil, Oil&Gas, retail, etc. Ampliamos equipo y seleccionamos un/a Product Owner especializado/a en producto API y con amplia experiencia velando por la entrega continua del Software de valor al negocio, para un proyecto estable e indefinido en el sector retail y en Ecommerce. La persona seleccionada colaborará en un gran proyecto tecnológico bajo metodología ágil, con equipos colaborativos y no jerárquicos, con alto grado de proactividad y responsabilidad. ¿Qué haré? Gestionar y negociar el roadmap con stakeholders de iniciativas propias y demandadas de los productos de Data Privacy y Fraud. Ser el último responsable del backlog del producto. Trabajar en la definición junto al equipo de desarrollo. ¿Cómo lo haré? Trabajarás con el UPO de la unidad o CPO de para conocer las necesidades de tus stakeholders y plantear un roadmap adecuado de los productos del equipo. Con el equipo de desarrollo formado por un TL y desarrolladores. Diseñarás y pensarás nuevas funcionalidades propias del producto que sean de utilidad. Entenderás bien las necesidades que vayan surgiendo de los clientes integradores del servicio y stakeholders. Aplicarás técnicas de priorización y medición de impacto de iniciativas para su negociación. Trabajarás con el equipo de desarrollo para conseguir las mejores soluciones trasladando las necesidades y resolviendo dudas y bloqueos funcionales. Objetivo: Impulsar el producto lo más lejos posible y asegurarse de que su equipo aporte valor al negocio. ¿Cuáles serán mis funciones? Comunicar con las partes interesadas en todos los ámbitos relacionados con producto, incluido el equipo de desarrollo para asegurar que las metas son claras y la visión esté alineada con los objetivos estratégicos de la empresa. Ayudar al equipo a mantener esa visión mediante la creación de una hoja de ruta del producto. Trabajar con la dirección como parte interesada para crear un producto que se adapte a sus objetivos estratégicos. Trabajar en productos internos, identificar y ayudar a los clientes internos a comprender el modelo de negocio y la propuesta de valor. Sopesar las prioridades de acuerdo con las necesidades y los objetivos de las partes interesadas. Jugar siempre con las variables de alcance, presupuesto y tiempo. Con la visión, la estrategia y las prioridades del producto definidas, supervisarás el desarrollo real del producto. Definir métricas de productos y su uso durante el proceso de desarrollo de los mismos. Conocer en profundidad el producto para anticiparse/resolver a problemas o necesidades y buscar soluciones. Servir de voz del usuario, representando siempre sus necesidades e intereses. Para respaldar sus decisiones, deberá medir el éxito del producto con los datos reales del usuario. Entorno de trabajo Agile / Scrum. Requisitos indispensables: Experiencia como Product Manager o Product Owner. Experiencia de producto API: al ser un comercio electrónico construido como una plataforma de microservicio, y algunos de los productos se ofrecen a través de API. Si está familiarizado con la definición de API como un producto y está familiarizado con el enfoque APIFirst, será especialmente bienvenido en algunos productos. Experiencia en entornos de trabajo Agile / Scrum. Experiencia en la toma de decisiones basada en datos. Experiencia en negociación con stakeholders y consumidores. Experiencia trabajando en la orientación a objetivos y resultado. Requisitos Deseables Experiencia en contextos de ecommerce. Experiencia previa trabajando con objetivos y resultados clave (OKRs). Conocimientos de DDD. Además, trabajando para BETWEEN obtendrás los siguientes beneficios añadidos: Formación con BTW University (Idiomas, Power Business School, Udemy, Certificaciones Técnicas, Pharos). Seguro médico gratuito desde el primer día. Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte del salario gracias a la Retribución Flexible. Acceso a descuentos (Viajes, tecnología y más). ¡Cumplir años como Betweener tiene premio! Si estás buscando una nueva oportunidad laboral y crees que tu perfil puede encajar, ¡no dudes en apuntarte!

title: Senior B2C Product Manager
description: About the job Ready to find your perfect job fit? Welcome to HomeBuddy, where making a home awesome is like seeing a vision come to life! We are on a mission to create a friendly and trusted platform to connect homeowners with the right contractors across the US. What started as a small idea has become a fast-growing home improvement platform focusing on lead quality and long-term partnerships based on trust and mutual success. We are a product-first company with a long-term outlook - our platform consistently and positively evolves based on data insights and the most up-to-date tools. This job is for you if You would like to work in a positive atmosphere where teamwork and trust in your colleagues are primary values. You succeed in an environment that values initiative and sharing feedback and where your suggestions and efforts are recognized and appreciated You are used to taking responsibility for solving difficult tasks and are directly involved in how your efforts impact the final result This role is full-time and offers home working flexibility. Your future tasks will include Conducting various analyses to identify product growth opportunities, including funnel analysis, user behavior analysis, and market trend analysis Creating and executing comprehensive, data-driven growth strategies that align with business goals and focus on improving key growth metrics Designing, conducting and analyzing A/B tests and other experiments to validate hypotheses Conducting user research, including surveys, interviews, and usability testing to deeply understand user needs, pain points, and motivations to identify areas for improvement Collaborating with the data department to design measurement frameworks, set hypotheses, and validate features through data analysis Effectively communicating with stakeholders (product teams, business leaders, development team, data engineers, marketing) to ensure alignment. Facilitating planning activities, gathering feedback, and keeping everyone updated. Ensuring transparency through regular communication of progress and delivered outcomes Managing and mitigating the feasibility, profitability, demand, legal, and other non-technical risks Leading solution discovery together with the development team, collaboratively identifying and validating the most effective approaches to address user needs and business goals. Ensuring that solutions are effectively delivered to end users Mentoring and supporting junior and middle product managers, sharing best practices and fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning You're going to need this to be successful in this role At least 3+ years of experience in Growth Product Management or 5+ years of experience in Product Management in B2C products. Experience with marketplaces is a strong plus Proven track record of driving growth and positively impacting key business metrics through product initiatives and experimentation. Experience with acquisition, activation and monetization is a strong plus Experience designing and running experiments, and analyzing data to make informed product decisions. Hands-on A/B testing experience is a must Deep understanding of user research methodologies (such as surveys, interviews, usability testing, and customer journey mapping) and the ability to translate insights into actionable improvements Skills to perform exploratory data analysis, data mining, and statistical analysis, or at least the ability to ask meaningful questions about data and effectively formulate tasks for data analysts Technical proficiency at the level required for effective communication with software developers and data engineers Excellent storytelling, presentation, and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to clearly articulate ideas, strategies, and results to both technical and non-technical audiences Knowledge of Agile practices and the ability to mentor others in Agile methodologies Ability to think and work independently, with attention to detail Excellent verbal & written English communication skills (at least C1) Why choose HomeBuddy Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere without being tied to one place - while ensuring you are available to our team during the agreed working hours Achieve a harmonious work-life balance with a flexible schedule tailored to your local needs, along with paid vacation, sick leave, and local holidays Empower yourself with work equipment of your choice partially paid for by HomeBuddy and up-to-date apps and tools to maximise your productivity Feel valued and appreciated with an industry-leading compensation package Get recognized and rewarded for both outstanding individual efforts leading to extraordinary results and our team success. Enhance your well-being with our allowance program covering fitness activities and mental health programs Learn and expand your knowledge by both working on complex tasks and using paid training opportunities, including courses, events, and conferences If this sounds like you, we should talk! By sending us your application you agree that Siren Group AG (known as HomeBuddy) will process your personal data to participate in this recruitment process. If you want to know more about how Siren Group AG processes your personal data please click here.

title: Product Marketing Manager (Part-Time - Freelance)
description: About the job Location: Remote Commitment: 10-20 hours/week Start Date: Immediate Contract: Initial 3-month freelance trial (with potential to convert to full-time, long-term role) About Jobgether Jobgether is reinventing the job search for the remote-first world. Our AI-powered platform connects global talent with remote opportunities, helping people find meaningful work through better job matching and career coaching. The role We're looking for a hands-on Product Marketing Manager (PMM) to lead the go-to-market strategy for our new B2C product: Career Coach. This role combines product sense with growth marketing execution, ideal for someone who understands the technical side of SaaS and knows how to turn a product into a movement. You'll work closely with the founders and tech team to boost awareness, drive engagement, and convert free users into paying customers. This is a 3-month freelance role to start, but it's designed as a trial period with the intent to extend into a full-time, long-term position if we're a good fit on both sides (optional). Your mission Own and execute the go-to-market strategy for Career Coach Increase Premium conversion by improving messaging, in-product positioning, and user flow Analyze and optimize the full user funnel, from landing to activation to conversion Identify friction points in the UX and fix it Design and run A/B tests to validate messaging, onboarding, and feature adoption Set up and monitor key metrics using product analytics tools (e.g., Mixpanel, GA) Build and engage communities across Reddit, LinkedIn, Discord, X, and niche remote forums Write compelling content: newsletter, posts, replies, and prompts for social AI tools Run messaging experiments and continuously iterate based on user feedback Identify visibility hacks, and relevant partnerships Move fast: test, learn, and double down on what works Requirements Proven experience in product marketing and product growth (ideally in B2C SaaS) Strong understanding of conversion funnels, UX principles, and data-informed iteration Hands-on experience with tools like Mixpanel, GA, Amplitude, or similar Ability to break down complex product flows and propose simple, high-impact improvements Experience driving community engagement and grassroots awareness campaigns Technical fluency: you're comfortable working with product and dev teams Lean, startup mindset: autonomous, creative, action-oriented Bonus: interest in career development, job search tools, or the remote work ecosystem Benefits Work directly with the founders and shape a product with real social impact Fully remote, async, and flexible Flat hierarchy, fast decision-making, and freedom to take initiative If it's a fit, this role can grow into a full-time, long-term position (if you want)

title: Product Manager - AI & Intelligent Automation
description: About the job Product Manager, AI & Intelligent Automation Location: Remote, local to regional Keyrock hub locations About Keyrock Since our beginnings in 2017, we've grown to be a leading change-maker in the digital asset space, renowned for our partnerships and innovation. Today, we partner with over 180 team members around the world. Our diverse team hails from 42 nationalities, with backgrounds ranging from self-taught DeFi natives to PhDs. Predominantly remote, we have hubs in London, Brussels, and Singapore, and host regular online and offline hangouts to keep the crew tight. We are trading on more than 80 exchanges, and working with a wide array of asset issuers. As a well-established market maker, our distinctive expertise led us to expand rapidly. Today, our services span market making, options trading, high-frequency trading, OTC, and DeFi trading desks. But we’re more than a service provider. We’re an initiator. We're pioneers in adopting the Rust Development language for our algorithmic trading, and champions of its use in the industry. We support the growth of Web3 startups through our Accelerator Program. We upgrade ecosystems by injecting liquidity into promising DeFi, RWA, and NFT protocols. And we push the industry's progress with our research and governance initiatives. At Keyrock, we're not just envisioning the future of digital assets. We're actively building it. Mission statement We are looking for a dedicated, technically experienced Product Manager to join our growing team, focused on pioneering the integration of AI and intelligent automation within our core operations and strategic initiatives. This role is pivotal in shaping how we augment human capabilities with AI, driving significant advancements in productivity, efficiency, and decision-making across the organization. You'll be responsible for identifying, developing, and launching innovative AI-powered solutions that directly impact our market-making activities, risk management, and operational processes. This includes, but is not limited to, leveraging LLMs and other relevant AI/ML technologies, Multi-Agent Coordination and Planning (MCP), and advanced data analytics (e.g. towards context engineering), to create tools and systems that empower our teams, to automate and accelerate value creation. Keyrock Product Managers are responsible for developing valuable and viable systems (& implicit services) that consider the voices of Business & Commercial teams, Trading & Research teams, And Engineering builders. In this way, a level of ‘trilingual’ competency - to be able to perform just enough research - is required for the role. Responsibilities Product Strategy & Vision: Define and articulate the product vision, strategy, and a roadmap for AI and intelligent automation initiatives, aligning with Keyrock's overall business objectives and technology strategy. AI Application & Automation: Drive the practical application of AI by identifying key use cases and working closely with engineering teams to integrate LLMs, MCP, and other state-of-the-art automation technologies into existing and new products, after prioritising. Technology Integration: Oversee the end-to-end integration of AI models and tools into Keyrock's existing technological ecosystem, ensuring seamless operation, scalability, and maintainability, through use case definition, documentation, and driving QA. Financial Context & Time Series Data: Leverage your understanding of financial markets and expertise in time series data manipulation to identify opportunities for AI to enhance trading strategies, risk prediction, and operational insights. Human-AI Teaming & Productivity: Champion a vision for accelerating human-AI collaborative intelligence applications. This involves discovering & designing products that enhance teams’ decision-making, automate repetitive tasks, and create efficient and valuable workflows between human operators and intelligent systems. Process & Capability Shaping: Actively shape organizational processes, standards, and capabilities related to AI development and deployment. This includes defining, promoting, and iterating best practices for data governance, model validation, and responsible AI usage, in conjunction with governance teams for relevant areas. Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams including Commercial, Trading, Research, Engineering, Operations, and Compliance to discover opportunities, gather requirements, define product specifications (with Engineering), and ensure successful product delivery that complies with the needs of regulatory and control functions. Market & Technology Research: Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, data engineering, and automation, identifying emerging technologies and trends that can be leveraged to create competitive advantages. Performance & Impact Measurement: Define key metrics and KPIs to measure the success and impact of AI-powered products, iterating based on data and feedback. Be able to identify why one piece of work is prioritised over another through (simple) models of impact. Essentials Experienced Product Leader: 5+ years of product management experience, with a proven track record of successfully launching and scaling complex technology products. AI/ML Expertise: Demonstrated experience with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, with a particular emphasis on practical application of LLMs, MCP, and other advanced automation paradigms. Relevant portfolios welcome. Technical Acumen & Data Engineering: Strong technical understanding of software development, data architectures, and API integrations. “Just enough” level of experience in data engineering, including building and maintaining data pipelines, is highly valued. Ability to engage in technical discussions with engineering teams. Financial Domain Exposure: Prior exposure to financial contexts, market data, and time series data manipulation is highly desirable. Experience in fintech, trading, or quantitative finance is a significant plus. Strategic & Pragmatic Thinker: Ability to articulate a clear product vision and translate it into actionable strategies and roadmaps, starting from simple, fast, proofs of concept. Process & Organisational Design: A strong desire to influence and shape organisational processes and capabilities, driving the adoption of new technologies and ways of working. Collaborative & Communicative: Excellent communication, interpersonal, and stakeholder management skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, highly collaborative environment. Problem Solver: Analytical and data-driven approach to problem-solving, with a keen eye for identifying opportunities for automation and efficiency. Entrepreneurial Spirit: Self-starter with a proactive and innovative mindset, comfortable operating in a dynamic and evolving industry. Beneficial experience 3+ years experience working in a financial services context Strong grasp of the technologies underpinning recent AI developments An existing portfolio of AI-centric productivity solutions An existing portfolio of product prototypes, with rationale of value for each Exposure to digital assets, financial trading industry, or financial services contexts. Hiring process People & Talent team screening call Hiring Manager Interview Recruitment Challenge Final Interview)s) (1-2) with (an) executive stakeholder(s) Our recruitment philosophy We value self-awareness in our recruitment process. We seek people who understand themselves and their career goals. We're after those with the right skills and a conscious choice to join our field. The perfect fit? A crypto enthusiast who’s driven, collaborative, and delivers solid, scalable outcomes. Why Keyrock? Be at the forefront of innovation in digital assets and AI. Work on challenging problems with a direct impact on the business. A competitive salary package, with various benefits depending on the method of engagement (employee or freelancer). Autonomy in your time management thanks to flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely The freedom to create your own entrepreneurial experience by being part of a team of people in search of excellence As an employer we are committed to build an inclusive, diverse and non-discriminating work environment. We welcome employees of all backgrounds, ethnicities, genders, creed and sexual orientation. We hire, reward and promote entirely based on merit and performance. Due to the nature of our business and external requirements, we perform background checks on all potential employees, passing which is a prerequisite to join Keyrock.

title: Online Program Manager
description: About the job About Us: The International Trading Institute is a pioneering institution dedicated to providing world-class education in trading and financial markets. Our mission is to equip the next generation of traders with the knowledge, practical skill, emotional grounding and ethical code they need to excel in the global trading marketplace. As a startup business school, we are looking for dynamic and innovative individuals to join our team and help us grow. Position Overview: Do you have experience in customer care and enjoy helping others? Are you looking to have a fundamental impact on an organization? Do you have good communications skills? Do you thrive in a small, high energy, entrepreneurial environment? If any of these resonated with you, then the Program Manager role might be a great fit for you. We are seeking a Program Manager person to interact with prospective students and provide information about our Masters in Trading program, and to then support students once they’ve enrolled in the program, ensuring their needs are met throughout their academic journey. The Program Manager will also liaise with faculty to remind them of deadlines, collect academic materials and assist with their publication on our LMS system, and monitor that grading and general course administration is completed in a timely manner. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills and a strong client-centric approach. This position offers the opportunity to facilitate the success of a pioneering institution. Key Responsibilities: Pre-Enrollment: Provide prospective students with detailed information about the Masters in Trading program, including curriculum, faculty, and career prospects. Respond to inquiries via phone, email, and live chat in a timely and professional manner. Help potential students to understand the application process, including guidance on prerequisites and admissions requirements. Identify and qualify leads to drive program enrollment. Maintain accurate records of interactions with prospective students. Collaborate with the marketing team to provide insights for blog posts, articles, or social media related to the student experience. Post-Enrollment: Serve as the primary point of contact for students enrolled in the Masters in Trading program. Support students throughout their academic journey, addressing questions or concerns related to their courses, schedules, or any other program-related issues by providing necessary information on academic resources, program expectations, etc. Organize and schedule meeting times with mentors and students for our student Mentoring Pods, as well as individual mentoring sessions. Act as a liaison between students and the admissions team or academic staff to monitor student progress and satisfaction with the Master course, ensuring student concerns are addressed early and in a timely manner. Provide ongoing communication to keep students informed about events, deadlines, and updates related to the program. Liaise with faculty to remind them of deadlines, collect academic materials and assist with their publication on our LMS system Work with faculty to ensure that grading and general course administration is completed in a timely manner. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Client-focused with the ability to build relationships and trust with prospective and current students. Ability to work independently and manage multiple inquiries and tasks simultaneously. Proficient in MS Office & Google docs, CRM software and LMS systems (Moodle). Prior experience in customer care, sales, student services, and academic administration preferred. Trading experience preferred. Why Join Us: Opportunity to play a pivotal role in the development of a cutting-edge trading program. Collaborative and entrepreneurial work environment. The chance to make a significant impact in the field of trading education. · This position is eligible for remote work and our Barcelona based employees work from home 4 days a week and have flexibility with their work hours · Paid vacation plus holidays and personal time off How to Apply: Interested candidates should submit a CV / resume and cover letter to julie@internationaltradinginstitute.com

title: Global Product Director, Product-Led Growth (100% remote friendly from Spain)
description: About the job Welcome to the good side of tech 👋 You might have heard about us, but with a different name: DocPlanner, Doctoralia, Znanylekarz... It all started 10 years ago when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: wanna join us in the next step of the company's history: Making people longer & healthier lives? We're coupling the latest advances in AI & LLMs to the power of the network effects of our Marketplace to transform how people approach healthcare. Docplanner at scale We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. 210,000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 3.500 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup mindset we started with over 10 years ago. And why should you join us? Because it feels good to tell your family and your friends how you made the world a little bit better. You go to bed knowing that what you do matters, and that your talents align with your beliefs. We want to make people live longer & healthier lives, and that starts with you being you. We believe that taking the diversity of human experience into account makes a better healthcare experience for all. We’re not just different: we embrace diversity. We will encourage you to come to work your whole self, and that includes not coming to the office at all if you prefer not to, as we're 100% remote-friendly. Job Description Docplanner serves thousands of customers, each with unique needs and aspirations. The area you will lead focuses on maximizing the reach of our offerings, ensuring they are delivered to the right customers, in the right context, with minimal effort required on their end. Our Product-Led Growth (PLG) teams focus on building self-serve experiences that drive engagement and scalable growth. They collaborate with Marketing, Customer Success, and other Product domains to better understand our ideal customer profiles and engage them effectively, whether by increasing awareness, improving onboarding, or aligning pricing with perceived value. PLG covers pricing, packaging, free to premium conversion, and self-serve flows, all key levers in our growth strategy. We are looking for a Product Director, PLG to lead these efforts, build strategy for both doctors and clinics, and manage talented product teams. This remote-friendly role, based in Spain or Poland, reports to our CTPO (Chief Technology & Product Officer) and plays a critical role in scaling Docplanner’s growth through product excellence. Your expertise in building a data-driven and business-minded product culture while delivering fast and safe iterations, knowing when to go for PoCs versus robust solutions, will be key to driving growth based on business appetite and product maturity. What We Expect From This Position Inspire, lead, and shape a strong PLG product vision across all relevant product teams Navigate a complex ecosystem where acquisition, upsell, and cross-sell strategies vary widely across customer segments (individuals, SMBs, enterprise) Define with PMs the strategy of each team, ensuring alignment with the overall Docplanner Tech and Product strategy Establish a shared vision and strong collaboration with key business stakeholders, including Sales, Operations, and Marketing Ensure that upcoming product needs and opportunities are aligned with your Engineering Director to develop a coherent Product and Tech strategy and roadmap Champion a hands-on, insight-driven approach to innovation by combining data, market listening, and direct user research Build a decision-making culture grounded in analysis, insight, and measurable outcomes Work closely with other Global Product Directors to turn objectives into clear indicators and actions, driving transparency and impact across the company Qualifications Minimum 3 years of experience as a Product Director Ideally, experience in SaaS, e-commerce, marketplace, and pricing or packaging environments Proven success in fast-paced, high-growth environments with strong exposure to change management and business scaling A proven track record of delivering significant success, scaling, and developing high-performing digital products that impact business and delight customers, especially in packaging, monetization, product marketing, and PLG at large scale Deep understanding of the end-to-end product development lifecycle with experience in agile and lean software development practices Entrepreneurial mindset with excellent organizational, communication, and leadership skills Strong business acumen beyond core product management with the ability to assess product–market fit and contribute to broader company strategy Sharp analytical thinking and strong problem-solving skills Hands-on approach. At Docplanner, leadership means rolling up your sleeves and diving into the details of challenges, opportunities, and solutions Experience in healthcare is a plus, not a must Additional Information Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings; Share options plan after 6 months of working with us. True flexibility and work-life balance Remote or hybrid work model with our hub in Barcelona; Flexible working hours (fully flexible, as in most cases you only have to be on a couple of meetings weekly); Summer intensive schedule during July and August (work 7 hours, finish earlier); 23 paid holidays, with exchangeable local bank holidays; Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate). Health comes first Private healthcare plan with Adeslas for you and subsidized for your family (medical and dental); Access to hundreds of gyms for a symbolic fee in partnership for you and your family with Wellhub; Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling. We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you’re reading, there’s a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we’re lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you’ve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other. “We believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.” Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

title: Marketing Program Associate-Product Led Growth
description: About the job Elastic, the Search AI Company, enables everyone to find the answers they need in real time, using all their data, at scale — unleashing the potential of businesses and people. The Elastic Search AI Platform, used by more than 50% of the Fortune 500, brings together the precision of search and the intelligence of AI to enable everyone to accelerate the results that matter. By taking advantage of all structured and unstructured data — securing and protecting private information more effectively — Elastic’s complete, cloud-based solutions for search, security, and observability help organizations deliver on the promise of AI. What Is The Role We’re seeking a highly organized and diligent Marketing Program Associate to support the Self-Service Cloud (SSC) Go-To-Market team. You will collaborate closely with the SSC Program Lead to help complete integrated marketing initiatives that drive adoption and engagement across our Hosted and Serverless Cloud offerings. This position is ideal for someone with a great foundation in asset development, email marketing, and program coordination. This role will require the successful candidate to be able to work US East Coast business hours. What You Will Be Doing Email Marketing & Onboarding Support Collaborate with design and marketing operations to ensure email journeys are clear, effective, and conversion-oriented. Handle version control and coordinate changes from team members. Monitor email performance and suggest content improvements to enhance user engagement. Campaign & Content Support Provide content support for SSC campaigns including solution- and cloud-specific landing pages, email nurtures, and other assets. Align with brand tone and messaging guidelines to ensure consistency across all deliverables. Work cross-functionally with product marketing and creative teams to develop and review campaign content. Program Management Own and manage the marketing plan for interactive content Coordinate with product marketing and other content teams to source new material, update existing assets, and ensure timely publication. Coordinate the integration of Instruqt content into the website and ensure proper cross-linking across relevant pages and campaigns. Coordinate social campaigns by sourcing assets and collaborating with the social team. Chatbot management and maintenance Maintain the chatbot content and version control Coordinate with vendors to execute the chatbot Monitor performance and troubleshoot by using crossfunctional teams Resourcing & Operational Support Help assess resourcing needs for content and creative requests across SSC GTM campaigns. Track requests and timelines to ensure timely delivery of marketing assets. Provide regular status updates and surface blockers to the campaign lead. What You Bring 2–4 years of experience in marketing, content production, or campaign execution supporting Product Led growth strategies. Excellent writing and editing skills with a strong attention to detail. Experience with email marketing platforms and basic knowledge of email journey creation. Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills. Familiarity with cloud or developer-focused technologies is a plus. Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do. We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do. title: Site Manager

Los momentos compartidos nos permiten crear lazos fuertes y conocernos mejor, lo que fortalece el espíritu de equipo (nos gusta disfrutar de estos momentos tanto dentro como fuera del trabajo) 🤝🥳 Porque tenemos un mix de culturas con integrantes de diversos países del mundo 🌏, por lo que priorizamos la armonía y el respeto mutuo. Debes monitorizar el alcance, coste y tiempo con la calidad, seguridad y relación con el cliente. ✅ Para cumplir con este objetivo debes: Estudiar los proyecto a ejecutar, características específicas, Manual de Montaje. Organizar la ejecución de los trabajos, especialmente focalizado en alcance, coste y plazos del proyecto Realizar seguimiento, control de la Producción y la Calidad del proyecto Colaborar activamente en medidas y mejoras en materias de Seguridad y Salud asi como en lecciones aprendidas. Informar y/o sugerir mejoras durante el proceso de instalación. ✅ ¿Qué debes tener para poder como Site Manager? Grado en Ingeniería civil, mecánica, industriales, caminos o arquitectura. Deseable formación en Gestión de Proyectos. Conocimientos y experiencia mínima de 3 años en las funciones descritas. Si es en el mismo sector, sería ideal! Tener disponibilidad para realizar desplazamientos constantes tanto dentro como fuera de España para estar in situ en nuestros proyectos.

title: Candidatura espontánea - BBVA (Finance, Business, IT, Engineering, Marketing, HR)
description: About the job Esta posición forma parte del equipo de BBVA, grupo financiero global con enfoque en innovación y sostenibilidad. Resumen de la oportunidad según Joinrs AI: BBVA busca candidatos para contrato indefinido o temporal en áreas como finanzas, tecnología, recursos humanos y más, valorando motivación y compromiso. El candidato contribuirá al desarrollo de la banca digital y sostenible. Ofertas entorno internacional, formación continua, igualdad, equilibrio vida-trabajo y proyectos de impacto. El proceso de selección será gestionado completamente por parte de BBVA. --- ¿Quiénes somos? BBVA (Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria) es uno de los principales grupos financieros a nivel global, con más de 170 años de historia y presencia en más de 25 países. Con sede central en España, BBVA atiende a más de 70 millones de clientes en Europa, América Latina, Turquía y Estados Unidos, ofreciendo servicios financieros innovadores y sostenibles en banca minorista, corporativa, de inversión y gestión de activos. En BBVA apostamos por un modelo de banca centrado en el cliente, impulsado por la digitalización y guiado por la sostenibilidad. En 2023, BBVA fue reconocido por S&P Global como uno de los bancos más sostenibles del mundo, y mantiene una sólida estrategia alineada con los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible (ODS) de la ONU. ¿Por qué postularte? Unirte a BBVA significa formar parte de una organización global en constante transformación, que prioriza a las personas y promueve un entorno de trabajo inclusivo, flexible y con oportunidades reales de crecimiento. Ofrecemos: Un entorno internacional, diverso y colaborativo Formación continua y desarrollo profesional personalizado Liderazgo en innovación digital y banca sostenible Políticas de igualdad y equilibrio entre vida personal y profesional Proyectos con impacto real en la sociedad y en el futuro del planeta En BBVA creemos en el talento como motor de cambio. Buscamos personas con visión, curiosidad y pasión por marcar la diferencia. Nuestros valores En BBVA nos guiamos por tres principios fundamentales: El cliente es lo primero: actuamos con empatía y responsabilidad para aportar valor real. Pensamos en grande: nos retamos constantemente para innovar y generar impacto positivo. Somos un solo equipo: colaboramos con humildad, respeto y confianza, fomentando el talento colectivo. Estos valores no son solo palabras: son la base de nuestra cultura y de cada decisión que tomamos. ¿A quién buscamos? Si compartes nuestra visión y quieres contribuir al desarrollo de una banca más humana, responsable y digital, te invitamos a enviarnos tu candidatura espontánea. En BBVA buscamos personas motivadas y comprometidas, interesadas en contribuir en distintas áreas del Grupo, como banca digital, riesgos, finanzas, sostenibilidad, tecnología, ciberseguridad, recursos humanos, análisis de datos y muchas más.

title: SP Product Manager
description: About the job Who We Are: Sailun Group (https://en.sailungroup.com/) is one of the world's leading rubber technology and tyre companies. Being the 10th largest manufacturer in the world, Sailun Group is offering a broad portfolio of passenger car, truck and bus as well as specialty tyres. The brand Sailun is the fastest growing tyre brand globally (2023) and among the Top Ten in sustainability perception. Smart manufacturing ensuring superior product quality, emotional brand building and passionate people are the key drivers for Sailun’s success story today and in the future. Sailun Group’s products are available in more than 180 markets and regions in the Americas, Europe, Asia and Africa. With over 18,000 dedicated talents, we are heading to extend our operating footprints in the major markets to best serve the local customer needs, and aspiring to become the leader of the local market. Position Overview: As a SP Product Manager at Sailun Group, you will play a crucial role in the lifecycle of our SP tyre products, from initial feasibility analysis to market release and performance evaluation. Your expertise will help ensure that our products meet market demands and maintain a competitive edge. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate across various departments. Key Responsibilities: Market Analysis and Feasibility Reporting: Conduct comprehensive feasibility analyses for new product development, assessing market demand and potential. Prepare detailed reports on market trends and future product opportunities. Quality Supervision and Feedback Management: Monitor and analyze product performance in the market. Address and resolve feedback and issues related to product quality and market usage. Technical Specifications and Market Promotion: Develop and release technical specifications and standards for new products. Plan and execute information release and market promotion strategies for new products. Technical Management of Test Tyres: Oversee the technical aspects of test tyres within the company. Ensure testing protocols and standards are adhered to and analyzed for product improvement. Industry Information and Research Development: Gather and analyze the latest industry information to guide future research and development. Identify trends and opportunities in the replacement tyre market. Competitive Analysis and Performance Comparison: Collect and analyze data on industry competitors. Develop and implement performance comparison plans between our products and competitors. Provide detailed analysis and reports to maintain our competitive advantage. Budget Preparation and Financial Oversight: Contribute to the preparation of the annual product research and development budget. Monitor and control budget expenditures to ensure financial efficiency. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, or a related field; Master's degree preferred. Proven experience as a Specialty Product Manager in the tyre or automotive industry. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret market data and trends. Excellent project management and organizational skills. Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams. Strong communication and presentation skills. Proficiency in relevant software and tools for product management and market analysis. What We Can Offer: A platform to raise your innovative ideas and bring them into realization, make your mark in the tyre industry and beyond; Being part of a rapidly growing company which strives for further success worldwide; Being immersed in a people-oriented culture built on trust and respect; Being part of a diverse, fun, high-spirited and empowered team and interacting with counterparts from other regions internationally and colleagues from varied disciplines; A commitment to train and develop you continuously throughout your career; A career path that allows you to demonstrate your full potential; Competitive compensation and benefits package and non-financial recognition to reward your dedication and achievements.

title: Underwriting & Product Lead
description: About the job Are you looking for a new challenge? Fancy helping us shape the future of motor insurance? Prima could be the place for you. Since 2015, we’ve been using our love of data and tech to rethink motor insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we’ve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we’re trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we’re expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain. To help fuel that growth, we need an Underwriting & Product Lead to join our Pricing & Underwriting team. This team is the strategic engine behind Prima’s growth. As part of this team, you’ll play a key role in shaping our business strategy and driving innovation. By combining advanced analytics and machine learning, you’ll help keep our pricing competitive and our risk under control. You’ll work at the intersection of data science and real-world impact, collaborating with cross-functional teams to turn insights into action. Excited to make an impact? Here are the details 🎯 Your Mission: Bridge data, risk, and innovation — driving underwriting excellence and strong antifraud solutions that protect our business while delighting customers. What You'll Do Own Underwriting Excellence –Optimize underwriting processes and risk selection criteria using data-driven insights, while refining portfolio strategies with Data Scientists. Unlock Data Innovation – Identify and integrate external data sources, negotiate strategic partnerships, and quantify their impact with the support of Data scientists to boost underwriting sophistication. Shape Winning Insurance Products – Design competitive coverages that balance risk, customer needs, and profitability—aligned with carriers and regulations. Outsmart Fraud – Develop antifraud tools and processes with Claims and Engineering, staying ahead of threats through constant cross-functional collaboration. What We're Looking For Insurance expertise – Proven experience in insurance (motor insurance is a must, ideally with an understanding of underwriting, risk, and antifraud strategies. Problem-Solver with Hybrid Expertise – Experience in motor insurance and consulting, or business transformation (e.g., process optimization). Project Leadership – Proven track record in managing cross-functional initiatives. Self-starter attitude – You take ownership, thrive in ambiguity, and make things happen—no hand-holding needed. Analytical powerhouse – Strong problem-solving skills and a data-driven mindset to turn insights into action. Entrepreneurial spirit – You love fast-paced environments, experimenting with new ideas, and collaborating across teams to drive impact. Fluent English – Clear communication is key in our global team. Nice-to-Have Exposure to underwriting/antifraud processes. Experience with data tools (Power BI, Tableau, SAS) and coding (SQL, Python). Experience working with Product/Tech teams or in startups. Why You’ll Love It Here We want to make Prima a happy and empowering place to work. So if you decide to join us, you can expect plenty of perks. 🤸 Work Your Way: Enjoy full flexibility – work from home, the office or a mix of both. Plus, work from anywhere for up to 30 days a year. 🏁 Grow with us: We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. Get access to learning resources, mentorship and a growth plan tailored to you. 🌈 Thrive and perform: Your best work begins when you feel your best. Enjoy private healthcare, gym discounts, wellbeing programs and mental health support. Think you’re a match? Apply now. At Prima, we celebrate uniqueness. If you don’t meet every requirement but are passionate about this role, we still want to hear from you. Innovation thrives on diverse perspectives. Prima is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Need accommodations during the process? Email us at talent.acquisition@prima.it. Let’s build the future of insurance, together.
